description:
I finally took it upon myself to try Super Duper.  I've been to this particular location, thus far, twice.  The first time, I ordered a large chocolate-dipped cone and the second time, I ordered a burger and garlic fries.

Facts:

* The employees here are friendly, and the ordering process is pretty simple.  You will be asked by them if it's your first visit.  If so, they'll explain the ordering process to you.

* Given its location at Mission and Spear, near many office buildings in the FiDi, the line is usually out the door around lunchtime.  Get here around 11:30 if you want to get in and out quickly.

* After you place your order, you'll be given a pager which will go off once your order is ready.

My chocolate-dipped cone was excellent.  Definitely make sure to have plenty of napkins with you.  You'll thank me later.

The burger was, sadly, a little flavorless.  However, I'm willing to concede that I screwed up by ordering it well done (only did this because undercooked ground beef gives me an upset stomach) and because I ordered it without the eponymous super sauce.  Parts of the burger had burnt edges.  Next time, I won't make the same mistake.  The garlic fries were great.  I'd like to see Super Duper open up shop to sell garlic fries (and other stuff too) at AT&T Park.  They'd probably put the other places that sell garlic fries there out of business.

The pricing isn't the cheapest out there, but it's San Francisco.  Will I be back again?  I don't see why not.

4 stars
author: Michael F.

description:
San Francisco's local go to really good burger joint. 

Best Burger in the area. Previously, this area was a waste land of sad, dead dreams and missed opportunities when it came to the burger. 

Hopefully they will open a second location in the same block or the line will be an hour long. No matter the wait the quality is always amazing.

There is nothing anywhere around here that has the freshness, juiciness and overall consistent food quality this joint provides. Don't forget that at the same time they always deliver friendly and courteous service.

Get the Double Bacon Cheeseburger with an egg on top! The amount of juice from the meat mixes so well with the consistency of the egg. Every spot I've had this at its always perfect. Always!

I come here too often and it's embarrassing.
author: Justin S.

description:
I've made several trips to Super Duper Burgers for lunch and once for breakfast.
Top of the list - the burgers. The burgers are cooked to perfection. If you want well done or rare, let them know. The cooks do it perfectly every time. And the burgers taste like they are made with quality, fresh beef.
The wait - Sure there's a line out the door every day, but with 3 registers going full tilt, the wait is not bad. There's a sign outside that says "5 to 8 minutes" and I waited exactly 5 minutes. Maybe it would take 8 if there are only 2 registers open. Then you have to wait a few minutes while they cook your burger. That's a good thing. You know it was made fresh when you ordered it.
3rd - I have to tell you about this Sir Kensington's ketchup. I order a side of fries every time because I love this ketchup. My grandmother was a big-time gardener and she cooked her own recipe of ketchup. I have never found any ketchup that was even close to her home-made recipe... until now. This Sir Kensington's ketchup is not like the super-processed stuff that you get in an ordinary grocery store. It remind me of home-made ketchup. I hope you like it too.
author: Marvin M.

description: Their burgers are great. I specially love their pickles: the cones are also awesome and if you can go there for a happy hour the tangerine beer is tasty!
author: Jay G.

description: My second visit to Super Duper, only because I live out of town, otherwise I would be here more often... their burgers are thick and big! Very juicy, not greasy. A meal in a bun! The fries are perfect!!! Cooked o side, not mushy, golden brown, crisp on the outside but not hard. Choice of dipping sauces, plus ketchup. They have Dill pickles that are crisp, flavorful and you get about 3 to 4 slices. Their Milkshakes, Malts, are thick! Flavorful and in TALL glasses. So, grab yourself LOTS of napkins. Sit inside, or outside at picnic style benches and enjoy!!
author: Diane V.

description:
Wow.  I wasn't expecting much when I was looking for a burger place in downtown SF.   However we took a chance and im sure glad we did.   The place was packed even after the normal lunch hour.   We got there around 2 and still had to wait a bit in line.  They have wine and beer on tap at very reasonable prices.   Since I was on vacation i had a glass of Pinot Noir and it was good for its price.  The tap probably kept it fresh.   The burger is a smashed flat top style.  Crunchy outside and thinish.   Singles or doubles are avail.  As you can see by the picture I had a double.   I'm sure they use 80/20 or similar.  The burger was very juicy but in very good way that makes you use a napkin and keep diving in.  My son and I both agreed it was an excellent burger.  There are a ton of topping options.  We also combo'd our meal with fries.   The fries were very good as well.  Thicker than an In-N-Out but just as crunchy.   The ketchup and mustard tasted more homemade than from a commercial source.    Great tomato flavor that shined through.     
All in all- we will be back to SDB.  It truly was a super duper burger.
author: Doug S.

description: Went to this burger place during my 8 hr layover in SF, recommended by my friend. I got mini burger combo and the size was perfect for me. Meat was super juicy and the special sauce inside was really good too. French fries were good, nothing special. I would recommend my friends to stop by at this place if they want to visit a good local burger shop in SF.
author: Shirley S.

description: Legit. Juiciest burger I've had in a long while. Perfectly cooked to medium rare. Everything fresh. Highly recommend.
author: Offset M.

description:
There's something about Super Duper that everytime I go visit them, I'm always excited!  Anyways, with May being National Burger Month, why not review one of SF's best burgers?

I'm so glad that there's a Super Duper near my work.  It was only a matter of time for me to finally have a burger.  And it was delicious!  

Super Burger with Garlic Fries -- http://bit.ly/2Ixi03U
Yeah, this burger is just too good.  Still as good if not better than when I had them a long while back at Metreon's location.  I usually prefer to have my burgers medium rare but with Super Duper I'll make that exception.  It's amazing how juicy it is for a medium well burger.  Plus, their Parmesan garlic fries are still epic!

It's also been a great stop for breakfast.  I've had their Egg Sandwich twice, once with Bacon & Avocado (http://bit.ly/2f3428C), and once with Sausage (http://bit.ly/2IRsbj8).  Both are really solid sandwiches and very filling.  Great way to start the day!

But the biggest surprise for me has been Super Duper's Housemade Mini Donuts.  They're OMGYUM amazing!!!
Housemade Mini Donuts -- http://bit.ly/2IXVAIC
I had these donuts for the first time just recently and now I'm hooked!  They're the perfect size and they have a great light crisp outside and soft chew inside which is expected since they're made hot and fresh.  They're just perfect!

So yeah!  This third location of Super Duper that I've experienced has earned a solid 5 stars from me.  For their epic burgers, crazy good parmesan garlic fries, and perfect mini donuts!

Happy National Burger Month!!
author: Rodney H.

description:
A somewhat compact but still dependable outpost of a solid local burger chain. This outlet is conveniently located for the SoMa office crowd and is open fairly early in the morning, when they serve egg sandwiches and donuts, and for the rest of the day well into the evening, when they serve their namesake burgers.

Service is efficient and professional despite the constant onslaught of customers, and there is a fair number of seats both inside and outside. Satisfying and dependable in every way.
author: Vincent L.

description:
For dinner I had a super burger ($8.25) with cheese ($0.75) and a side of garlic fries ($3.5). The burger itself, a simple endeavor without excessive garnish, seemed nonetheless well-executed. The lettuce and tomato seemed quite fresh, and the patties held their flavor and juices well. 

The garlic fries seemed a touch light on garlic, but that remains a personal nitpick. I do wish the cheese had not clumped into the center of the fries.
author: Justin S.

description:
Having tried many of the major burger joints, Super Duper was one that has been on my "to try hamburger" list.  Needing a quick dinner before a nearby event, it was a perfect time to check out this Super Duper.  This is a fairly large restaurant with many interior tables as well as a large patio.

Hamburgers come in a 4oz single patty or 8oz double patty with secret sauce. Cheese and bacon are additional cost add-ons.  For toppings, "Everything on It" includes lettuce, tomato and red onion. Additional free toppings include jalapenos, grilled onions and pickles. They do have chicken and vegetarian burgers and salads for non-beef eaters.  Combo specials are the Mini or Super which comes with fries and a fountain drink. 

We got a single and a double burger with an order of fries. As stated on the menu "Our burgers are cooked medium and are very juicy...could be messy business!!"  Yes, the burgers were juicy or was it grease. The juice/grease from the burger made the wrapper a little wet. The beef is daily ground and 100% vegetarian fed. Grass fed beef does have a certain taste to it.  The all natural Kensington ketchup and mustard were self-serve and were nice quality. 

Overall, good burger burgers. But at $5.75 for a single and $8.25 for a double, they are pricey in comparison to two top burgers, In-N-Out and Habit. The fries were good, but the portion was small relative to the price.  
But I might be back for their Happy Hour of $15 for a pitcher of beer which comes with three orders of fries.
author: Al L.

description:
Wow how disappointing.

Ever had a tasteless meat patty?

Seems we all were in agreement that

1) the burgers were small
2) everything seems overpriced
3) garlic fries are too greasy
4) shakes are to small
5) service here sucks
6) the burger has little or no flavor

Order the bacon cheeseburger and they gave me one piece of bacon which they ripped in half. The garlic fries were lukewarm but drenched in oil.

They forgot my friends chocolate shake and when he showed them his receipt and that they didn't give it to him, they said they did and it was a back and forth argument before they would give him the shake.

Super overpriced at $15 for my meal ( see pic)...yeah super duper is super duper expensive alright and not worth the hype.

Go elsewhere.
author: Jack R.

description:
The burgers are definitely juicy.
Ever so slightly salt heavy, nothing a glass of soda won't fix.
author: William V.

description:
I can't get enough of Super Duper that I got it twice in one week... Do I feel a little guilty? Yes, but not really. haha. Super Duper burgers aren't the least messy burgers you can get your hands on, but they definitely are tasty for lunch. I recommend coming before 11:30AM since the lines here never really end, or at least until 1:30PM.

My go to is the mini w/grilled onions on the top w/ garlic fries. YUM & for around $10! I really like the fact they have tons of free options to add on your burger such as the sauce, grilled onions, and even jalapenos. If you're craving some more spicy they do have peppers by the soda machines. If you want water just ask for a water cup when you pick up your order. If i'm feeling extra indulgent I opt for their delicious milkshakes! If you're not feeling a burger, they do have salad and chicken sandwich options.

The only con with this location is the fact that the doors are open so pigeons frequent the place. I totally understand that there isn't a way to get rid of them completely, but seeing them on the tables outside make me chose to just take my order to go and bring it back to my office. 

Otherwise, service here is quick & friendly no matter how busy it gets. They even welcome you back if they associate your card with one used in the past. It's not a huge thing, but it's also one of those nice little things you never expect, but appreciate when they do.
author: Keizzel C.

description:
Pros:  delicious burgers and milkshakes! Great ingredients cooked amazingly well! This location usually has ample seating though there can be a wait for a larger group!

Cons: Honestly I feel that the prices are a bit high. I mean I get that good ingredients have a higher price to them so it's not a huge deal but for the quality presented it's a bit steep to make this a go to burger joint! 

During lunch time this place is packed so be prepared to wait about 30 minutes for line to food!

All in all a solid 4 star spot!
author: Aaron K.

description:
Juice dribbling down my chin. Fries forgotten in favor of flattop patties. Cheese oozing out at every possible exit point. Damn right, that's a good burger.

In search of something to eat before going to the Exploratorium's After Dark event (a must if you're nerdy like us and dislike going to museums because of the unruly kids running around), we landed here. It wasn't too busy and we got our orders within 10 minutes, a real achievement at prime dinner time. 

My significant other got a super burger combo with fries and a soft drink, while I got a four cheese super burger, resplendent with blue cheese, jack, cheddar, and aged white cheddar. Both burgers were immensely satisfying. Despite having smaller parties, both were juicy and the cheese incredibly melty. The four cheese burger in particular left cheese strings all over my face, and all four cheeses worked cohesively -- even the blue cheese, which I normally hate. They were happy to customize the veggies to our liking, too. 

The patty was a smidge too soft. No crust formed, and while there was still some of that broiled flavor, it lacked the external structure to hold it all together. This was strange to me, since I thought their burgers were made on a flattop. If it had more of that char, this would certainly be a five-star review. Aside from this, though, everything was fresh and wonderfully prepared, from the romaine lettuce to the ooey-gooey cheese.

Our extras, the fries and drink, were pretty good. They have that perfect fry in between shoestring and steak, for one. It was a little undersalted, but that was easily fixed. The ketchup here is from what seems like a third-party vendor, and has the texture of tomato purée, not Heinz. Also, is it just us, or does all Coke taste way better in a glass? Theirs certainly does.

Bring some wet wipes. I swear it took me a solid five minutes at a sink to scrub off all that delectable meat juice and grease. Super Duper, you make one mean burger.
author: Gwen W.

description:
Been here a few times since my office is right across the street. I've tried their donuts in the morning, super duper burgers, fries, and milkshakes. 

Of course first I would say that their milkshakes are DELICIOUS. My favorite is the Cookies and cream one. They regular sizes are more than enough and their small sizes aren't satisfying enough. If only they could have an in between size, that would be perfect. I've also had the alcoholic milkshakes here before and they are basically milkshakes with soju. I thought it was good because it was unique to me but I didn't like that I couldn't taste that there was enough alcohol in there. The last time I've gone, they also included fries with a purchase of an alcoholic beverage so that was pretty cool! (Probably during their happy hour) 

Burgers. I got the super duper four cheese burger. HOLY MOLY that burger was way too much for me. It's 8oz if meat (two patties) and loaded with CHEESE. Don't get me wrong I LOVED everything about this burger but I felt like I was going to get a heart attack or something because 1. It was way too much food for me and 2. It was very oily. I would highly recommend getting a mini burger if you know you can't eat that much.. 

Fries. Were great! Love all the different dipping sauces (additional $1.50 I think) but I'm biased because I love fries of all sorts! 

Donuts. I got it one morning with my coworkers and they sell three different flavors (chocolate, vanilla and plain/glazed?). These are mini donuts that are 3 for $2 I believe. Pretty decent donuts, very surgery and sweet but that's not surprising with this type of food. 

Overall, pretty decent experience here. Workers are nice, there's Jenga to play and happy hour!
author: Amy L.

description:
Super Duper is definitely a trendy spot but for some of the menu items, I feel they are a bit overpriced. For instance the vanilla cone, they have kiddie sized ones (and yay on the menu tell you to essentially have no shame for getting kiddie!), and it was good; however, double the price of a cone from McDonald's or Burger King, which to be honest taste just about the same. 

They have good burgers (though sometimes it can be a bit of a hit-or-miss situation with the patties) and are often quite busy for a good reason, but I don't think their food is mind-blowing amazing and could be cheaper (but don't we all want cheaper food? haha)
author: Jennifer Y.

description:
If I could sum up my experience here in one word, it would be: "eh."

We came here because we were starving and neither of us felt like going grocery shopping. We wanted something healthy and flavorful, and on a Saturday afternoon, this was really the only option on our way back to the car. 

We decided to share a chicken sandwich, no cheese, sauce on the side, plain fries, and a chicken salad. We waited at least 15 minutes for our food, and the place wasn't even crowded. They forgot the fries and our side sauce, so I had to ask. 

Pros: 
*Kensington ketchup! It's my favorite because it tastes different than heinz, and is a little spicy? 
*The toppings are free, and come on the side
*Burgers/sandwiches are wrapped to reduce the mess
*Vegetarian and non beef options

Why I won't recommend this chain to anyone? The chicken was juicy, but it was flavorless, even when I poured some of their chipotle sauce on top. The bun was also flavorless, and nothing special The salad and the dressing were also flavorless.  We decided to put some chipotle sauce on the salad to spice it up a little, but it still wasn't great. There was more lettuce than ingredients, and after awhile, only eating lettuce got tiring. We also decided to order the garlic fries because we were looking for something with a little flavor after our disappointing meal. This was instantly a huge regret. We ended up waiting another 10-15 minutes for fries, and when we finally got them, they were soaked in grease/oil from the cheese, that was melted on top.  We poured the fries on top of a pile of napkins to dry them off.  We left unimpressed, and with aching bellies after those garlic fries.

My girlfriend asked me to slap her if she ever suggests going to another super duper, and I will...not literally, of course.  We wish we either sucked it up and went grocery shopping while starving, or spent more money at Perry's across the way.
author: Ashley S.

description:
I had to see why so many people are here eating after work and I still don't get it. I waited in a long line to try the hype. Menu is large, you can order salad to burgers. I choose the most common ordered meal, a burger, fries and drink. They hand you a ringer to tell you that your meal is ready to pickup. 10 minutes is how long I waited and my burger was ready.  
Burger was pretty small for the price. Juicy is all I can say. 

Not worth the long line.
author: Len L.

description:
I don't understand the hype. The little morning donuts are nice but the burger is just a regular greasy burger. Nothing special about the sauce or the bun, the meat is usually overdone and very greasy and has a texture of a shoe sole.  Garlic fries are nice and they're the only reason for the 3 stars and not less.

The pickles are way too sweet.
author: Anton B.

description:
Went with my colleague and buddy to try Super Duper Burger after receiving a recommendation to try the place. We walked in and we smelled the aroma of fresh hamburgers. Thanks to the breeze flowing through, the seating area didn't feel too stuffy. We came around noon right before a massive line formed so bless up. I ordered the super duper burger (two patties) and my friend got the mini burger (one patty). When we picked up our respective orders, we also grabbed some pickles because we heard they were fantastic. 

When I took the first bite, I was greeted with the warm taste of solid beef, which wasn't too greasy. It also tasted more than salt and mixed well with the sauce. The pickles were also balanced too and weren't too sour. I was told that the Super Duper burgers are better than in and out and I have to agree.
author: Nathan C.

description:
Super Duper Burger is one of the better chain store burger places in FiDi. I don't think I've seen an Umami, Five Guys or Habbit in FiDi so if you are looking for something more than a McDonald's or Burger King, Super Duper Burger is a good choice. I think there are 4 locations in downtown and as this one is closest to my place of work, I've been here a couple of times for lunch.

At the peak lunch hour there is always a long line stretching out of the door, but it moves quickly with the entire turnaround time from ordering to pick up being at around 15 minutes (which is very acceptable for FiDi).

They have basically two types of burgers, the Super burger ($8.50 with cheese) and the mini burger ($6 with cheese). The Super comes with two beef patties while the mini has just one. You can also get a combo that includes fries and a drink for $12.75/$10.25 respectively. My standard order is the mini burger and garlic fries ($3.25). The burgers here are a little greasy but very good. The fries are thin cut but retain their crispiness on the outside while being soft on the inside. Quality has been consistent across visits.

Price wise they are in line with what you would pay for a sandwich, burrito or wrap in FiDi for lunch. Unfortunately they don't have an online ordering option. It would be great if they added this as it would allow you to skip the line at lunch. Despite this drawback Super Duper Burger is a good option to have as part of the lunch rotation in FiDi.
author: Ahmad J.

description:
I have come to two separate Super Duper Burgers since moving here to San Francisco, and I've consistently been amazed by how great this place is. Everything from the price, customer service, atmosphere, and quality of the food has absolutely blown me away.

I came to this location on a Friday night to meet up with some friends. When I got there around 7:30, my friends had already been waiting in a fast-moving but long line for around 10 minutes. They said that for how long the line was, they were moving really quickly. There were a lot of people eating inside and outside, but after ordering from a very friendly cashier we found an empty table instantly. 

Our food arrived pretty quickly and I was once again blown away by the quality of the food. I got the Super Duper burger with fries and a drink, which came out to be $13 with tax. A good deal for a very filling and high quality burger. The two burger patties, albeit thinner than other fast-casual places such as Five Guys, were incredibly juicy and flavorful. I'm not sure how they do it. I savored every bite of my burger, and was pretty upset when it was over. The fries were also quite good, though nothing to write home about compared to the burger. 

I keep comparing this place to Shake Shack to my friends, but a part of me says it might even be better than Shake Shack. I'll definitely be back here more than I ought to throughout my time here in San Francisco. I'm really interested in the breakfast sandwiches and chicken sandwich!
author: Jenny D.

description: Nice location with lots of outdoor seating. Awesome juicy burgers.
author: Sunil R.

description:
Ughhhh so delicious! Why did I have to discover this place? Super quick lunch with my husband on Saturday while shopping at Union and dang! These burgers are perfect. Simple (perhaps a little greasy) deliciousness and didn't even need bacon or eggs or avocado, even if those add-ons are totally an option. Fries are great too!

Their cookies and cream shake is incredible and organic ice cream cones looked great even if we didn't try them. Will definitely return when in the area and give that a whirl.
author: Joanna R.

description:
Always good, I love that this place always pours on the super sauce, my lettuce wrapped mini burger is always swimming in delicious goodness. The chicken burger is also good lettuce wrapped, i order my burgers this way most of the time because it's way lighter and healthier this way without all that bread. 
I'm diabetic and always appreciate a lettuce wrapped burger done right, not only this but their version of a mini is actually small enough but still filling if you are on a special diet and need to be watching your portions or carb intake. 
Compared to other burger joints, Super Duper has the good lettuce, darker green and fresh, and use better quality tomatoes that aren't mushy or taste unripe. Adding jalapeños, grilled onions, or pickles is free! What more do you want? Organic ice cream shakes? Done.
author: Mona L.

description: Fairly quick, reliable, tasty burger & fries. Esp. with egg & avocado.
author: Neil S.

description:
I am a huge fan of Super Duper Burger but this location...not so much, which is really disappointing since it is just a short walk from my work office.

I've been here a few times and the quality of my food isn't as great as the other locations I've been to. The garlic fries are usually a must for me, but when I order it here it's like I paid for normal fries but with a sloppy pinch of cheese on top. I couldn't even tell they were garlic fries. I also tried the chicken burger here which was okay. Not really blown away since the first few times I've had Super Duper I've always thought of it as juicy and flavorful. I feel hesitant coming back.
author: Allison S.

description: There's no place to wash your hands or use the bathroom here after hours :-( gross. Now I have to eat my fries and burger with dirty hands.
author: Jeff K.

description:
Super Duper is our Go To Burger in San Francisco

My wife and I usually get a mini burger each (single patty) with grilled onions, lettuce and tomato and share a garlic fries. If you are hungry, their standard burger is a double. Their shakes are awesome -- hence why we share a fries -- to leave room. Don't miss the house made pickles. And they have a happy hour every day (times vary), that gets you free fries with your beer. Always friendly efficient service.
author: John C.

description: They never disappoint! I always get the burger with avocado , egg, cheese and bacon! It's a must try! They also have really good milkshakes.The employees are also super friendly.
author: Thomas M.

description: Come here after a long touristy walk and was craving burgers really badly. If you're not feeling fast food, this is the spot to get a really quality burger. Though the price point is high, you get what you pay for. I had a mini burger, which is actually just a regular burger (no double or anything) with cheese and bacon. Super delicious! The patty came medium rare and was really juicy. I subbed regular fries for garlic fries and had no regrets. Still retained a crunch and had a loooot of Parmesan on top. The complimentary pickles here are really good as well and I recommend filling up on them (near the soda). The only complaint I have are the freaking pigeons (probably just an SF thing) they're incredibly sneaky so I don't recommend eating outside unless there's no other option. A few even got inside lol.
author: Krysta M.

description:
I ordered the Veggie Burger ($6.75) and Garlic Fries ($3.50).

I liked how the bread and patty were really crunchy. However, I found the burger to be kind of plain. The patty was very thick and almost tasted like nothing. I could hardly taste the veggie toppings. I think I was given one very thin piece of lettuce and a little tomato slice. I saw sauce on the bread, but I could hardly taste it. I ended up using a lot of ketchup for my burger. I was glad the burger was not salty.

At least, I was glad the patty was not a black bean burger you find in a supermarket. It contained a ton of ingredients, such as corn and rice pieces. 

The fries were crunchy and oily. I liked the melted cheese!

If I were to come back, I would only go for the fries.
author: Kristina M.

description: One of the best burgers I've had. So good I had one for dinner and went back in the morning to get another one
author: Jennie R.

description:
I literally pass by this place about a million times but had never set a foot there. Today, I was suuuuuper hungry so I stopped by and gave it a try. I ordered a veggie burger, french fries and white wine. ($15  Combo, well that's what it said on my receipt)

White Wine by the tap - it's really good. They give you this cute little pour glass. They do ID you btw lol.

Fries - These are amazing. Not even oily. I admit it, I got some over well done fries ( maybe because I came half an hour before closing) but they were actually not that bad. I got some ketchup from there and I don't know where it's from, it's amazing lol. I know it's ketchup but it was high quality ketchup and it was so good .

Burger - I saved this for last because I was not that impressed. Honestly only because they did not put cheese until I went home and realized that they didn't. It's okay the burger was really good though, so I definitely reccomend it !! My only question/request is that if you can cook it on a separate place so it's suitable for the veggies!

Overall, the place has great ambiance. The workers are really nice too. The service was remarkably fast. Last day of final examination celebration went super well !
author: Disha B.

description:
Enjoyed a really good burger here.
The place is spacious and clean.
The staff is nice.
The burger was made with quality beef.
A couple beers on tap.
Nice lunch.
Eater will be happy.
author: Dude Food G.

description:
My wife and I were mulling what to eat for lunch last week and we were waiting in line next door at Mixt (which really should be named Super Duper Overpriced Salads). But I got impatient at the slow moving line, peered into Super Duper Burger and was pleased to see that they served Chicken burgers as well. So I called the missus over and we both got chicken burgers with cheese. We ordered garlic fries as well to share and decided to stick to water.  

It's very apparent to me that SDB uses quality ingredients. The veggies like the tomatoes were fresh and tasty. I lifted the bun up and was pleased to see two nice and thin chicken pieces. Notice I didn't say patties. I was apprehensive that I'd get one of those Costco or Mega conglomerate Food service type chicken formed patty, but not so.

The taste?  Hmmm. I wasn't in love but I didn't hate it either. I thought the sauce didn't really enhance the flavor but kind of muddled it for me. The bun...not sure what it was but something along the lines of a ciabatta. My expectation was that they'd use their burger bun but that wasn't so. Maybe next time lll ask if they could do that for me. Which is to say I really didn't like the bun. But again, everything in between was pretty good. 

As for the garlic fries, they were good but personally I think I am fine with just their regular fries. 

We both agreed that we liked their burgers better and will probably stick with them next time. But I'll try the chix again provided they put it on their beef burger bun.
author: Bob K.

description:
This one is my go to for breakfast more than anything as it's right near the ferry building on my walk to work. 

And yes, I said breakfast at super duper. Their breakfast deals are awesome. I go with the mini combo of egg sandwich + avocado, mini donut which are homemade daily and a small four barrel coffee for about $7. The avo is extra but without that bad boy combo is only $5.50. Usually about a 2 min wait cuz they make the sandwich fresh meaning it's a damn good egg every time. Probably had this egg Sando about 12 times now, and I can't remember a badly cooked egg. It's so consistent.

Finally, y'all know the burgers are bomb and every once in awhile I'll hit these guys on walk back to ferry for a beer and a burger.
author: Nate E.

description: Stopped by here for a quick dinner and was pleased with my overall experience. Great environment with a very relaxed vibe. There is plenty of seating inside and outside so it's the perfect place to hang out with friends or have a solo meal. My food arrived pretty quickly and the fries were perfect- crispy on the outside but soft inside. The reason I'm giving this place 4/5 stars isn't because of the food, it's because of the extremely limited soda selection. I would have liked more options, that's all. Other than that: great place, fast service, very clean, and plenty of pickles!
author: Bianca M.

description:
I think im the only one that prefers their breakfast menu over their burgers. 

+Donuts- cute and yumm! Chocolate, Vanilla or sugar coated. They have an egg sandwich which is great.
+Ice cream reminds me of my childhood and the size of the small shakes are nice. 
+Veggie burgers are pretty great
author: Amanda M.

description:
This is one of the better links in this chain. The service appears more genuinely attentive, and the space more wide open with patio seating a popular spot for office workers who don't seem to want to go home. This was a Lightening Foods a long time ago where I spent an inordinate amount of effort putting toppings on my salad rather than the salad itself. Now it's all about the burgers and fries, and for what they're worth, they provide reasonable fast-food satisfaction near the Embarcadero.

Jamie W. and I made it here after work where we just decided the $7.75 Super Burger just might do it for us with with its two four-ounce patties, secret sauce and all their fixings (photo:  http://bit.ly/2itT7IV). It did the trick, and we added a bit of indulgence with the $3.25 Garlic Fries which was just plain gooey with melted aged cheddar (photo: http://bit.ly/2ihPMJN). We also took advantage of the complimentary Kosher pickles because that was the closest we were getting to anything healthy during that meal (photo: http://bit.ly/2hG14GX).

FOOD - 3 stars...juicy burger with fixings and the fries work, too, but not quite classic
AMBIANCE - 3.5 stars...roomier than most Super Dupers
SERVICE - 3.5 stars...not as curt as they are at other locations
TOTAL - 3 stars...still less than super with an emphasis on duper
author: Ed U.

description: Cozy enviorment and super friendly staffs. The portion size of mini burger is suitable for Asian women. The burger bun is great, but the beef is a little salty. Don't like garlic fries that much though.
author: Fu-Feng W.

description:
Okay burger chain located throughout San Francisco. I stopped by this branch for a late lunch as I was really craving a warm burger on a chilly winter day.

I ordered the regular-size burger with cheese and a side of fries. The burger was okay: the meat patty had a juicy flavor and they also added a little bit of lettuce and tomatoes to go along with the meat and cheese. However it was a little tad too oily for my preference, the bun was not that memorable, and the portion size was quite small for the price (~$9). The side of fries (~$3) was okay but also not quite memorable.

Location of this branch is very convenient, about a block away from Embarcadero BART station. I think there's better options for burgers around the city, but decent to satisfy a burger crave (though personally I felt quite expensive).
author: Alvin W.

description:
A casual, easy, go-to option for a vegetarian in the city! You can't go wrong with Super Duper. 

FOOD (4/5) 
Their veggie burgers are pretty big and filling. They have a really good combo of toppings, BUT you do have to add cheese (!!) and avocado for an extra price (and you definitely should as these make the burger infinitely better). In terms of the veggie patty, its not my favorite.. it has a lot of corn, sprouts and other different vegetables fused into the patty. However, I like that they are creative and make a pretty unique patty rather than the usual bean or portobello options. Also, it looks pretty healthy! Fries are very tasty too - not greasy at all and always taste fresh! 

DRINKS (5/5) 
Great wine options, also have a selection of beers and normal fountain drinks, etc. Not a place to turn up... more to like casually enjoy a drink with your burger. 

ICE CREAM (5/5) 
Don't leave without saving room for some soft serve! Kind of the major highlight of this place! :) My favorite is the swirl! 

AMBIANCE (3/5) 
Basic burger place. There was a pigeon inside when I went yesterday which low-key scared the sh*t outa me when it suddenly started flying right over our heads. Sometimes it can be dirty if you come during a busy time, so make sure to bus your table and help people out! 

OVERALL (4/5): Great food and dessert! Slightly pricey, but it's high quality and healthy fast-food.
author: Natalie F.

description:
I'm a huge fan of Super Duper and grabbed a quick lunch here. The line was long but went fairly quickly as they had three cashiers during lunch hour. I placed my order for a mini combo (everything + cheese) to go, and got my order right after getting my drink. As I was getting my order, the guy at the counter informed me where the condiments and free donuts were. 

FREE DONUTS? Yes please.

Grabbed a donut and a few containers of ketchup. Pickles seemed to be popular--I'm usually not a fan but decided to try a few. The burger was perfectly cooked, fries were crispy and delicious, and I enjoyed the pickles as well.

As for the donut, that's sitting nearby so I can pretend to have some semblance of self-control.
author: Jenn C.

description: The team that was working at 3:45 PM on Saturday, August 4th, 2018 were extremely friendly and welcoming. Could not ask for a better experience. Greeted as soon as I walked in the door and help through all the steps of ordering. Will absolutely recommend this place to EVERYONE!!
author: Alexandra W.

description:
The most juicy burgers ever. The hubby had the double Patty supreme burger, I had the chicken sandwich with Chipotle aoli sauce and the garlic fries with beer. Our bellies and taste buds were super happy. This location is clean and super efficient. So glad we decided to walk in.
I wish they come to Chicago soon. Obviously grabbing it again before we leave!
author: Nivedita S.

description:
Super duper unimpressed.

$13 for a so-called 8 oz burger (not even any add-ons) and garlic fries. I guess there's a super duper premium and not many burger options in this part of town.

Three hours later I was hungry again. 8 oz? Maybe half of them melted away in the cooking process.

The garlic fries were good and might be worth a re-visit. The burger, definitely not. This meal should have been $9. For that price my money is better spent at Big Mouth or In-N-Out. Seriously, even Sizzler has a considerably beefier bacon cheeseburger and fries combo for that money.
author: Richard C.

description:
Why was the cheeseburger sad? IT HAD BLUE CHEESE!! For an additional $1.50, you can add Cambozola blue cheese to your burger here, but the last thing it will ever be is SAD!!

How do you make a hamburger laugh? PICKLE IT!! This place is known for having the most delicious (complimentary) pickles. Grab a few while you're near the drinks/condiments station to munch on while you wait for your food!!

I can see why this chain is called Super Duper Burgers. IT'S SUPER DUPER!!

What I've had:
- Veggie burger ($6.75): The first time I had the veggie burger here, I REALLY didn't like it...by default, it comes with hummus, cucumber, and Super Sauce (a mayo-based sauce with other secret ingredients). I LOVE hummus, but idk it wasn't really doin' it for me on the burger. One day, I decided to give it another another chance. The second time, I got it without cucumber and hummus and added avocado ($1.25), roasted portobello ($1.25), and jack ($0.50) for an additional price. IT WAS ABSOLUTELY FRIGGIN DELICIOUUUS. BEST VEGGIE BURGER I'VE EVER HAD. I usually never really go for a veggie burger wherever I see it because more often than not, it resembles something you can find in the frozen food aisle of your neighborhood grocery store...BUT THIS. From the picture, you can see that it ain't your average veggie burger. You can taste the bits of vegetables in the patty, and overall, it tastes REAL

- Garlic fries ($3.50): I am on a mission to find the best fries in the area, and so far, Super Duper is winning!! The garlic fries here are made using fresh garlic and 6-month aged cheddar. The texture is usually nice--crunchy on the outside but soft and mashed potato-like on the inside. They literally come loaded with a MOUNTAIN of cheese and the perfect amount of garlic sprinkled on top. There have been a few times when the fries seemed a little too burnt, but usually, that isn't the case

Bottom line: AHHH I LOVE YOU, SUPER DUPER!! Kinda pricy...but you can definitely taste the quality. The ketchup they have here ain't your average either, and they have pickles that people rave about!! I'm not the biggest pickle fan, so I'll let you decide for yourself on that...they have soft serve too AHHH!! If you're in the area and looking for a bougie burger that ain't so bougie that it's extra, head on over to Super Duper!! Your tastebuds will be elated
author: Kithumini J.

description: While visiting San Francisco we were told he had to try this place. Not really knowing what to order since we had never been we were looking and discussing the menu while they cashier just looked and never offered any help or advice (especially seeing we have never been you think she would have) we ordered our food and just by watching what other customers did, I found they have pickles in a jar by the condiments (famous pickles?) So I decided to try them I Love pickles. The food was very good, and the garlic fries were unlike any I have ever had.
author: Danielle N.

description:
Came in for happy hour around 6:40pm on a Monday. The line went out the door but I was able to order and get my food in less than 15 minutes. They have a happy hour deal where you get free fries with the purchase of alcohol ($5 a glass) and I was able to upgrade them to garlic fries for .50! I ordered a veggie burger with grilled onions and cheese, a beer and garlic fries all for $12.75. Good value for what you get and lots of open seating. 

The only downside was my burger did not come with cheese like I asked for and there were only a few small grilled onions (I had to look to make sure they were there at all).
author: Mary S.

description: Fresh n tasty. Located in FiDi so if you go for the weekday lunch time hours, make sure you go during the non-prime time. The veggie burger here is no joke - my girlfriend decided to try it and I ordered the chicken sandwich w/ bacon, but sincerely thought the veggie burger tasted better. The fries were also very crispy and had that very unique aromatic potato flavor that's usually lost in the deep frying stage of the potato's life.
author: David Y.

description:
This is the second location of Super Duper burger my best friend and I have visited in the city. Just like the first location, this place was packed. Even though the line was long it took us no time to get up to the register and order. The kid behind the counter asked if it was our first time, and when we told him it was at this location he welcomed us and told us where we can find the condiments. 

We both ordered a mini burger. Like five guys, when you order a mini or "little" burger what they really mean is it's a normal burger with one patty. The super burger comes with two. I can get past the fact that they charge extra for cheese for two reasons: 1. The cheese is Cheddar, so it's good quality cheese, and 2. It's only an extra 50 cent charge, so it's nothing. The burger came out amazing. For fast food, it's amazing how juicy they can make these burgers, plus mine was a little pink in the middle (how I love it), so clearly the burgers are freshly made. 

We split an order of garlic fries. The fries were crispy and seasoned well. But the garlic and the cheese that just envelops these fries is what it's really about. If you ever wanted to know what heaven smells and tastes like, this is it. 

At the condiment station they have ketchup, mustard, etc., however, they also have homemade pickles. These things are spicy, but they are delicious.

Don't let the fact that these guys are fast food get to you. They may be fast, but they're delicious as well.
author: Jonathan R.

description:
An underwhelming experience. We spent +$30 dollars for okay burgers and fries. 

The restaurant is poorly laid out and inadequate to accommodate the large crowd it obviously draws. Families of 6 or more were squished in very small-two top tables that are bolted to the floor so they can't even be moved to fit snug together like a four-top. Meanwhile parties of two took up large tables for 4-6 or spread themselves across the larger communal tables. Obviously a result of the self-seating approach. As a results the main aisles for traffic were blocked by people just trying to eat with their families who couldn't get bigger tables. Certainly a fire-code violation. 

The food itself was okay. Burger was good but not anything extraordinary. Fries were good but also within the ordinary. 

And...they don't allow PAYING CUSTOMERS use of their restrooms. Lmao what in Saint Peter's golden gates type of policy is that? You serve greasy burgers and fries, with cheese and soda with free refills, you obviously get crowded and get a lot of families with small kids coming in...and in your minds you don't think restrooms are just a tad necessary? 

We had three kids with our group of 7. Seating was a nightmare, acoustics were terrible because of the damn near, if not, all hard surfaces, it was cold in the place...the kids had to use the bathroom and the cold didn't help...and to make matters worse people were just standing over our table waiting for us to get done with our food. 

This was truly a crap experience. At least the person who took our order was polite. I guess.
author: Ronna B.

description: This place was our first stop in San Francisco, my friends and I were staving when we entered and full when we came out!  At first I was reluctant to go to this place because I wanted something fresh like a salad but after taking the first bite of my burger I changed my mind I though the burger were really good, the meat inside was fresher than other burgers place where you can eat. The service was fast, we waited 10 minutes for our tasty burger. I recommend this place for lunch
author: Liberte F.

description: I guess with a name like Super Duper Burgers, you come in with a pretty high expectation. This burger did not disappoint! Ingredients were fresh and the fries were crispy. Price point is nice as well if you're looking for a quick lunch or dinner. Service was also really quick; the line was out the door and we ordered within about 7 minutes.
author: Heather E.

description:
Thank you for being open on the weekends! Not many options in this area are, so I've been running out to snag a veggie burger on my Saturday lunch break. 

Pros: 
-this location is spacious enough to accommodate their crowds (unlike the 3rd/Market or Metreon locations)
-food quality is consistent across all locations I've been to.
-open on weekends (unlike their neighbors... looking at you, Eatsa!)

Cons: 
-if the line is beyond the threshold, it will take more than 30 minutes to get out of there with food in hand. If the line is AT the threshold and you only have a 30-minute break, you'd better be prepared to scarf your food once it comes.
author: Krista L.

description:
They use locally sourced ingredients and you can really taste the difference. Great fast food-style dining, but significantly better quality than typical fast food. It gets really busy during the lunch wave but the service is pretty fast!
I always get the mini burger and garlic fries. I think the mini burger is the perfect size - not tiny but not overwhelmingly large. I love how they have options to add free toppings like jalapeños, grilled onions, and pickles. The burgers already come topped with lettuce, tomatoes, red onions, and their super sauce. I like to opt out red onions for grilled onions and add jalapeños for a slight kick. 
I love the garlic fries. Their freshly made fries are topped with garlic and aged cheddar. It's a must-try! 
The prices are reasonable and the food is great! You're paying for the quality and freshness of the food!
author: Emily L.

description: I really love the veggie burger here and the garlic fries! The staff here was really nice Max, Blake and Adarius were very helpful and nice towards my picky needs! I Will come again for sure!
author: Sidney S.

description:
was feeling like a burger but lighter.

The Super Duper veggie burger came through, and then some.
Add some avo for a buck more.

The meat, er..patty was crispy on the outside with little sesame bits that cracked as I bit down; the patty was def. meaty and thick, not dry too.
The buns were fine, moisty and tasty; the lettuce and tomatoe were fresh too.
Luv'd their veggie burger.

Had the lemonade with brown sugar; it was good as well. Not too sweet, nor too tangy.
author: Bert K.

description: I have had a decent burger here before, but a lot of times they fail. Ordered a burger with cheese and bacon and received the saddest burger made. It was edible but for the cash I should have walked to gotts, or any place else. It's a crapshoot depending on who makes it.
author: James P.

description:
If you're vegan, this review is the one you'll want to read.
Super Duper has a hella good vegan burger. Order the veggie burger without cheese or special sauce, and make sure you get it on ciabatta bread. It has delicious hummus which keeps it from getting too dry, as well as some other veggie goodness going on like cucumbers, tomatoes, corn, etc. I was surprised with how tasty it was! All of the flavors were fantastic. Just enough food without feeling gross or bloated afterwards (see: a perk of being vegan). I usually keep my expectation low for veggie burgers because not a lot of places do them right, but Super Duper does.
author: Lauren W.

description: I noticed a lot of these franchises on yelp in SF so I must say I under estimated this place and the food quality/service over exceeded my expectations. Got a craft beer to go with my Burger. I'll have to try a milkshake next time.
author: Jeff N.

description: Holy deliciousness! From the burgers to the fries, you cannot go wrong here! I consider myself to be a bit of a veggie burger snob, and theirs passes with flying colors... packed with mouthwatering flavor, it's a great option for even the non-vegetarians in your group. I also highly recommend the garlic fries! The garlicky, cheesy goodness is absolutely amazing. I will definitely be back here the next time I'm in San Francisco. Now if I could just convince them to open a location back home in Minneapolis...
author: Brittany S.

description:
I was craving a burger, and it was one of those rare days where I didn't bring a lunch to work.  So, I convinced the lunch crew to go to Super Duper.  When we got there, the line was way out the door, so we decided to head down the street to Bistro Burger.  But when we got there, we found that there was no longer a Bistro Burger.  The rest of the lunch crew bailed on the burger idea, and I was the only one to remain undeterred.  I went back to Super Duper and stood in the long line.

While we waited, they offered us samples of their delicious soft serve ice cream.  After about 15 minutes, I got to the front and ordered a double burger, with no veggies and mayonnaise and ketchup, along with garlic parmesan fries.  After another 10-15 minutes, I got my to-go order, and trekked back to the office to dig in.

Mmm, that burger really hit the spot. Juicy. Beefy. Cheesy. Delicious.
author: Nadeem A.

description:
I've been to Super Duper a few times, but never this location.

I've gotten the veggie burger and while I'm glad they have it, it's really a falafel burger, which is fine but not amazing. I do, however, love that they have jars of free pickles!

We also got an organic ice cream cone dipped in chocolate. The child size is large enough.
author: Veg V.

description: Great burger! The patty was cooked to perfection. I ordered the super duper combo for a total of about $14. The burgers are juicy and greasy just like you want. Their garlic fries will leave you with stanky breath for hours but that's how you know it's good. The restaurant aesthetics are very appealing to the population they look to attract. Semi mondern design. Always crowded because it's so delicious.
author: Trevor J.

description:
My go-to lunch spot! What's not to like about Super Duper? Good, delicious, fresh burgers, tasty garlic fries, free homemade pickles that are very addicting and great service. 

My only gripe is that the lines can be (literally) out the door and the wait gets unbearable sometimes. But then I just find myself stuffing my face with pickles... it helps.
author: T L.

description:
Outstanding customer service and an amazing veggie burger!

I paid for some pepper jack cheese, but it wasn't included in my burger so I brought it to one of the server's attention, only expecting them to give me a slice of cheese. However, they apologized and brought me a brand new sandwich soon after. Although it was a minor mistake, I really appreciate the good customer service and will continue patronizing this restaurant.

Seriously was the best veggie burger I've ever had and I can't wait to come here for a cheeseburger after I'm no longer on a diet!
author: Vu P.

description: Ordered a salad with an add-on of avocado and didn't receive my avocado. :(
author: Jennifer L.

description: I am so glad I drove 20 minutes out of my way to eat here! During the lunch rush, the service was so nice and fast. The food was absolutely delicious. We split one of the burger specials and she gave a second drink for free. We were delighted to find they gave out free sugar donuts! It was the perfect way to top off the meal. The location was corner and enough indoor / outdoor space. They promoted their events and games, serving beer and playing Jenga. I wish we had one of these places back home! It would be my go-to spot! They advertised everything being natural and organic, who knew it would be so good and at such a good price!
author: Mariah P.

description:
This was my first trip to this place and they really do have super duper burgers. 

The chicken burger was delicious, very well seasoned. 
I wasn't really impressed with their super duper burger there was no seasoning, it was kind of bland.  

I would definitely visit this place again for their chicken burger. 

Overall the ambience was good, the staff was friendly and food was yummy !!!
author: Simran K.

description:
The burgers and shakes are great, the service is friendly and pretty fast, and the interior is nice. 

So why three stars? It's unsanitary, could eventually get someone sick, and the company doesn't seem to want to do anything about it. They allow pigeons to fly around the restaurant interior and even get close to the kitchen. All it would take would be someone at the door to shoo the pigeons away before they come in, but they don't seem willing to do that. (See reply below.) It's not rocket science. 

I'd hate for such a great restaurant to have a Chipotle moment, but they seem to be blindly heading in that direction.
author: Al S.

description: Pretty obsessed with their burgers. Such a great spot for a quick burger and fries fix. Outdoor seating available. Location is really nice and clean. Staff super friendly. I always order the same thing, mini cheeseburger, fries and their chipotle sauce to dip my fries in. I tried their cookies and cream shake once and I couldn't take more than two sips, tooooo sweet for my taste.
author: Eidit C.

description:
*****Super Duper! Super Yum!*****

Super Duper has breakfast on lock! Breakfast sandwiches, hash browns, donuts that are probably some of the best out there, annnnddd freshly made orange juice?! 

My visit to SDB was the morning before SF Pride to fuel our tummies for a day of celebration, resistance, and a showing of love and equality. SDB sure did show us a good time before the parade! 

Let me take you for a trip down the menu of that day. It was booked for our Glamazon parade participants, so it was a limited menu that morning, but from what I sampled, they have definitely gained my future business.

First off, those donuts are freakin' addicting! I had 2! Well, 2 and 1/2. That's a pretty big compliment considering I eat a donut maybe once a year, and it has to taste like a unicorn looks for me to fathom consuming all those sugary calories. Bravo and hat tip to the creator of that sugary beast of fried dough. Mmmm... Mmm... Mmm.

Next up? Their take on an Egg McMuffin of sorts. I've never had a traditional one from McDonalds, but I know that they exist. This little sandwich was quite filling, and came with an egg, cheese, and avocado. Delicious. I will be back for you one day little sandwich. Hopefully sooner rather than later. They also have others that come with various meats, but I don't partake in those types of choices. 

Lastly...The hash browns. Super fresh out of the fryer and pipping hot! Yes! Crispy delicious on the outside, and soft in the middle.  

Beverages? I washed it all down with some freshly made orange juice. I don't even like pulp! I did that day since it was so good!

Oh and not only do they know how to make some good grub, they employ some pretty nice people. Super sweet service. 

Although this was a pre-fixed menu for our Glamazon group, I did notice that they have quite the selection of menu items. Many options besides just breakfast selections. 

Thank you Super Duper for making our Pride morning go so smoothly, and not leaving our tummies growling. You have gained at least two more loyal customers, that cannot wait to sample some more of what you have to offer.
author: Alexandra F.

description: Long lines at lunch time. They should allow for online orders to speed up the lines. It's nice that there is indoor and outdoor seating. I wasn't too impressed with the service here but enjoyed my food which came out hot off the grill and fryer.
author: W A.

description:
This Super Duper Burger on Mission in the Financial District is an establishment that manages to be at once comforting and 'trendy'.  The comfort is in the lay-out and the food: delicious hamburgers, veggie burgers and chicken sandwiches (not as good as the burgers) served with fountain drinks, shakes, french fries, salads and/or beer.

You enter and are directly in queue for the register, where you order from a wide menu above while a cashier walks you through the process step-by-step with an impressively authentic level of enthusiasm.  You are given a drink and a buzzer to notify you when your food is ready for pick-up.

In this sense, Super Duper is a classic burger joint.

However, the aesthetic is a bit different.  Solid plank tables and counters of polished wood adorn the interior dining room.  An enormous wooden effigy in the form of a bovine silhouette dominates a wall, paying homage to Super Duper's most beloved ingredient: tender beef patties.  Extensive outdoor seating is available and channels the atmosphere of a German biergarten, despite being at a busy intersection and under frequent assault by those charity-seeking San Francisco flying rats, also known as pigeons.  

The only downside of the design is that there are no restrooms.

The common thread between the cuisine and the atmosphere is refined casual simplicity.  It's classic at heart, but classier and trendier than most traditional burger havens.

Your buzzer chimes and you get your food with the herd from an expo counter that faces the main dining floor and provides a glimpse into the kitchen.  After you receive your victuals on a tray, you may choose to stop by the condiment counter and soda station.  The unique touch here is the jar of complimentary sliced pickles and Super Duper's ketchup, which is more thick and tomato-y than traditional Heinz.

I got a mini burger (4 oz of beef) with lettuce, tomato, grilled onion and super sauce (their take on 1000 island, I believe), as well as a Racer 5 and a side of fries.  The burger was fantastic; meatier and heftier than your average In-N-Out burger.  The patties are cooked thoroughly, but retain a soft buttery texture.  The produce is fresh and tasty.  Although it's not fresh-off-the-vine bursting with flavor, it's leagues better than the watery, lifeless, nearly colorless toms you often get at a greasy diner.   Kudos to the whole wheat bun as well, which is sturdy and courser than your usual burger bun.

Overall, it was everything I want from a quick burger.

The fries are good, but not extraordinary.  They are somewhere in between soft and crispy.  Again, I was reminded of In-N-Out, who's fries I don't much care for unless they are buried under a heaping pile of special sauce and grilled onions, which I don't think is an option here.  Honestly, Super Duper's fries (plain) are a step above, having more flavor and body than those of the California classic.  The ketchup might not do it for some people, but I didn't mind it.

Overall, this Super Duper is solid.  The cuisine is classic but higher quality, and the atmosphere is simplistic and comfortable.  I recommend Super Duper to anyone who is downtown and craving simple, classic fare.  They make a damn good burger and it's a good location for either solo-dining or a casual lunch meeting.  The service was friendly, fast and professional. 

Places like Super Duper aren't going to revolutionize your palate, but they hold down and even slightly elevate an American culinary standard.
author: Max T.

description: It wasn't even 7:55 and the beer was all cleaned up. ;/ I wanted my beer and fries happy hour. Oh well it was really slow anyway. Just 2 guest inside. Sad hour...
author: Jray M.

description: It's all about location I guess. These guys need to learn from In-n-Out on how to make a good lettuce wrap burger. The lettuce tasted just like paper. I swear with every bite I looked to see if I had accidentally eaten the paper it was wrapped in.  Or better yet, offer a gluten free bun. If they can offer $1.25 for a piece of bacon, they can get better ingredients. The meat was good but otherwise no flavor.
author: Jessica Y.

description:
First of all- I love the name! It's screams fun and satisfying. "Let's all go to Super Duper Burger" 
I was strolling through SF on an 80 degree Saturday, and the kids were starting to get hangry. 
The menu had various sandwich options and veggies burgers too. 
Super Duper Burger began to get popular as we waited for our food, but the line moved quickly. 
My hatchlings (along with my Super Duper Husband) had the mini burgers - plain. 
They thoroughly enjoyed them. My husband said the seasoning on the burgers was quite tasty. The buns were toasty and also got 10 thumbs up from the crew. They complimented the fries as well. Speaking of fries- the man one table over from us had garlic fries, they looked so scrumptious. They had parsley and aged cheddar melted on top. They looked like golden garlic fry perfection, I had serious fry envy. I snapped a pic,for your viewing enjoyment, while he was looking away. 
I wasn't hungry, so I just had some of their pickles. They were spicy and reminiscent of the pickles that my Grandma used to make in her cellar. Meaning- those are some delicious pickles! 
I heard the woman behind me us say "Holy Crap this is delicious" that's an exact quote. She was eating a chicken sandwich. Good to know :)
The staff were friendly, they came around sweeping also collecting trash, trays, etc. and kept the outdoor area nice and tidy. There is an awning and umbrellas, to provide shade- thanks. The bright orange color impressed my little people. It was pretty warm inside, so the outdoor seating was a far more comfortable option. 
I definitely recommend giving Super Duper Burger a go. One warning: the outdoor benches are very lightweight, and they will tip if you sit on the far end of one. Our daughter is a super lightweight and she accidentally tipped it like a teeter totter! 
I hope you Super Duper like this place as much as we did.
The ice cream looks like a whole lot of cool and creamy delightfulness- I don't care if that's even a word. I totally want some.
author: Kimberly T.

description: My favorite burgers place. See for yourself, good combination of the buns, beef and cheeses! Taste so good! Love their Garlic fries too!
author: Lydia K.

description:
The rave reviews and proximity from my hotel are what drew me to Super Duper Burgers. I don't often eat beef, so I found the reviews very compelling. 

I ordered the mini-burger with all the usual fixings, plus an egg and bacon. Also a freshly made order of fries and fresh lemonade. Overall, I was most satisfied with the burger. It was juicy, hot and had just the right amount of secret sauce. Though I did add some ketchup. The bun was toasted just right and didn't taste like something overly processed you'd purchase in a 7-eleven :-0

Sadly, my fries were warm, not hot and crisp. I tried adding salt, pepper and ketchup to them, but it was already too late to bring them back to life. So I only ate a few.

Surprisingly the "naturally sweetened" lemonade was not bad. Not as sweet as I'd like, but not sour either. It was a good alternative to the fountain soda. Kudos to S-D for that option.

Pros:
- quick service
- easy to understand menu
- pretty fast turn-around of the food
- good fast-casual option in the Mission District

Cons:
- the fries may be hit or miss, so I'd suggest tasting them ASAP to determine whether they make the grade
author: J W.

description:
We stopped here on a Monday night around 7 pm after scooting around SOMA and the Ferry Building. We had our heart set on Super Duper, but thought it was only near the Metreon and on Market. Turns out there are *four* lovely downtown locations for burger goodness, and this one is a special gem. Aside from being super-close to the Embarcadero, there is easily double the seating of other locations, both indoors and outdoors. On a lovely spring night, it's hard to beat chilling outside with a beer and a Jenga tower. They keep baskets of the blocks on most tables, and it's a great time-kill while you wait for them to page you for your order. 

The folks working here are super-friendly, and the line was non-existent. Those of you who try to maintain a healthy diet during the work week, take note. ;-) 

From M-F until 7 pm, a $15 pitcher (or any alcohol purchase) gets you free fries! Even garlic fries! This is a great place to start a mid-week bar crawl, or to simply park yourself for an hour or so as you enjoy their incredible Burgers and Chicken Sandwiches ($7.50 / $8 with cheese). I can't get past the chipotle sauce on those - lots of subtle, wonderful heat. Load up on the free pickles! 

If there must be a flaw, it's that there is no on-premise bathroom, which is definitely a bummer. We were told "it's a bit of a trip" to get to, so we just ended up heading back to the Ferry Building. Oh wells. Also, there are several intrepid pigeons who will think nothing of lunging at your fries while you're actively eating them. Clapping and yelling will only make you look like an idiot. If this bothers you, best to sit inside. 

All said, this is a great stop, especially if you're looking to save some coin and recover from the sticker shock of Gott's. Pending another warm, beautiful evening, we'll be back!
author: Laura B.

description:
No stars for this place. I didn't want to leave a bad review, but this place have the worst customer service. 

It was my first time here. It was a Saturday, so I'm not sure if Saturdays are more chilled and relaxed for the workers here. They seemed to not care at all. The place wasn't really busy; they had a few people dinning there. I ordered a burger to go and it took about 25mins. JUST for 1 Burger! No fries, no shake, no extra item. I went to the condiment bar 3x to get pickles while I was waiting for my burger. 

I can see the cooks from where I was waiting and one guy kept looking up and smiling at me and laughing with his co-workers. I was getting annoyed because I had to be somewhere at a certain time and I couldn't believe why it was taking so long to make my order. A customer came in 15mins. later and her order was up before mine. ??!! Wow...

While I was waiting, I saw the cashier go and clean underneath the condiment bar and went back to the register without washing his hands. He was on the floor cleaning Underneath the soda station. And I also saw the guy behind the counter who calls out the order and gives you your food, wipe his nose with a napkin and Didn't wash his hands after. SMH....

I heard a customer asked for a restroom and one of the workers said they didn't have one. So she told her friend that she needed to go across the street to Walgreens. Wow!! Again! For a place this big and in This location, I Really think they need to have a restroom. 

After 25mins. and 3 servings of the pickles, I finally got my order. I left and halfway to my destination, I noticed there was No bacon on my burger. I paid an extra $1.50 for the bacon, and it was not in the burger. If I didn't have a Giants game to attend at a certain time, I would of definitely went back to complain. I just have to count my loses and know not to go back to that location.
author: Edie G.

description: They burgers are really good. My boyfriend got me the mini burger which is just a regular size burger and he got the big one which is just double patty. Anyways it was good the fries were really greasy and kind of not worth it but we'd go back for the burgers.
author: Minnie C.

description:
Since there was a huge conference going on at Moscone, my office couldn't find a Super Duper close to us that would take advance orders. (We're located Downtown.) That is, until they called the location on Mission at Spear. On Thursday, March 17th, we order lunch for pick up to celebrate St Patrick's Day.

Since I'm not eating red meat for a while, I got the Chicken Sandwich: 100% natural free range chicken breast with chipotle aioli with with all The Free Stuff: Lettuce, Tomato, Red Onions, Jalapeños, Grilled Onions and Housemade Pickles ($7.50), add Jack cheese (+$0.50), Roasted Portabello (+$1) and Organic Egg (+$1.50). I love Super Duper's burgers, but I can't say I feel the same about their chicken sandwich. The chicken was dry instead of being moist and tender. It may have suffered a bit from transit as the cheese had also hardened and the egg didn't provide the soft runny yolk I love. The pickles don't actually come in the burger, but Super Duper was nice enough to pack a to go container filled with pickles on the side.

I did love the Garlic Fries: Fresh garlic & 6-month aged cheddar ($3.25) as usual. Though they did get a little soft and soggy in transit, I loved the garlicky and cheesy flavor. I decided to add Three Dips: Super Sauce, Housemade Mayo, Chipotle (+$1.50), but that may have been too much as the dips are very creamy and I believe mayo based. A touch of ketchup seemed to cut into the garlic fries better.

I'm so glad this Super Duper was able to accommodate our big office order, but I found myself wishing I had ordered a burger instead of a chicken sandwich. Next time Super Duper, I will have one of your delicious cheeseburgers!
author: Elena N.

description:
Hello! Pigeons do not belong in restaurants. I'm not sure what the fascination is with propping doors open to restaurants when pigeons and possibly other critters can easily wander in.

Despite seeing yet another one on my most recent visit, I am revising my previously dismissive review as I've come to crave the breakfast sandwiches here. While they are extremely expensive ($1.50 for an extra "over-hard" on a $5 sandwich is... egg-regious), the taste consistently exceeds my expectations. Savory goodness!

If I ever get up the gumption to try the burger again I *might* have reason to upgrade my review further, but five stars will be forever out of reach as long as pigeons roam the floors...
author: Marty F.

description:
Apparently I've been spoiling myself because I assumed this place would serve classier, more gourmet style burgers. I was wrong: it's a slightly-better-than-McDonald's fast food joint in disguise. 

I was hoping that the flavors would be complex since I did pay $8 for a 4 oz burger with an egg, but what I got was pretty tasteless. The bottom of the bun was soggy when I got it, and the burger itself had this "old, recycled oil" taste that made my nose turn right away.    

Honestly I was starving when I got here, so in retrospect this was a low bar to pass.... (An empty stomach is easy to please.) 

My guess is that people come here for its location and convenience over its tasty food.
author: Julia Y.

description:
Headed back to BART, I decided to make a pit stop here.

Opted for a mini-combo - 4oz patty w/ fries and a drink. Also got an ADULT dipped ice cream cone...I should have gotten the kids size because it was huge. The soft serve is OK, the chocolate dip made it a lot better.

The burger and sauce was great, fries were crispy, and the girl that took my order was very sweet and sincere.
author: Elijah B.

description: Amazing gormet burgers, delucious garlic fries, great beer and great attitudes! This place is a MUST!!!
author: Tara R.

description: I have eaten here 4 time in the last three months for lunch.   First time good meal, 2nd time sick to my stomach, 3rd time good meal, 4th time sick to my stomach.   So I'm 2 for 4 with this place.  Each time I ask for the hamburger cooked well done. I will point out the times I got sick was during lunch rush hour, the good meals I came early before the crowds.  But This 4th time will be my last time here, never again.   The odds are just not that good.
author: Lance S.

description: Wish I could give it less. They can't get a single thing right. Ordered a plain burger and they gave me a burger with EVERYTHING on it. Went back to get another one, they charged me for the second one, and did it again! Terrible service. I used to like this location but they service has gone down and I would not recommend this place at all.
author: Cole M.

description: Quite possibly the best burger in the area I have been to two of their stores here in the city and one in Marin and it is consistently fresh and tasty! The picked are awesome!
author: Paul D.

description: I was in the city for the day and I found this place on the way home. The food was great and the service, excellent. I would definitely recommend it.
author: K C.

description:
I don't find their burgers super exciting but their breakfast sandwiches and hash browns are amazing. 

The workers here are very nice and they're pretty quick with getting your food out. I wouldn't try to go here during the lunch rush though, the line gets pretty long.
author: Angelica P.

description:
As tourists in San Francisco, we arrived here after heading eastwards, wandering in from Chinatown, on a Wednesday afternoon around 1:00 PM. It wasn't overtly busy, and we were able to grab ourselves a table.

Service was decent, the garlic parmesan fries were absolutely delicious (a bit on the saltier side though), and the burger was perfectly juicy. If you're in the area, this isn't a bad option for a quick lunch, particularly if you're in a hurry.

For a burger, garlic parmesan fries, and a chocolate shake, our total came to $17.30.
author: Barbara D.

description: I have a man-child friend who will only eat burgers and fries. On this day, we tried to get him to eat at a normal restaurant but he moped like a kid who just had his iPad taken away. After growing tired of his sadness, which was killing our vibe, we decided to leave to find a place where he would happy. We heard about SDB from another friend and decided to check it out. It was AMAZING! Even the crybaby was in beef heaven. If you haven't been, you gotta go!
author: Jason M.

description: Super Duper lives up to its hype. The Super Burger with cheese is absolutely tasty and worth the money. The atmosphere is also pretty nice. My go to lunch spot when I'm at work. Keep the quality up!
author: Vivian C.

description: Great fast, casual dining in FiDi. My friend who ordered the super duper burger thought it was great, I ordered the chicken sandwich and thought it was pretty good, my friend who ordered the veggie burger thought it was good. Pricey for fast food, but high quality and great portions. Also, their chocolate dip soft serve is great- creamy, natural, cone and ice cream work together really well. Also, on weekdays during happy hour, they have Jenga at the tables!! But I would be wary of touching the pieces honestly lol
author: Jess L.

description:
Friendly customer service in person, but like everyone I date, they wouldn't return any of my calls. Accidentally left my bag outside and didn't realize until I was on BART, so I frantically called them, but got the answering machine every time. Pick up your phone Frances! Oops I mean Super Duper. Their answering machine said they were super duper busy, but when I came back, there was no one in line and they had nothing going on! Where have I experienced this before.. 

Anywho, this is the only negative thing I can say, veggie burgers were yummy, came with a donut, and everything's compost so I'll be back.
author: Jakob Eats Alone ..

description: Super juicy and cooked to perfection. Service was fast during the lunch rush. Cashier was friendly and helpful.
author: George T.

description: So satisfying after a day in the city !! Love their pickles and an interesting take on garlic fries.
author: Karina S.

description:
you know its funny - i have all these burger places bookmarked on yelp (popsons, for one! which is so close to my house..) but i always end up coming to super duper.  perhaps because it's located two blocks from the office and sometimes you're just in need of a burger for lunch?! maybe.

i usually go with the super duper burger (because duh), add egg and grilled onions (sometimes portobella too but then it becomes hard to hold it in your hands), and garlic fries (because if it's on the menu you should get it - just get some gum before your afternoon meetings).  the burger is super juicy and comes with lettuce, tomato, onion (i usually dont eat those toppings to save calories).
