lines can get long, and it's very popular as a happy hour destination (great deal on beer pitchers).  i really recommend this joint for a satisfying burger! i think the bun could be improved a bit..
author: Christina L.

description: Good hamburger very tasty, the blue cheese sauce was very good and strawberry milkshake was good.
author: Marie-Claire L.

description:
Friendly staff. Fresh burgers. Perfectly crisp fries with a soft center. We arrived before noon for lunch and it wasn't that busy, about one or two people were ordering ahead of us with two people working the registers. Tasha greeted each guest with a hello and asked if we had been there before. She said welcome back and proceeded to take our orders. She read my mind and gave me a cup for water after noticing the Starbucks in my hand. The burgers took about 7 minutes. Warm and juicy with a sesame seed bun equivalent to a mix of traditional dough/pretzel consistency. My only complaint is my roasted portobello mushrooms were cold. They weren't cooked with the burger, probably prepared beforehand. I like their garlic fries, but this time the amount of Parmesan overpowered the garlic. 

Unlimited pickles. I still haven't gotten a kids vanilla chocolate dipped cone (kids size is ok for adults too, as noted on their menu board).
author: Kristine F.

description: Hey. So I took my girlfriend on a date to San Francisco and it was our first time to Baker Beach we had such a great time and then I got really hungry and I said hey let's go look for a burger joint I took my baby to super Duper burgers and to be honest I haven't been off the toilet sense LOL it was entirely too greasy I might have artery damage now. The people there are Helen nice and I'm very happy with the service especially because I don't have to buy Ex-Lax now
author: Miley N.

description:
Yummy! Good burger, good fries. Good service, too. 

Stop by if you can.
author: Erin J.

description:
As good or better than Smash, Umami, etc.  Meat came out perfect in the 2 burgers I ate here.  Juicy, crispy exterior, and flavorful meat patty.  
Garlic Fries were just okay, would probably just get regular fries and the dippings sauces next time.
Sadly, both visits we were here the Ice Cream machine was down, so can't comment on the milkshakes or Ice Cream.

Steve
author: Steve M.

description:
Super Duper is super duper yummy lol
The first time, came for lunch with a coworker. I knew we had to show up early because the line gets ridiculous! Show up between 11:30-11:45 and you'll be good. Delivery time after you order was a very short wait as well. The staff was very friendly and the cashier was really welcoming. 
We both ordered cheeseburgers with an egg added, side of fries and a kids cookies and cream shake. The egg was cooked to perfection! I love biting into a burger and seeing the yolky goodness fall onto my tray then dipping my burger into the yolk. DELISH! The kids size for the shake was so cute too! 
I realized that they make FRESH mini donuts in the AM so I knew I had to visit again. I came back the next week and ordered 3 donuts (vanilla, chocolate and cinnamon sugar) and a sausage, egg and cheese breakfast sandwich. The sandwich wasn't too oily and it was made to order. The donuts were a perfect size too! They were definitely not mini, maybe like a medium. So not too big and not too small. You can't beat 3 donuts for $2 though! 
A week after my coworker brought in a dozen donuts and I was not mad about it =))
author: Nari M.

description: Been going here since they open best burger for your buck. They pickles are to die for
author: Michelle L.

description: I was in the area and have been to this location before.  I had the burger the first time i was there, and thought it was very tasty.  This time I went with the Chicken sandwich, and it was tender, and cooked perfect.  Cashier was friendly, overall good experience both visits.
author: Charlie G.

description:
Great service at this location. I guess they forgot to do my order because of a computer glitch and they found out without me pointing it out. They also refunded my entire order.

Food for vegetarians at Super Duper is great! Their veggie burger is good. Get everything on it. They also have fresh pickles, and i usually hate pickles but fresh pickles are good! 

Happy hour is 5-7pm on weekdays and then all day Sunday I believe. It is a good deal because you can get 15$ pitchers of beer which would come with 3 orders of fries!
author: Neil P.

description:
I wasn't really in the mood for a burger when I came here, so I went for the chicken sandwich instead. Best chicken sandwich ever!! The texture bun was great, the chicken had SO much flavor and was super tender, and the chipotle sauce added a slight kick which I found to be perfect. I also ordered a side of garlic fries. Those were okay. The texture of the fries was on the soggy side, but there was a lot of flavor from the garlic and the cheese. Overall though, the chicken sandwich was definitely the highlight. 

The line here can get pretty long but it moves surprisingly fast. Definitely excited to come back to try their burger! And maybe their milkshakes as well--those looked delicious!
author: Ashley Y.

description:
I wanted a quick bite before I headed out from SF on July 4th and this place was super busy. I ordered a single burger with everything on it and cheese and a small vanilla shake. 

The burger was excellent. Small but filling and the vanilla shake was truly delicious. Would return next time I'm in SF. Prices are decent and service is friendly.
author: Vaibhav R.

description: I went to Super Duper Burger for lunch and had a chicken sandwich and homemade pickles excellent choice. nice clean restaurant and excellent service I will go back again.
author: Kida J.

description:
Had lunch here on a Friday and it was one of the best veggie burgers I've had in awhile. While ordering the cashier was very friendly. It was loud and crowded but she got my long order correct. She was also very welcoming and made her scripted lines seem non scripted. 

It looks smaller than other burgers I've had but it's equally filling. I love how their menu is designed to make your burger very customizable. They cooked the veggie patty to a slight crisp which added to the texture. 

I couldn't resist getting the fries and the dips, though I ended up only liking one of them. I finished every scrap of my meal.

Everything is compostable or reusable, a fact that is quite common in SF but further down in the South Bay where I'm from its less prevalent.
author: Gary D.

description:
I'm a vegetarian, so I've only tried the vegetarian options here. 

GREAT fries. So good. Belgian style (I believe they're double fried, they taste like it anyway). 

Love their dipping sauces for the fries.

Veggie burger is really good, not the best I've ever had, but definitely in the top ten. 

Staff is always super friendly and often remember me. If you want to indulge try the strawberry milkshake. hands down best milkshake I've ever had.
author: Naomi T.

description: The meat from Super Duper is hands down the best quality that you can get from most burger joints around here.  Their meat is sourced from Niman ranch so the taste is really good and for the price you really can't get a burger better than Super Duper.   The free pickles are a really great side dish for those not looking to pay for fries. :).
author: Loi T.

description:
Went to Super Duper Burger for a quick bite during lunch hours and it is in a prime location on the corner of Mission and Spear. The line moved quickly and I got my food within five minutes!

I got a bacon super burger (two patties instead of one) with garlic fries--the burger was smaller than what I would have expected, but was good nonetheless. Got mine medium-rare rather than their usual medium and it came out well.

The garlic fries had a normal amount of garlic, but an excessive amount of cheese and oil, and I would probably opt for normal fries next time.
author: Justin H.

description: Got takeout while staying at a hotel a block away. The chicken sandwich was good enough, but the cold garlic fries pretty much ruined the experience.  I thought maybe they had cooled quickly on the short walk back to the hotel, but no - the grated cheese, even the cheese in the middle of the fries, had never melted.
author: Ian L.

description:
In terms of service - Super Duper is really super duper - haha ok I'll stop. 
But in all seriousness - fast food burger chains are a dime a dozen - what really stood out here is not the food in particular but the customer service and experience. 

Usually a line 30+ deep wouldn't even have me considering it as a lunch option but I decided to check it out and if anything leave if the wait was too long. Once on line, I saw the manager come out with french fry samplers for those waiting in line - wow! you just don't expect that level of consideration and service at a fast food chain. 

Further down the line they had a small post sign that gave you an estimated wait time to order at that point - nice touch. They're pretty efficient as it didn't turn out to be too bad of a wait even with all the people. Once at the register - they were quick with the order and offered me water while I waited for my to-go order without me even asking. The orders also came out fairly quick - whatever they're doing works - they got a good system going on. 

Food wise - the garlic fries ($3.25) are amazing. The burger is pretty good for the value ($5.50 small) but mine came out a bit dry. Perhaps it was b/c of the lunch rush. The homemade pickles are ok - I liked that it had a kick to it but I prefer sweeter pickles - this was pretty salty. 

Overall great experience - highly recommend if you're looking for a casual lunch/ burger joint in FiDi. They have plenty of indoor and outdoor seating as well.
author: Brenda L.

description:
I've been to a few different burger spots. From In-N-Out to Shake Shack and everything in between. So when I came to Super Duper Burger, I was a bit skeptical. I thought "it better be one amazing burger if the name of the place is Super Duper". 

Checked out this location while visiting some friends in the area. This location has outdoor seating area. There is also beer and wine on tap as well as other bottled options.

Ordering is quick and easy. Super duper burger with everything on it. Food was ready in a few minutes. Grabbed some pickles to go with it. The burger is perfectly cooked, juicy in the middle. Nice bun and crispy lettuce and onions. The pickles are great too. Nice crunch to them as well. 

Did the burger live up to the hype? Yes! The fries were nice too with a crispy exterior. If you're ever in the embarcadero area, make sure to come through Super Duper Burger for some excellent food.
author: Dennis Y.

description:
I've been here both for lunch and for breakfast! Definitely enjoyed the lunch I got - I opted for the chicken sandwich and it was really tasted. Chicken was juicy and tender and was balanced by the rest of the fillings inside the ciabatta bun and the chipotle sauce. I also split a small oreo milkshake with a friend, and they even made cute little mini milkshakes for the both of us. Yum! It gets pretty crowded during lunch with long lines, but the line moves quickly and you get your order relatively soon as well. Plus plenty of Indoor and outdoor seating!

The breakfasts are also a pretty good deal: an egg sandwich + a small coffee for only $5! You can even add a mini donut or cheese (both for $0.50 extra). Wasn't super impressed with the quality or taste of the egg sandwich - it was just an average egg muffin sandwich. But enjoyed the combo and the short wait time in the morning!
author: Kathy C.

description:
Super duper is my go to burger spot when in San Francisco. Ordered the mini combo with jalepenos and bacon. 

The burgers here are super delicious and they're pretty consistent on flavor every time I come here. Extremely fresh and the free pickles they offer are awesome too, nice crunch and a perfect way to counter the hearty burger. I love this place

Would I be back? Hell yes
author: Michael T.

description:
Surprisingly delicious! If I had anything negative to say it would be that the burger is somewhat small (even the super!) but I suppose that's a good thing and that my eyes can be too big for my stomach sometimes. 

The burger is a cross between the freshness of in and out and the greasiness of a Five Guys. super delicious and it gets messy so be sure to have napkins on hand.
author: Leo I.

description: Walking around the Embarcadero area I decided to search for a burger and found this spot via Yelp and I'm glad I visited. The burgers are cooked fresh, the fries have some great seasonings and the house-made pickles are outstanding! If you go, it's hard to get through the double burger - not just because it's a half pound of meaty goodness, but because it's so juicy that the buns get real soggy. It's a great one to split with a friend......
author: Jeff H.

description: Came here for a late lunch and the staff was extremely friendly. I ordered the mini burger with everything, overall a good burger with all the right condiments. The mini size is comparably a bit larger than an in n out cheese burger. I especially liked their homemade pickles. I will need to try their garlic fries the next time I visit.
author: Carter L.

description: Being from the East Coast, I have never heard of Super Duper until I got here and saw it everywhere. A coworker recommended it to me so I decided to try and I am so happy I did. I ordered the mini burger and it was the perfect size. I did add an egg, grilled onions, and pickles. The burger was cooked perfectly and the special sauce was delicious. The garlic fries on the side was super tasty and a generous portion. It had a strong garlic flavor and was topped with shredded cheese. My friend is a vegetarian and also loved her veggie burger. Its based with hummus and cucumber. There a pickles and ketchup near the drink station if you want to add them to your burger. This was one of my favorite spots in SF and wish they would come to the DMV.
author: Khoi N.

description: Great burgers, but they have mice in the restaurante, it was disgusting and really dangerous for people's health. I told this to one of the staff and they were not even surprise, they did nothing.
author: Constanza P.

description:
Quite honestly the BEST BURGER In SF. 

Period. End of sentence.

Yes, the lines are a little long and for a reason, don't let it intimidate you it's only 10 min during Peak Lunch Time and WORTH the short wait... they actually have it COOKED FRESH AND TO YOUR ORDER! 
Once you e buzzer goes off, they have your Delicious, Perfectly Cooked burger, waiting for you! You go towards the kitchen where they pass you your tray and WOW!!

Once you get this burger up to your mouth, take a bite, you taste JUICY, HOT, FRESH BEEF perfectly lightly seasoned with pepper and little salt.

I was too consumed into this amazing burger to notice that my whole arm from hand down was dripping with juice. 

No complaints.. lots of happy customers!! Thanks
author: Trey C.

description:
Seriously a great burger! Visiting San Francisco, I was told I had to try this place. I was not let down by the hype. It was pretty tasty and they also have good fries. The milkshakes are really good, but rich. I couldn't finish it. 
    So a nice juicy burger with all the fixins. I had the mini burger and shared a fry with my friend. It definitely satisfied my hunger. I did feel that the sauce on the burger was a tad bit too salty, so if you are sensitive to salt, then ask for it on the side so you can decide how much to put on your burger. I came here twice in the four days I was in town, so you can see how much I loved the food.
author: Nicole E.

description:
I went here today. I work in the area and I got here a lot and usually get the same thing. A mini with cheese and an egg. 

So I got back to my desk and unwrapped my burger. The egg is usually runny. Today it looked so gross. Completely overcooked. I couldn't eat it so I took it off. The burger was great which is the reason I didn't give one star. I spent extra for the egg. I feel ripped off.
author: Christine A.

description:
Sometimes the breakfast sandwiches are good but it's really inconsistent. I've had totally cold ones where the egg is 100% cooked through and it's disappointing because the sausage or bacon won't be warm either. 

The burgers are good. It's much more solid for burgers and lunch or dinner options.
author: Alli J.

description:
Walked by it once, hungry.  Long lines - put a hold on it.  Hey, it's my first time in SF - i'm sure i'll run into more food that looks awesome.

But then I found the bay and the bridge and the view and...forgot about food.

Now...super hungry.  At this point, if I saw one more person walking around with a delicious looking dipped soft-serve cone I thought I would maybe...probably just grab it from their hand.  So...back to Super Duper.

Opted for the chicken sandwich with everything (free) and the other column of (free) everything...so this guy had everything on top of everything.  If you are going to pack a sandwich that high, it is important to have the right bread.  Yup.  Their brioche-type bun did the job.

An excellent place to sit outside and people watch, drinking root beer like it's my job (I can't remember the last time I had soda so this was a treat) waiting for the buzzer thing to go off.

Pro tip: Load up on the jarred pickles.  Amazing.  I'm a pickle guy so this was just the side I needed.  On a second visit...gotta try those garlic fries.  The people next to me had them and they smelled very much like the intense garlic fries I intently traverse Yankee Stadium for.

The chicken sandwich was awesome, the secret sauce reminded me of In-N-Out (but still different in its own, excellent way) and before I leave SF, I MUST try the dipped soft serve.

Even if it's only the kids size...it must be done.
author: Tyler R.

description: Juicy and delicious, best burger around soma. Juicy and delicious, best burger around soma.
author: Jess C.

description: You had me at free pickles!  Tasty burgers and fast, friendly service at a reasonable price.  YAY!!!
author: Lynn A.

description:
Had their burger years ago, and this rainy day brought me in although I was headed elsewhere :). Burger was great; efficient service, good price, easy to get a seat minus the pigeons walking around, haha... I guess they don't like the rain.  :). Cashier clerk very friendly.  Had the fries, super plain, heard of salt and oil? (Maybe I am comparing them to the not so healthy McDonalds fries)...Won't order again, and it was slap on my hand that I shouldn't be eating fries anyway.. have a waist I need to keep trim 

....keeping as 5 star for burger, efficient and attentive service.
author: Neveen B.

description:
My go to burger spot and favorite fast casual burger. I love that they're organic grass fed and cooked medium rare. 

There's always a long line to order but it moves relatively fast and the food comes pretty soon after. There's wine and beer on tap and free spiced pickles. 

Veggie burger is also pretty good and garlic fries are delicious. Ive been coming almost every Friday for a year and never get sick of it!
author: Daniela J.

description: Don't come within two hours of closing if you want any kind of customer service. Went Saturday night around 6:30 pm and the entire crew was only focused on closing the store rather than service to paying customers.
author: Lewis H.

description:
I was there a couple weeks ago with my roommate and we were so hungry. We had a Super Burger for each and a French Fries to share. We spent $24 for both of us, so I'd say it's a pretty good deal.

I think it was AWESOME! :D
I've always been a fan of american burgers and this one is definitely one of the best in San Fransisco. The buns are delicate, patty, or should I say patties because they serve 2 patties for Super Burger and they were well-seasoned and so juicy. Vegetables are fresh (lettuce, red onion, and tomato), and I loooove their homemade pickles!! It's just sourly good. Fries were OK, I should've ordered Garlic Fries though (maybe for next time).

Overall, service was good, food was great, I'll come back for sure!!
author: Annisa J.

description: I decided to give their chicken sandwich and try and I will never regret my decision ever to switch to ordering this. First off it's much bigger than a super duper burger and second it's cheaper. The sauce in the sandwich is to die for! This location is right in the financial district and is very close walk to the ferry building. For seating, my party of 6 ended up sitting at the stools because there were no tables inside large enough to fit all of us. If it were a nicer day we'd definitely sit outside.
author: Sarah H.

description:
Been here before. Burgers are decent. Unfortunately, garlic fries were cold. I never understood people who complained about cold food until today. There was 0% warmth in the fries. Either an arctic chill passed by in the 5 seconds it took to go from pick up to my seat or they served me cold fries. I'd guess the latter. 

I'm most annoyed that the servers served it to me. There's no way they weren't aware that the fries had been sitting there too long. It's too bad, I'm actually a fan of the burgers.
author: Stephanie L.

description:
Very delicious if you're looking for something cheap and looking for a similar taste to In n Out on the West Coast or Shake Shack on the East Coast. Depending on what you order, it could be as cheap as $8 for a burger and fries or as expensive as $15 for the larger burger with fries.
Very simple menu, 2 different sizes of hamburgers: regular or large and also comes with lettuce, tomato, red onion, and their sauce which recommend. There is also the option of a chicken burger if you don't want beef. Three different variations on fries and they definitely are worth the price for the length you get for each fry. Also an option for salad and dessert too. 
Lots of seating and this restaurant is between 2 pokestops! Definitely coming back again!
author: Jessica Y.

description:
Wow I love this place so much, I'm a little bit ashamed I haven't written a review. 

When you go, here's what to get if you have amazing taste: cheeseburger with aged cheddar and everything on it, extra jalepenos, and a fried egg. For your side, the garlic parmesan fries and all the homemade pickles your heart desires. Just looking at the pictures of the food is making me a little koo-koo.

You're welcome and enjoy.
author: Crystal C.

description: I love super duper.  Freaking love super duper burgers.  But this is the second time I've had breakfast at this location and spent ten bucks (including tip) for a cold and tasteless breakfast sandwich and potato thing.  They do burgers well.  They are super duper.  They can't cook an egg.
author: Spencer T.

description:
Any place that makes my nephew happy on his birthday weekend deserves 5 stars. I mean, they have burgers, ice cream, milk shakes, and of course fries. And let's not forget, they really provided amazing customer service. My experience at Super Duper was great. The cashier was patient with my nephew when he couldn't decide what to order and was doing his best to read the whole description of the menu's items (What's aioli???). This place is decently price and offers all natural, vegetarian fed and freshly grounded (daily) beef which would make this place stand out. 

I ordered the super duper burger with cheese and grilled onions, tomatoes and lettuce ($7, plus .75 for cheese) and a side of their garlic french fries, to share with my hubby. I will say this, the beef itself tasted really good and well seasoned AND cooked to medium perfection. The bun is soft, warm and not too much. The garlic fries weren't too garlic-y but for a day out and without a toothbrush handy, it's a o k. My nephew ordered a super cookies and cream shake which was more than enough for him. With that being said, I had my fair share of that myself and it was delicious. Surprisingly it wasn't too sweet and it had enough cookie taste in there to satisfy the inner and semi hidden cookie monster inside of me. 

Tip:
Bathrooms are in a different building.
author: Catalina T.

description: Gotta give them credit: After reading my review, they checked their soft-serve machine and found a problem. They fixed it and offered me a free soft-serve next time I'm there. I'll take them up on it and update the review again when I do!
author: Carl B.

description:
I'm not a big fan of teeny tiny fancypants burgers that leave me craving pizza after a meal.

So said, I had yet to visit this Super Duper location despite the close proximity because the line is usually out the door and the burgers seemed a little small to my tastes.  I cater to the 1/2 lb crowd and will go in search of that which will cater to me my large burger patty inclinations!

This spot gets jam packed during the lunch hour so be prepared to grab a seat anywhere and as soon as possible.  I always ordered the double patty with a side of french fries.  The burgers here are greasy, bad for you, heavy, but delicious.  What is one suppose to do?

Inexpensive, fast, and a good burger for those working along Spear and need a burger to hit the spot of the day.

Staff is efficient, service is quick.
author: Miika M.

description: Love this place. Best prices and the food choices and quality is good. The only reason I gave 4 stars is that there is no consistency in their garlic fries. One day I got there after rush lunch hour and garlic fries were so different in a very good way like somebody paid attention and took time to prepare them. Otherwise during busy time they literally file like regular fries with little bit garlic and cheese thrown on top. Overall, I'll definitely go back and recommend if you are looking for a good burger place and milkshakes.
author: Raja T.

description:
Definitely my favorite overall burger in San Francisco at a joint without waiter service.  Actually, might even be my favorite compared to traditional restaurants too.  Their burgers are delish and filling and reasonably priced (for San Francisco).

Sausage, Egg, Cheese Breakfast Sandwich: Like a fancy and tastier version of the McMuffin.  Since their burgers are amazing, you can imagine how good their ground sausage patties must be.  The eggs are somewhere between a scramble and an omelette with many thin layers folded on top of each other in a nice square.  They put real cheddar cheese on *both* sides of the bread!  And their English muffin tastes fresh... though I do wish they'd toast it a bit.

Super Burger w/ Cheese: Better than In-N-Out.  Umami Burger offers more complexity, but Super Duper has a classic taste in a good portion.  Though, ultimately I prefer a Shack Stack (from Shake Shack) over this.. but that is not an option in this city.  Something about the sear of the burger patty that just tastes awesome, even on the section that isn't covered by fixings.

French Fries: Decent.  Some are crispy and some are limp.  Better to have decent fries than no fries I suppose.  It pains me to say it, but few trump McDonald's fries.

Pickles: Yas!  I love me some fresh sour pickles (...sorry nasty bread & butter).  I find that a bite of pickle after each bite of burger is a perfect way to keep my mouth from going into greasy overload.  It's like the pickled ginger to my sushi, helps cleanse my palate so I can appreciate each mouthful of burger.
author: Adam B.

description: Do not come to this one ....way better customer service at super duper on Kearny street, I would rather walk down there for lunch
author: Mario L.

description:
Good burger, good fries, long lines but decently efficient.

I got the "mini" burger (which is really just an average sized burger, with one 4 oz patty rather than the two that come with the "super duper" option), with a fried egg. It was a bit messy to eat (egg yolks have a way of oozing everywhere, but by what I can only assume was magic, I managed to not drip all over my white jacket), but tasty! Their house sauce was yummy, too.

Overall, it wasn't the very best burger I've ever eaten, or anything, but it was a solid, classic burger that definitely feels and tastes a couple steps above fast food, while still being pretty fast. 

I'd definitely go back - and maybe throw some soft-serve into the mix ;-)

Oh! And I almost forgot to mention their self-serve pickles, which I'm pretty sure were flavored with fennel. I liked those a lot!
author: Liz F.

description:
I went there couple of weeks ago with me wife and ordered 2 mini meal(VEGGIE) and the person who was taking order has not specified(VEGGIE) while taking order, So when we got our order we found out that that was beef burger and we went back to the counter and said that we didn't ordered this and can you please replace it with VEGGIE one. They agreed upon that and said they will replace it and give it to our place where we were sitiing. SO after a while there representatives came in with our order(VEGGIE) burgers and also 2 more fries(Which we already had before and did returned back with beef burger). He said that's fine after compelling several times to him to take fries back, he gave the fries along with VEGGIE burger and than he asked us what went wrong with our order, we explained everything and he said sorry for that as well and said that's our mistake and will take care of that and he talked very politely to us and said let me know if you need anything else. 

That's what my feeling was, And I just wrote this not because we got our ordered replaced but coz he was so humble and talking very nicely. I'm really impressed with there service. 
Thanks for the fabulous service and delicious food as well.
author: Harpreet G.

description: Super duper indeed. I always have the chicken sandwich and even though it is not their main speciality it is truly awesome.
author: Nikunj Y.

description:
Always a good place to grab a quick burger in SF. It fits the guidelines of food quality in SF by being organic, grass-fed, and eco-friendly. 

I would recommend getting the Super Duper burger. Massive burger with two 4 oz patties with their special super sauce. If you're feeling in the mood to put on some calories and go on a sugar high the shakes are worth tryingl.
author: Kunal T.

description:
Yum! My go to place for burger and fries in the financial distirct! And why not play a game of janga while you're there? Relaxing spot for a burger in downtown SF. With both indoor and outdoor seating, visitors have the option to sit outside and enjoy the weather if it is nice.  

The staff here are also great! Super duper nice (see what I did there?!)!
author: Aletta B.

description:
One of my favorite places for days when I'm craving for some not-so-healthy food. Absolutely love their burger with super sauce. My go-to meal? Mini burger with garlic fries. The garlic fries and be a hit or an almost-hit. They sometimes go a little bit overboard with the garlic sauce and the fries has a garlic-spicy taste. But most of the time, they're very excellent. They got great proportions on their burger, just the right amount of meat to bread. Not a huge lettuce fan, so I usually just get mine with cheese, super sauce, and tomato:) Their chicken sandwich is also very excellent, but the burger is my go-to.
If you're feeling extra hungry, they also serve amazing milkshake and ice cream. However, most of the time, I'm too full after the burger and fries. My recommendation for milkshake: cookies & cream!
author: Sharon L.

description:
Order an garlic fries at non-rush hour (Saturday) , wait 15-20 mins to get an cold Garlic fires.
When start eating....super crispy because it is over fry ...and that is third or fourth time i got this problem.
author: Jason H.

description:
BEST GARLIC FRIES EVER. enough said. 

But seriously, the only that I've tried from here was their Garlic Fries and they were straight up legit. Perfectly crispy without being crunchy and tons of garlic like there should be. Good portion size too. 

Pro-tip: Come by for late night drunchies- you won't regret it ;)
author: Sam L.

description: Better than McDonald's and Burger King me and my homegirl came over here to get something to eat in between events so I told her about Super Duper Burger we both got bacon cheeseburgers with everything with garlic fries the garlic fries were amazing and the burger was good your best bet is to not go during Peak cuz you will have to wait
author: Maria R.

description:
Love this place. It's across the street from my office. The line can get pretty long, so if you are going on a weekday for lunch, I would recommend going before noon or after 1pm.

I usually get the mini burger (sometimes with avocado) and a side of fries.

Tip!: If you go after 6, you get free fries if you order a beer or wine!
author: Cynthia M.

description: Came here because the reviews happen to be good mostly. How ever with a $13 combo price the burger was a greasy let down and not worth the money. To top it all off the cashier had an attitude when I asked for a plastic to go cup for my drink instead of the dirty drink glass he was handing me.
author: Ali T.

description:
Yum! Glad the decision to stay in the city longer than anticipated was made the day this establishment received a visit. Honestly, don't recall many details from the visit, as it had been quite a long, stressful, and emotional day.

Their burgers are juicy and really delicious but a little pricey, but then it is the city, rent is probably high. At this location, there is ample indoor and outdoor patio seating, pretty open and spacious, occasionally a pigeon might fly in and share the space, it's kind of funny to randomly see a pigeon inside the restaurant. 

Apparently, this restaurant makes their own pickles, and you're welcome to as much of them as you want. Pickles are somewhat of a fave, yup, it's quirk. Didn't really care for these homemade pickles, they didn't taste like pickles. 

The next time a visit to the city is made, returning to this restaurant will definitely one of the options. Would like to give their milkshakes a try, they all sound delicious!
author: Pam F.

description:
Three Course Meal- Burger, Fries and Ice Cream!

This was the second time I visited this SF chain. My first experienced at a different location was AOK. A friend had told me to make sure I try the chocolate covered ice cream cones.

For whatever reason, this location served me a better burger than the location on Chestnut. This one was actually juicer and the avocado was "oh so good!" I added fries and they were pretty tasty. Fresh Fries would be a better name and they were fresh and crispy! 

Three corse meal? Yup, I got desert. One Ice Cream with chocolate to go please!

So many variables at restaurants. This is the same chain and within walking distance but I had a much better experience here.

Super Duper and a three course meal...I am a fan!
author: Nick H.

description: Grabbed a quick bite to eat before heading to the festivities. Very open and spacious with excellent service. It was very quick even during lunch hour. Fairly inexpensive and the doughnuts are just like the pier. The best part is the fresh side of pickles and jalapeños once you pick up your order. A little messy when you bite into your burger with all the fixings but it's a burger so chow down. Loved the food and the garlic fries are actually better than the ballpark. This is a hot spot so come early to beat the rush.
author: Omar R.

description:
You got to love super duper for the Consistency.  But this I got to try the Spiked Milk Shake.  It was pretty tasty.  The Milk Shake with Soju mixed in.  It came with Garlic fries so that was kind of cool.   I do recommend it for a try.   This is my first time at this location and we ate outside.   The inside didn't seem as big as the market or the target location.   But it has outside seating.  

There is no bathroom in there so you either go to 1 market.  I recommend going across the street to Rincon Center.   Get passed the post office and go to the left where the food court is.   It seems closer.
author: Homer S.

description:
Good lunch spot during the week.  Arrive before noon to beat the crowds and get a table.

Burger, garlic fries and a milkshake.  Yes, order them all!
author: Jill S.

description: Next to In-N-Out, IMO Super Duper is just that. Great tasting, and filling. Great shakes too!
author: Matt T.

description: Unfortunately this place is right near my work...so I'm constantly lured here by the delicious burgers and fries, not to mention the great chocolate milkshakes. They also make their own pickles which are delicious. Every now and then they'll have left over donuts from breakfast and they give them away free with lunch. Which takes an already unhealthy but delicious lunch and turns it up to 11.
author: Brandon G.

description:
Wait time was about 8 minutes. Place is often crowded. Workers there were very nice. Condiment/Soda station was clean. There you can grab mustard, ketchup, pickles, salt, napkins, and straws.

Ordered a super burger with cheese and everything but jalapenos and pickles. Totaling $8.53. Burger was decent size. 2 Juicy patties. Cheese was like 1 thin melted slice, very big sad face. Not sure if the onions on mine were grilled but oh well. Didn't get much secret sauce on mine. Very sad. But all in all I still liked the burger. Will come back when I'm craving some..

Had a free sample of the fries and sauce. OMG the sauce was BOMB. Reeeeeeeal good stuff.
author: Benita M.

description:
The local Super Duper franchise is still one of my favorite places to grab a quick burger and beer combine in one place at an affordable price. 

Unlike the other locations, the newest location, which is located near the Ferry Plaza building, is busy during lunch time with workers in the Financial District. But dinner-time is much quieter with less people at night. At least it is during the birth of the new location. 

Recently from one of the other locations, I was hooked on Super Duper's Chicken Sandwich. And my debut of the newest location, I ordered that same Chicken Sandwich. For $7.00, I get a piece of grilled chicken breast, lettuce, tomato, onions, spicy sauce and melted Blue cheese ($.50 extra) in a toasted Ciabatta Roll. Every now and then, I like to switch up my variation from the great food here. And the Chicken sandwich is continued to be my favorite.

But there are no combo meals with my chicken sandwich. I also added a side order of fries and a pint of Scrimshaw Pilsner. My meal totaled close to $15.00. My meal: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/super-duper-burgers-san-francisco-7?select=IQefT7sL144rscow6WjNVg#j2s6rjmJV3DnmcQUm6xtnQ

I was listening to music from the 80's as I was enjoying my meal. Indeed I was "Hungry like the wolf!"

This new Super Duper location closes much earlier than the other locations as well. At least this location is least crowded that serve great burgers. Come here early for dinner and you have the rest of the night to do whatever.
author: Matt G.

description: Hi Ed!  Thank you so much for responding to my review and giving me a complimentary burger.  I ordered my burger and instructed them to do a quick sear on the patties before transferring to the buns.  Burger was still very juicy and the buns did not get wet and soggy. I was treated so well by your staff and your manager, Angel, introduced himself to me and thanked me for coming back. Your service has been top notch.  You guys have delivered an now I'm giving you five stars!
author: Marlon P.

description: Cheeseburger mini combos with fries and a drink~ burger cravings for the family happily fulfilled : )
author: judy l.

description:
This Super Duper location opened up about a month ago in the building that I work in, and I finally made my way here today. This one seems bigger than the one on Market St., but this location is no different than all the other ones during lunch time: there is a long line out the door. Nonetheless, they take orders pretty quickly, and you can get through the line in about 15 minutes. 

I ordered the mini burger, which is just under $5, and I added an egg (they cook it sunny-side up) for an additional $1.50. I also couldn't resist an order of fries for $2.25. Even though I came during prime lunch hour, it only took about 10 minutes to receive my food. My burger, with egg yolk running down the sides, was juicy and delicious without being overly greasy. Next time, though, I'll skip the egg; besides the extra wetness it gives the burger, I can't actually taste the egg. The fries were comparable to In-N-Out's fries in terms of texture, as it's on the softer side, but they are a little larger/fatter.

Overall, Super Duper is one of the better chain burger joints. I'll be back very soon to try a chicken sandwich and a chocolate-dipped ice cream cone!
author: Celia K.

description: I love this place! Great hamburgers and fries. So glad its close to my house, and now its even bigger with them expanding to the space next door.
author: R H.

description: Honestly one of my favorite burgers ever. Enough said. (But also the fries are hella good!)
author: Mia A.

description:
Awesome, customizable burgers, freshly shaken up shakes, garlic fries and signature pickles, makes this burger joint chain superb!

I like their additives of egg, bacon, avocado and portabello mushroom onto my burger! 

I love my burgers loaded and messy!

Speedy, friendly staff and spacious seating!
author: Tiffany D.

description:
There is nothing this good at this price point in this part of the city. 

I got a burger and a beer, and I was endlessly impressed by the simplicity and excellence of this burger joint. The burger was tasty as hell, cooked perfectly, all nice and pink in the center, with fresh tasty toppings. Plenty of food, but not enough to put you in a coffin. There are a few beers on draft, all at reasonable prices. 

The atmosphere is open and unpretentious, which is refreshing. 

It doesn't have to be hard, but you can easily pay double for the same quality around here, and on the other end of the spectrum, McDonald's is only a buck or two less and a tenth the quality (and no beer!). 

They really hit a sweet spot here with great food, great prices, and good setting.
author: Christian J.

description: This place was so so SO good. I ended up here with my parents when we were in San Francisco for a day and I'm so glad we did. Their fries are bomb and their veggie burger is even better. The only downside was that you have to walk outside to get to the bathroom which was a bit inconvenient, but other than that I definitely recommend this place for a good bite to eat.
author: Cindy H.

description: Just ordered a kid size ice cream. Saw the cup she gave me and compared it to my co workers kid size... It's half of what she got. Annoyed!!! Here's a picture. It's their water cup with 1/4 of ice cream. This is bs all the other times I've come here it's been at least full! Hope someone sees this that owns the place. This place being cheap. They didn't even give me the cone I asked for and paid for. I gave the lady a long look, but walked out as I was so angry from the size of the damn thing.
author: Daniel L.

description:
Definitely a great bang for you buck kind of burger joint. Prices like In-N-Out but with a fancier ambiance and outdoor seating touch -- I'm a fan! 

I got the Super Duper Burger with cheese, bacon, and topped with everything. The patty was juicy, but lacking in flavor. Thank goodness for ketchup and mustard. Loved the complimentary homemade pickles though! Good size and tasty overall.

I prefer In-N-Out over this -- they got the onions (both styles), the chiles, and it comes out cheaper. Yet, Super Duper is pretty yummy and worthwhile.
author: Ellen W.

description:
The burgers here are very solid.  Fresh, tasty and well prepared.  Lots of optional toppings available.  I thought the fries were just "okay", I expected a burger place to have better fries.  The pickles are homemade and I was not a fan.  They tasted like cucumber slices that had been sitting in vinegar overnight.  If you like a strong vinegar taste, like you're one of those weirdos that buys salt & vinegar potato chips, you'd probably like the pickles here.

Super (pun intended) popular place and it was jammed at rush hour.  Service was really quick however and they kept the line moving.  Found a nice sunny spot to sit outside about 20 yards away and enjoyed the weather.
author: Bill J.

description:
Love their homemade pickles! I can eat three trays of them. 

Some stores offer free fried and or shakes ontology of a meal. I've never opted for a mini burger and always went for the regular sized burger. 

It tastes alright. But doesn't have that secret sauce like Ike's or in and out burgers.
author: Vicky L.

description:
This is my favorite Super Duper Burger location. It's away from Market and super close to Embarcadero. I love the manager who use to be at the Market location - she is very sweet.

For a fast food burger - I think their burgers are really juicy and flavorful. I like to get mine with cambozola cheese which really kicks up the flavor meter.

I love this for families. My son loves their grilled cheese and the kid size organic swirl cones are a favorite for him.
author: Viyada S.

description:
The name of the restaurant definitely justifies the taste . We ordered one chicken sandwich and one vegetarian burger and both of them were super yummmm. 
The vegetarian one had one patty onion avacado lettuce etc . Tasted so well. 
The chicken one was also really nice . Loved the ambience az well. 
Great options for vegetarians :) 
Open one in fremont too pls :)
author: Rohit K.

description:
This was my first time at this location, and I have to say that Super Duper produces a consistently good burger. And while the burgers are consistently good, the real highlight for me is the house made sweet and spicy pickles. 

Super Duper Burger, I am a fan.
author: Travis G.

description:
I visited this place a few times while I was visiting San Francisco. I thoroughly enjoyed my burger every time - it was juicy and flavorful. It is made to order, so you might have to wait a few minutes to get your food. This is something that I actually prefer and I don't have any problem waiting at all. The fries are good, as are the milkshakes. And the service was friendly each time. I will say that I think it's a tad bit pricey - but I'm also from the Midwest visiting the West Coast, so you may take that with a grain of salt.

All in all, I'd definitely recommend stopping by here for a good, relatively quick, burger.
author: Brandon S.

description: Really good burger it's so delicious if someone going to ask me would you go back there my answer will be yes because the burger is so delicious & + they give you a good attention
author: Gilbert B.

description: This location is probably one of the best locations for Super Duper Burger I've ever been to! It's a really nice atmosphere and love that there's some outside seating for those nice days to eat some lunch. My favorite order combo is their Chicken Sandwhich and their Garlic Fries! It's delicious. I'm actually craving some right now. The service in this location is always amazing, always greeted with a smile. I always come back to this location whenever I'm in the San Francisco area. Keep it up, guys!
author: Louisse G.

description: Burgers are always delicious (my favorite burger anywhere in the Bay Area),  great fries and chocolate shakes! I love the chicken sandwich, and their homemade pickles are to die for! Also, the staff here is always so friendly and helpful!! :) Enjoy! You won't regret coming here.
author: Toccara S.

description: The burgers are on point. They are all hipstery and from cows that had the "burger donor" sticker on their driver's license or something. There are 3 beers on tap, Scrimshaw, Racer 5, and Tangerine Wheat, and a small selection of wines. The happy hour pitchers/bottles include 2 orders of fries. Every table has a set of rectangular wooden bricks to use to make your beverages into mojitos I think.
author: Dano G.

description: Super Duper Burger never fails to impress me. This location in specific is always clean, quick and very friendly. Whenever I am in the area I always try to go here and bring new friends who have yet to try these burgers. The super burger is a classic and you can't go wrong with that. Be sure to get some garlic fries, I always get the fries and the chipotle dipping sauce and use a little inside the burger. I also appreciate the fact that they have a vegetarian option and also chicken sandwiches, so there is something for everyone. There are a lot of burger choices in this area but Super Duper Burger is always on the top of my list. A must try.
author: Jeovany F.

description:
Maybe my burger craving was really strong last time I was here, but that last burger I had seriously hit the spot right. I ordered a bacon cheeseburger. Let me tell you that it tasted like how I imagined a a bacon cheeseburger - a smokey flavor with cheese for a good contrast; beef and bacon griller perfectly with just the right amount of grease to make you feel guilty (in a good way) but not guilty enough to regret it. Their burgers are a definitely a must try!

I also enjoy their happy hour deal, which runs (I think) 5-7pm on Mondays to Friday, and all day Saturdays. The deal is $15 for a pitcher of beer plus a choice of fries on the sides (including garlic). Even if you don't get the $15 pitcher, you still get a side of fries during happy hours. Their fries are not as greasy as their burgers - which is a good thing - because they are golden and crispy with just the right amount of salt for flavoring.  I recommend the garlic fries. And like their burgers, their fries are a must try!

Also if you get here early enough, they have a jenga set they rent out for free during happy hour! It's a great way to kill time with good company, good food, and a good location close to the Embarcadero.
author: KJ S.

description:
3.5 Stars

My last visit to Super Duper was decent but nothing noteworthy. With their latest location so close to my office I figure I had no excuse not to give it another try.

I decided this time to get the Super Combo two 4oz patties + fries + drinks for $10.50 + tax. 

The burger was juicy and tender with a great meaty bite. At one point, I found myself lost in my meal for a brief moment. My only critique would be that it could have used more salt. 

I am obsessed with fries and can eat them everyday! They are my guilt pleasure that I only allow in various occasions for the fear that I will balloon back up. A chubby boy I don't want to be no more! 

With that being said, the fries at super duper are solid but again needed more salt

Overall Thoughts

Suffice to say, this location definitely made me more of a fan, only time will tell if they stay consistent
author: Eddie W.

description:
During my time at the Exploratorium, we had a collaboration with a Tibetan Buddhist monastery in South India on a sensory perception exhibit. When I finally got the chance to meet with the group of visiting monks I (of course) asked them what they first ate upon arrival in SF and how they perceived it. They responded that they tried a burger that was the most Super Duper and nodded enthusiastically when I asked if they enjoyed. Sold!

I like how this location has outdoor seating so I can soak up some rays (ha) while people watching. After I pay, my order takes about five minutes to come out. The mini burger fills me up and if I'm really hungry I'll add an egg or go for the Super burger. The free range chicken breast sandwich is also a great alternative if you don't feel like a burger. Don't worry because the all meat here is juicy, tender, and 100% natural. You'll only feel guilty if you pair it with a shake. Straus organic soft serve shake with strawberries, come to mama!

I'm glad that the monks pointed me in the right direction, in more ways than one. Don't you love how easily food transcends the language + culture barrier? :)
author: Jenny Q.

description: Fantastic Super Duper Burger spot. A bit of a walk from my work place, but definitely worth the walk. This is definitely one of the bigger Super Duper Burgers and I will say that the place is very busy during lunch hours. I went to eat here with two other co-workers around 1:00pm and we waited in line maybe about ten minutes. The wait for food was about another ten. I ordered a mini burger, fries and strawberry milkshake. The prices aren't exactly the cheapest (i paid almost $20 bucks for everything), but its good quality food. The burger was great. Just the right size to now make me feel bloated afterwards. The meat was nice and juicy and the bread was soft and complimented everything well. The shake was to die for! Absolutely delicious and there was even some extra in a tin cup to drink up after. I really liked the fries as well. Crispy and not soggy. I enjoyed this spot and will definitely return to get my burger on!
author: James R.

description:
I'm excited about Super Duper because of their chicken sandwiches.   Being on a year ending health kick, I was hoping that their chicken sandwich would be as good as their beef burgers and the sandwich I got was pretty good.  The chicken was a decent sized piece of meat...just as big as the burger.

While this place is still new and the line to order and get your food can take more than 20 minutes total, I still like what they offer.  I did try their milkshakes for a late afternoon sugar run and those shakes were pretty good too.  I wanted to try my shake "spiked" with alcohol but they didn't have their liquor license yet when I ordered.

The lines to order are still long and I'm not going back until the hype dies down.
author: Ben H L.

description:
Super Duper 1 year ago, placed a lunch order was waiting for 20+ mins when I finally got the food.

Super Duper Employee, " Oh! Sorry about the long wait. Let me walk process a refund for you."

Super Duper Today, waiting for 20+ mins 

Employee (after ignoring me for 5 mins- "As you can see they are cooking the food!"
Me - "Yes I know that but can you check on my order"
Employee "THEY ARE COOKING THE FOOD!!!"
Me "Ok whatever"

Yes I get it they are cooking the food, you are handing out orders and I have been staring at my phone for the last 30 mins. The correct response if you are running a restaurant is, "I WILL CHECK UP and GIVE YOU AN ETA". I don't think its un-reasonable to check up on your order and I expect basic courtesy from the employees.
author: Prantap B.

description: As good as burgers can get, Super Duper is Super Duper :) nice patty, tasty french fries, cozy setting, greasy buns...hmm...satisfying !
author: Chean L.

description: Every time I go out of town I try and find local burger joints that aren't found back at home. During my trip to San Francisco I stumbled upon Super Duper Burger. With a name like that I had hopes. Thankfully, it didn't disappoint. The staff was friendly and willing to make a suggestion when asked. The place was clean and the food was delicious. I'm making it a point to go back one more time before I leave town. Thank you to the staff at Super Duper Burger. You guys were great.
author: Shauntai G.

description:
Super Duper Burger. Their shakes are made with skim milk so skip those. fries are edible and soda is the same type of fast food selection just cost more. they do have beer. and their tea is ok.

Manager corrected below, but tastes like skim milk to me.

I wont be back to that location, the others are so much better.
author: Dean N.

description:
This chain should be nationwide! But love that SF area can claim it as an exclusive burger joint.  Phone order up until 11:00 and gets even busier once noon strikes.

I usually order a mini burger with grilled onions, portobello mushroom, and avocado. Can't forget the garlic fries! I have also tried their chocolate milkshake and lemonade. Milkshakes are creamy and flavorful but did not care too much for the lemonade.

I always pack an abundance of pickles from their pickle jar.
author: Lauren K.

description: Service here gets a 0!! I just went in this morning for a breakfast sandwich LITERALLY at 10:30 on the dot. Some guy was ahead of me in line ordering a breakfast sandwich and we was served, by the time I get to the register its 10:30, I ask for a breakfast sandwich and the woman at the register says NO, I check my phone, its 10:31, and I told her that, in case she didnt know..... and no one is behind in line, and the guy before me JUST ordered one.... seriously lady!? Not cool..... she knew I was upset but didnt care, GREAT customer service.... great.
author: Rocky R.

description: This is a neighborhood that seriously lacks casual dining options, so Super Duper is much appreciated. A burger and fries will set you back about $10 which seems like a pretty good price in the FIDI. I get the mini burger (one patty) and ask them to put on grilled onions and jalapeños. I also always get the garlic fries which come sprinkled with a LOT of mild garlic, parsley, and cheese. I wish the burger was a little bit less wet/greasy and it would be nice if the fries were a little more crisp, but they're both delicious. If you come during their happy hour, (4-7 pm on weekdays and ALL DAY Saturday) I think beer and wine is something like $5 and you get fries thrown in for free? If you're paleo or low carb, you can also order the burger without the bun and they will carefully wrap it in huge, fresh leaves of lettuce (no pre shredded crap here).
author: Cat M.

description: Good, meaty burgers, good add-ons (come on, who doesn't love warm egg yolk running down and coating your food?), free pickles, and option to have beer/wine? Whaaat?? I just wish I had known about Super Duper Burger sooner... now I need to rethink my fast food burger rankings!
author: Steve L.

description: Came for breakfast - food was served quickly and tasted very fresh. Outside table was also nice since it was a beautiful day. Couldn't beat the price. No complaints; we will come here again.
author: Eileen M.

description:
FOOD: My favorite burger place in the Bay! Super Duper makes the kind of burgers that you don't hate yourself after inhaling because they use such fresh ingredients. On top of that, you can go all out and add an egg, avocado, and all the works, while grabbing as many freshly homemade pickles as you can possibly handle. Ugh I die. Garlic fries are a good share item - while the garlic/cheese ratio is pretty solid, but sometimes the cheese clumps up on the top. 

TIPS: This place can get crowded especially during weekdays around lunch time. Service is pretty quick, however and they have a big outdoor seating area.
author: Trina B.

description:
Honestly im not much of a burger fan, hmm maybe it's because I'm vegetarian!!? But one of my best friends made the trip all the way over from the east bay to have lunch with me so I felt kind of obligated to eat where he wanted. He said he wanted a burger, prior to this visit I had never been but everyone raves about Super Duper so I figured this was the place to go.

I must say, I love it! I had the veggie burger with avocado, pickles, and fries. The food was all very tasty, considering the venue is right next to the embarcadero and they have a ton of seating I guess I'd say the price was worth it. My meal was about $12-13, initially I thought the burger was a bit small, but I left feeling pretty full so all-in-all I will definitely return.
author: V I P.

description: Super Duper Burger was indeed super duper. I ordered the super burger with garlic fries and cheese while my wife ordered the veggie burger. Both were great and the fries were covered with cheddar, amazing. Also, the price was right. We were both full and got out for less than $25. All in all it was a great experience. Highly recommend this establishment to those looking for a tasty burger at a reasonable price in downtown SF.
author: Matt R.

description:
The first time I was at this place my mind was blown by the quality of the burgers. The second time I was there it met my expectations and now Im craving it more. I don't see them sacrificing any part of their burgers and other things for cost.

Plus, they have bottomless free kosher pickles. Go nuts!
author: Mohsen R.

description: This was just delicious, staff are super friendly, food was fast, definitely worth a visit, It was one of the best burgers I have ever had, My one complaint, actually not even a complaint, Is that since there are a lot of people visiting here, there are a lot of people to be seated, so maybe add a little more seating space, but that's it, still definitely worth checking out, I'd give it more stars if I could
author: Gael G.

description:
Expensive fast food, but yum.

I think Super Duper Burger is expensive for what it is. $9.25 for a mini combo meal seems pretty pricey. However, I do enjoy the food, which is why I still eat here every so often. Sometimes they have free deals and if you're one of the lucky visitors who get there early, you'll get whatever free food they're offering. Recently, I got to enjoy a free mini cheeseburger, fries, drink, and soft serve cone. The burgers are cooked well (not well-done), though sometimes can be on the greasy side. There's various locations all around San Francisco, so take your pick. I've been to the one on Market, which can get crowded (and seemed to be the most greasy). The location near Metreon isn't too bad, but I think so far I like the Financial District location best (by Spear Street) as there are plenty of seats and usually isn't packed.
author: Becky C.

description:
I nearly gave it one extra star for being open after 5pm.  It's not quite at 5-star level, though.

What is it like?  Not too bad, one of the better burgers.  The meat is cooked well (actually medium well).  You can get either 1/4 pound for regular-sized stomachs, or 1/2 pound for big tanks.

This is a great choice for cubedwellers.  It's just south of Market, so it's good for lunch hour, although it's a longer walk if you work near Montgomery Street.  A few places to stand and eat, outside tables are an option.

My story:  I'm no longer a cubedweller in the Financial District.  But we were going to a book signing at the Ferry Building, and I had a hunch that the line would be long (It took us 3 HOURS from getting in line to getting Nerdy Nummy Ro Pansino's pic and signature), so I was looking for some place, ANY place, to get good inexpensive food at night.  I knew the pickings would be slim, I didn't realize how slim they were.  Super Duper Burger was one of only six kid-friendly places within four blocks that was open past 5pm.  It was only a three-block walk for me and the 8-year-old, the hunny held our place in line.  The girl and I both got 1/4 pounders with cheese, I included bacon, and we ordered a chicken sandwich with jack cheese for the hunny.  I thought it would be Monterey Jack, but it was Pepper Jack;  my wife doesn't handle hot food well.  But we ate while waiting in line, we all got all of our food down, and were all pleased with what we had.  If we had time to sit down and eat, Super Duper Burger is a clean, well-lighted place for burgers - and it's open after the offices close down and the parking meters stop working.  Friendly staff that's good with kids.

I'm sure there are better burgers in the Financial District;  I've had better burgers before.  I remember one in the food court below Nordstrom that was better, albeit more pricey.  But you can certainly do worse.  Again, Super Duper is not a 5-star burger, but a solid 4;  great eats for such a hokey name.
author: Ron L.

description: They do lettuce wrapped burgers too for keto dieters out there. Really good food. Nice interior. And one of the friendliest staff members. Even though they always change, super duper keeps it's reputation with very approachable friendly helpful workers. Always a pleasant experience at super duper.
author: Ken T.

description:
Love this place but someone tell that kid to stop asking me 'Have you ever been here before?' And when I respond he says Yessss like he just sank a 3-pointer. Every time. So annoying. 

And I'm in there like twice a week. Pay attention !
author: Jesse M.

description: This is my favorite burger, it's simply good , fresh made, they use good ingredients (that's what I feel) if I want to eat a burger I just look for super duper burger, don't try (I don't like waiting in the line).
author: Amarjit G.

description: Just delicious MMMMMM tasty fresh yummy scrumptious awesome ingredients MMMMMMMMMMMMMM
author: Sasan S.

description:
Super Duper is great. The chicken sandwich is delicious with chipotle aioli and jack cheese. Although I rarely eat them, the French fries are very good and come  with garlic if you desire.  

The hamburgers are prepared with Niman Ranch beef and are juicy and thick.  I love the homemade pickles that are offered as a condiment. The breakfast egg sandwiches are very good too.  This place should  put Bistro Burger out of business very quickly.
author: J M.

description:
I love this place!!!!!!!!!
The location is super convenient. But the sad thing is, the lines get super duper long ;)

I recommend going at 9:30 for the breakfast combo of a cheese and egg sandwich, mini donut, and coffee.

I recommend going at either 11:30 or 1:30 for lunch.

Getting grilled onions on your burger is also a good direction to go into.

Splurge on the sauces. The mayonaise is so good you can dip your fries in it and it's not even weird.
author: Natalie C.

description:
Vegetarian fed cows , freedom chicken... Looks like a healthy burger and then boom, full in oil, buttered was dripping of buns. So much oil in one burger. 
Will never eat here again and they have no place to wash your hands and no restrooms.
author: V L.

description: Ive never been here before but my friend bought me here and yes! I love garlic fried!! And burger is so yummy! Totally will be another my favorite place  to come by again for sure.
author: Faith S.

description: Burgers and fries are decent, shakes are awesome but I'm seriously not gonna be able to eat here anymore. I'm sitting here now eating and birds are flying all over the place and one just pooped on the table next to me and the poor guys sitting there had to deal with that. There's bird crap on their table now!!! Someone needs to get these birds outta here and prevent them from even coming in the door in the first place. Disgusting. How can you enjoy a meal when you have to constantly look up to make sure birds don't shit in your food or on you?
author: Dusty N.

description: This place is super duper in deed. The burgers are fresh, moist and cooked slightly pink like they should be. The Garrick fries are amazing and the strawberry shake is on of the best that I have had. Oh and they have jenga.
author: Raymond R.

description:
Strike 1. first time they over cooked the fries. Burger was good but took 20 minutes on a Wednesday night that was dead.

Strike 2. Just got fries, used old oil. skimpy on the cone... I pay good money for a cone tinier than McDonald's??? The texture was good though.

Strike 3. busy night, got REGULAR fries only to go... good, but how does 5 orders of garlic fries ORDERED after me gets theirs first? I simply got REGULAR fries ONLY...... n had to ask for it....

like many, all I got was oh I'm sorry with insincerity. Your skimpiness, turnaround time, and poor customer service doesn't allow me to enjoy good food.

Peace Out SDB, you lost my support.
author: Ian C.

description: Pretty solid burger. and the garlic fries with cheese were pretty good as well. I was not a fan of the lemonade however I'll be back when I'm in the mood for a solid cheeseburger.
author: Rod M.

description:
I hate grilled chicken sandwiches. And I hate driving up to the city from the south bay for anything. Yet I would drive to Super Duper Burgers in the city for their grilled chicken sandwich any day. Juicy, tasty sandwich with access to an unlimited amount of pickles. Suggested toppings: tomatoes, lettuce, red onions, and jalapenos. The garlic fries are the perfect complement, and if you're feeling extra gluttonous, I'd recommend tacking on the regular swirl (chocolate + vanilla) milkshake as well. 

The only thing keeping it from a 5-star review is its exorbitant prices. If only rent control could be applied to sandwich prices..
author: Madhur B.

description: As soon as I took my first bite, I'm pretty sure I saw God. My tastebuds started singing hymns and my tummy said, "it is good."
author: Victoria M.

description:
Good burger - well seasoned beef. Really delicious fries and Homemade pickles - Great prices. 

How can you lose if that's what you're looking for.
author: Rew C.

description:
Finallyyyy got to try Super Duper when I was very hungover one day. The only thing that would fix it was a greasy cheeseburger and fries. My dream came true when I entered Super Duper, where I had to stand in line to order (that 5-8 minute estimate wait time is actually accurate!) and received my food very quickly thereafter.

The burger totally hit the spot, as did their fries. I wish the patties were seasoned a bit more (they were pretty bland, though cooked perfectly) and the burger in general wasn't so greasy (somehow now have grease stains all over my pants). I think that this is a very solid burger and will totally do the trick if you're hungover. With that said, it's not the best burger I've ever had and it really is the Yelp definition of 3 stars - A-OK.
author: Amy Y.

description: Ok so there are a lot of good burger places in Foody SF. fine, we all know this. Some are better than others and thats subjective I would venture to say . But without a doubt a burger thats juicy and really tasty to me and I guess is in the fast food category, Super Duper gets my 5 stars.........
author: Fernando R.

description: The greasiest burger you ever ate prepared by people who could care less. You'd be better off eating at mcdonalds.
author: Nors D.

description:
Visiting area and wanted to find a good burger spot for lunch. Best choice, friendly staff, explained menu, and seating outside and inside was great.
Milkshakes highly recommended ! We got the super duper burger and chicken sandwich which both wet awesome ! Best burger !
author: Josephine L.

description: Was a bit disappointed in breakfast.  Ordered a breakfast special with OJ and a dozen donuts for the office to go.  Egg sandwich was missing the bacon and the cheese.  Also the lid for the OJ was defective and spilled juice.  People did seem to enjoys the donuts though.
author: Emily Y.

description:
They're pretty good. I got the super burger with everything and garlic cheese fries. The fries weren't really hot but it was good. I feel like I'm about to fall asleep and explode. It made me so full. I ate everything plus the pickles. The people here are nice and it doesn't take long for your order to be ready. Although I went as soon as they opened so they weren't that crowded. I will try again one day if I don't choose to become Vegan lol. I need to take a nap.
Only bad thing I can say is I don't feel they're good enough to be charging 9 dollars for a double cheese burger lol. I'm just saying
author: Chanel D.

description: Got the mini burger and the garlic fries. The garlic fries are super good-- super duper garlicy, and definitely worth the $3.25 prices. I would say the hamburger is okay-- it didn't have a lot of salt or flavoring, but cooked to a nice medium rare.
author: Y W.

description:
Ooooh typical Bay Area native alert but In n out is better. 

If you MUST have a burger in the financial district, Super Duper is the place to go. It's just a so-so burger that is a bit on the pricey side for what you get. Love the child portion milk shakes though. They're great when you got yourself a sweet tooth but are not trying to blow over your sugar limit for the day.
author: Jo L.

description:
After scrolling on Yelp for a nearby place to eat, I was excited for Super Duper Burger because I was super duper hungry.

The atmosphere was very open and modern, which was refreshing to walk into on a rainy afternoon. I ordered the combo with a mini burger, fries, and a drink. The burger and fries both tasted pretty average for me and the size of the burger was surprisingly small to me even though I ordered, well, a mini burger. After going through a few reviews, I guess ordering extra toppings really makes the burger.

You can self-serve some pickles at the condiment bar, which was pretty rad! I don't go HAM on the whole burger and pickles combo, but it helped out the burger a bit every time I took a bite of a pickle after taking a bite of the burger.
author: Rosemary F.

description:
So gross. I guess they only decide to wear gloves for 1 or 2 weeks then decide that wearing gloves is optional when serving people food. Just now and again last week, food handlers are not wearing gloves again. 

I truly have absolutely no faith in this management and its workers to ensure food safety for their customers. 

This place really should be shut down. What an embarassment to other super dupers. Disgusting.
author: Alex C.

description:
Disappointing. I looked on Yelp for a good burger place that would compete with So Cal since this is my first time here in san Fran because of work and I found Super Duper.

I ordered a super duper burger and garlic fries, to go! I was so excited to try the garlic fries because i love them in general and will always try any.

I ended up getting fries instead of garlic fries. They messed up the order. I checked my receipt to see if it was something i said or if the cashier messed up. Nope.. It said garlic fries. Check my uploaded picture. So disappointing.... The burger was bland and not unique. It was just cooked and well put together but nothing that stands out.

Wasted my money here. I may still go back just to try the garlic fries though!

My recommendation: Go get a Box Burger here in San Fran even though the tattooed guy there hates his job and seems a but fussy when you ask simply for the order to take out.
author: Esau R.

description:
First off, let me just say I'm usually not a fan of burgers.  I'm more of a veggie and light fares type of person and a burger just seems so heavy of a meal.  However, my BF is a burger fanatic so I decide to surprise him and take him here as part of our date night.  I've had Super Duper burgers before and thought they were one of the better burgers I've ever tried.  The ingredients are fresh and tasty and I've always had good service. 

I've never been to this particular location but it was a bit deserted the evening we went (4th of July weekend).  The service was phenomenal though!  Everyone was super friendly and when they accidentally poured an extra beer (we only ordered one), they said we can just have it.  That made J a very happy man! Then again, who doesn't love free beer lol.

My favorite thing here is not the burgers (gasp) but the chocolate dipped vanilla cone.  I think they make the best chocolate dipped vanilla cone I've ever had and I always crave it from here.  Being lactose intolerant, I usually avoid dairy at all costs but was willing to endure feeling like a hippo for their chocolate dipped vanilla cone.  That's saying something!  What are you waiting for, go get one!
author: Yue L.

description: Very greasy! The burger tastes great, but the grease that comes from it is excessive. I don't think I've ever had a burger that greasy before. It's a cute fast chain restaurant that's great for a quick grubbin'.
author: Amanda T.

description:
Right when this location opened 2 months ago next to my work, I knew I was in big trouble.... 

The first week it opened, I went three times. WHY? Because their burgers are cooked to perfection and I am seriously addicted! Get the Mini Burger (you can request Med Rare if you want) with everything on it and don't forget to add an egg! You will not regret that perfectly cooked over easy egg.

Their chicken sandwich served on a ciabatta roll is also very juicy and delicious. Will not disappoint!
author: Karen O.

description: I'm not a big fan of burgers but when I do want to eat one, I go there. I just live two blocks from there so it's pretty easy to have a late lunch. Staff is  and burgers are great. Make sure to try the garlic friends, they are awesome. They also serve ice cream.
author: David P.

description:
I'm a long-time fan of SD's awesome breakies, finally got a chance to try a burger and all I can say is Yum-O!

Perfect grease factor, super flavor, and the fries are terrific! And, they even serve beer!

Nice folks running the place, too...
author: Richard F.

description:
Not even noon and the line is out the door!

Conveniently located a few blocks from the office, this is the spot to go for a quick juicy burger or better yet, their ultra lush + silky [swirl] soft serve cones.
author: Julie L.

description:
I love a good burger and Super Duper does not disappoint!! Everything is as fresh as can be. The staff is friendly, happy and fast!! The garlic fries with aged cheddar cheese are a must order item.

My favorite thing Super Duper has to offer is the HOMEMADE PICKLES!!! They rock!! Strong on the vinegar.

Update: I was finally able to try the breakfast sandwich. It is a perfect small snack for me on my morning break and the price is very reasonable!
author: Ben M.

description:
First time customer, stumbled upon it. It was dinner time and our first choice (that we found on Yelp) was packed so we decided we'd try it. We each got a burger, he a "super" and me a "mini", we shared garlic Fries and each got a shake.

The garlic fries were fabulous. The burger was 'meh. It was prepared as we asked, but just an average burger. The shakes were pretty good.

Won't be a repeat customer because I'm on vacay. Not sure if I would be if I lived here or not.

UPDATE 4/20/15: Ed O sent me a note via Yelp messaging. LOVE FOLLOW UP from these places via Yelp. It shows me that they care and really do want us to be happy. Updated from 2 stars to 3 just because of that. Thank you for going the extra bit and hitting me up with a response. I appreciate it, Ed O!
author: Sharron G.

description:
As the workday was coming to an end, my coworker approached me with a distraught look on his face. He was starving and the only thing that would satisfy him was a juicy tender american cheeseburger. I laughed knowing that this is SF and a good burger would be a synch. I grab my phone and jump into yelp.  Epic Road house, Prospect, Wayfarer Tavern apparently all had some juicy tender delicious to die for burgers. I hadn't tried the burger at Wayfarer yet so we made our decision and I lead the way full of confidence and a growing appetite.  

As we approached, he noticed that there was a crowd at the door. Upon asking the hostess, we learned that with no reservation we would have to wait.  A craving will wait for no burger! And so like Harold and Kumar, we continued our journey in search of satisfaction's epic fulfillment. Burger Bistro was nearby but Yelp told me I could do better. After some more searching and short walk into the SOMA, we end up at Super Duper Burger.
