It may be a chain burger joint but damn this was a juicy tender to die for gooey American cheeseburger that would be satisfaction's epic fulfillment.  5 stars. Thanks Yelp!
author: Huy V.

description:
I love super duper but this location sucks.. I gave it 3 chances.

First chance - got a burger with stale bread

Second chance- I asked for extra super sauce and they gave me no sauce and a dry burger.

Third chance - I checked my order at the counter since they messed up before. Got to my office avocado was in my burger. I'm allergic to avocados. Now I want to throw up.

And I mentioned that my orders were messed up before and all I got was "sorry about that" from a worker that just didn't care. I get it but this is my third time!!! 

Go to any other super duper with better customer service.
author: J B.

description:
The cashier was hilarious. My friend asks her if she has any suggestions for what to get since it's our first time here. She pretty much says she doesn't know. Okay...

Then after each of us orders, she recites a scripted line: "have you ever been to Super Duper Burger before?" Well obviously he hasn't because he just said so, but we both say no and she responds with "welcome to Super Duper Burger!" I suppose I can appreciate the effort.

She also dropped my credit card on the ground :(

The burger itself was a bit small, but for SF it's a good value I suppose. No complaints about burger quality. They have those buzzers that tell you when your food is ready, but it's not a long wait anyway.

I don't really remember how the inside of the restaurant was, but it was obviously they spent time on the interior design.
author: Brian H.

description:
The third location I've been to in SF and the newest one.  Finally, a location closer to my office.  Went on Monday for lunch after 1 and the line was out the door.  They were very nice though and gave out samples of french fries and one of their dips to patient customers waiting in line.

I think I liked Super Duper more the first few times I've had it.  They still cook a great burger for the price and their fries are spot on too.  I didn't have to wait that long for my burger and fries to go after placing the order.  I felt that the burger was a little dry until the last 3 or 4 bites though.  The fries were still just as crispy and seasoned perfectly.  

For the most part the Super Duper chain remains consistent cranking out good food at great prices.  The portions are generous too!  I'm in trouble with this location being so close to my office.
author: Cat C.

description:
I tried your chicken sandwich and fries a few weeks ago and I am absolutely hooked.  Great staff, quality ingredients, good value.  My major gripe - and it is serious - is vermin walking around the restaurant.  Pigeons.  Point them out to the staff, and they look at each other and giggle.  It is extremely inappropriate to allow pigeons to roam freely. I have half a mind to stomp a pigeon dead or chase it around the place so management is reminded why vermin are prohibited in eating establishments.

Despite the pest problem, I still come back for the chicken sandwich and fries.  Without the flying rats, it would be 5 stars!
author: Ramsey E.

description:
Its fast food, but elevated.  We stumbled on this place after a particularly long night out at Cantina and it was the perfect hangover cure.  Plus, we were looking for outdoor seating and they have a really large patio.

I ordered the small bacon cheeseburger and we split an order of (not garlic) fries.  The bacon on the burger was nice and thick, but too chewy for my taste.  I prefer my bacon super crispy, but I know that everyone has a different preference.  The burger was pink in the center and had crispy edges with a super juicy middle.  In fact it was so juicy that I ended up ruining a pair of jeans with greasy goodness.  

Our plan was to try the chocolate dipped organic soft serve ice cream, but I had to dart back to the hotel to save my pants.  Next time ShakeDown!  Next time!
author: jennifer j.

description:
Ugh. I came here for the very first time today because my friend convinced me to try here over Ziggy's Burgers. I am not impressed. It tasted like in and out, only FAR greasier. I had the mini combo and I couldn't finish it, my stomach was churning from the grease. I'm sitting at my desk now and I feel like I ate a stick of butter. I haven't felt this sick since the last time I went to Carl's Junior.

I feel disgusting. This place put me off burgers for a long time.
author: Lara E.

description:
Having eaten at my fair share of burger places, I believe Super Duper is easily the best burger (from a chain) you can get in the Bay Area.

The Habit and 5 Guys aren't on the same level. In-N-Out is always relevant because of its price point and amazing $2-a-burger value, but when comparing burger to burger, Super Duper wins out for me. Shake Shack is good, but SD has the edge.

The burger patties here are unlike any other I've had. SD manages to have a slightly crispy outside and a tender, juicy, and well seasoned inside. The chipotle aioli rivals the In-N-Out spread for how much it adds to the burger. The homemade pickles are great, and the garlic fries are done fantastically: just enough garlic and parmesan to add big flavor without becoming overwhelming.

I'm always in search of a new favorite burger, but right now Super Duper is at the top of my podium.
author: Kevin T.

description:
Opened yesterday, cash only! 

Went back today and the credit card machines are working :) Good thing cuz I fed several hungry co-workers.
author: Walt L.

description: good quality products with reasonable prices. Plus they also open late ;) I was here when I was vegetarian and now when I eat meat I like it even more!
author: Ilmia N.

description:
Some local SF friends suggested Super Duper Burgers for a place to grab a quick bite for lunch. They said it was like Shake Shack in NY. Some said it was better than Shake Shack, some said it was not as good. After eating here, I still like Shake Shack more, but this is still a good substitute.

I like how there are so many toppings you can add on for free. And there are also a lot of other ones you can add on for additional charge. The patty was a bit on the well done side, which is my only complaint. I like mine more medium and juicy. 

I ordered the Cookies and Cream shake and this was so good! Thick and creamy, and strong flavors. 

Overall, this is a pretty good burger place.
author: Vickie C.

description: Don't let the long line scare you; it moves.  I especially like the pickles in the condiment area - have as many as you want.  I've only ever gotten the mini burger with fries; it's filling and good for lunch.  Also, really a fan of the soft serve ice cream.
author: Donna G.

description: I like the veggie burger and the lemonade. This location gets busy on weekdays but the line moves quickly.
author: Nikhil D.

description:
At first I thought, "just another veggie burger" but then I bit into it and found it was made out of veggies other than corn with black beans.

The service, environment, food, and compostable/recycle attitude marks this one high on my sandwich stops.
author: Ryan A.

description:
Yum! A mini with cheese, no onions.  

Since the line was long they gave us samples of fries to distract us from the line, it worked. 

The the crispy bits in the edge of the patty were FAB, and secret sauce dripping everywhere...what a GREAT lunch! 

JUICES DRIPPING, running and ripping...
author: B K.

description: So when you walk into a place and you hear the customers say mmmmmmm. Or oh my gaud. You know,you are in for a treat. Burger was great. Garlic fries even better. Fast service and friendly employees. Lot of construction workers in here so you know it will be great!
author: Steve W.

description:
This location is really spacious! I went during off hours around 4pm and it was empty. 

I got a mini burger with jalapeños on it and garlic fries with the three dipping sauces. I seriously think Super Duper is better than In and Out burger! In and Out has been tasting salty to me the last few times I went. Also Super Duper's quality of the meat is great. 

Garlic fries: AWESOME. So garlicky! 

I also love their organic vanilla soft serve! So delicious on a sunny warm day. I noticed many people getting shakes so next time I will have to try that.
author: Cathy B.

description: We came here for lunch on a Sunday while attending an event at the Marriott near the Metreon.  We had the mini combo with fries and a soda.  It's a good burger, and they are very friendly at the front counter.  It's nice inside and a solid place to get a quick burger.
author: Dan L.

description: Family had two mini burgers and garlic fries.  I had the super duper burger with fried egg and jalapeños.  The burgers were dry, but had really good flavor.  The homemade pickles were very tasty.  Finished off lunch with a vanilla shake.  The shake was definitely the highlight.  Lunch for the family came to $35.  Big turn off is the fact that they do not have bathrooms.  After the tasty greasy egg yolk dripped all down my forearm, I find out that there is no bathroom.  So Macgyver skills came into play and I rinsed my hands with my drinking water.
author: Jimmy T.

description: We stopped there while visiting SF. Delicious burgers and toppings! Single hamburger is a good size, the double is good if you're really hungry! Really enjoyed it! The jenga on the tables makes for a fun wait!
author: Florencia S.

description:
Fast, good, clean, with beer, and smily people.
Perfect spot for anyone looking for a good bite to a sandwich.

Is it the burger perfect, no, but but sure you won't regret!
author: Max F.

description:
I will never come back here again. I tried it twice and twice I got a raw burger. How this place has a line out the door and around the corner is beyond me. How the fuck do you cook a raw burger at 10:45 am when no one is in there. The kicker is I asked for my burger to be cooked well done. 

So I decided to call them to complain and ask for my money back. Their phone system is out of memory? I have to walk all the way back now just to complain. 

The customer service was shit while I was in there. The lady taking my order mumbles and looks straight down then gets an attitude when I have to ask what she said 3 times. 

I have not had a good experience here ever.
author: Gage K.

description:
Stopped in here for a quick bite to eat before heading to see a show at the Orpheum. The mini combo was more than enough for me to feel almost uncomfortably full. The fries were yummy and crisp and the burger was juicy (though the patty was a tad on the salty side).

I mean, they're burgers. I don't see what the crazy hype is about. Other than the pricing being pretty damn decent for the Financial District, nothing about them really stood out to me as outstanding. If you're craving burgers and you're in the area, they're a good place to go. Just make sure you head over either early or late -- the lunch rush is NO JOKE in this area!
author: Anna W.

description:
I walk by this place every morning on the way to work. Today the $5 Super Duper Breakfast sign was calling my name. With $5 in my pocket I was looking forward to trying their breakfast sandwich, mini donut and coffee special. 

Sadly they were out of donuts as they make them in house and we're waiting for their ingredients delivery.

So I just ordered a coffee instead. 3 stars for the complimentary coffee and service. I'll try to come back another day
author: Audrey L.

description: This place was super duper good. The food quality and affordability was fantastic for the San Francisco area. The garlic fries definitely hit the spot and they weren't overly garlic. The service was great, the cashier was welcoming and asked if I've been there before which is a nice way of helping you through the menu. All of my questions were answered. I would recommend if you want something quick to eat and reasonably priced in the area. Thus place will not disappoint you.
author: James J.

description: The line here is always long at lunch peak hours. I never enjoyed Super Duper that much to suggest coming here but only when coworkers want this for lunch. I still like in-n-out burgers better and not to mention at cheaper. I get the mini burger and it's double the price of in-n-out burger and imo not that good. I don't like their garlic fries and had experience with it bc it gets really soggy. Regular fries are ok but I don't prefer it. Their fresh strawberry smoothie was good! Very milky.
author: Sherry Y.

description: I'll keep this short: I paid for bacon. So where's my bacon? No offense for the one star, but I came here almost at 3PM, where you count the number of customers in one hand. Why screw up my order now?
author: Edward T.

description: The Garlic fries are too die for! I only did 4 stars cause my burger was a bit dry. ..otherwise this was totally fun and yummy! Place is packed and smells amazing!
author: Elizabeth W.

description:
This review is for their breakfast. 

Its $2.50 for their egg sandwich, but I was disappointed that there was an upcharge for cheese .50 and then to add bacon $1.00.   After ordering that with a large coffee, it came out to a little over $7.  

The size of their sandwich plus coffee, I would have hoped to pay more around $5.00

They need to stock sleeves for their coffee cups.  Coffee was great but super hot to the touch. 

In the future, I'll use my $7 for their awesome burgers instead
author: Ivan D.

description: Great juicy burgers and the garlic fries are Bomb.com..this is a great place to get your burger fix and a very helpful and friendly staff.
author: Irene P.

description:
In a major attempt to reintroduce me to American food after living in Italy for a few months, my best friend decided that we should go to Super Duper Burger. She had said a few times how #lifechanging their burgers were, and me being curious and seriously craving some burgers and fries, had to see what all the fuss was about.

After looking over the menu, I decided on a super duper burger (go big or go home) with grilled onions and everything on it. In all honesty, I wasn't expecting to be wowed at all and thought that nothing could top my beloved In-N-Out burgers. Now I'm not saying that this blew In-n-Out burger out of the water, but they were pretty close.

I asked that the burger be cooked medium-well and it was still pretty juicy. The fries were really good but I wished that I had ordered the garlic fries. My friend ordered a beer but they gave her the wrong kind so we ended up with a free beer! If you order a drink after 4 p.m., you get free fries with your order. 

Service here was kind and they were more than happy to explain their menu and offer suggestions. 

Overall, I really enjoyed my dining experience at Super Duper however, the only thing that would stop me from coming back here often is the prices. Definitely more than worth a try if you're a burger fan!
author: Stephanie C.

description: Very solid place - love that they serve burgers for breakfast. All natural and quality ingredients, and that clearly came through on the first bite. Definitely repeat.
author: David B.

description:
Breakfast is good, homemade donuts, Four Barrel coffee and hearty breakfast sandwiches--modestly sized.

Burger was good, but not amazing.  I would return for it anytime I wanted a wholesome simple burger experience.

Tried the grilled chicken sandwich with everything (bacon, pepper jack, chipolte spread).  It was huge, came on an unexpected hard roll, was a bit too salty and the chicken was over cooked.  Focus on the beef.

The french fries (plain) were excellent.
author: Patrick S.

description:
I've heard so many good things about Super Duper and I was finally Downtown SF and got a chance to eat here. Thank goodness my friend and I got here around 11:15 right after we ordered our food the line was literally out the door. 

She said I'd get full with the mini burger, so i got that with cheese. You can taste that it is REAL meat, cooked to perfection and the bun slightly toasted. MMMMMMMMM and I got full with half of the mini. Of course I had to get the garlic fries and a coke. I would totally come back and try the chicken sandwich, I heard that was good.
author: Irma R.

description:
Best veggie burger I've had hands down.

The burger comes with lettuce, tomato, onion, cucumbers, hummus and special sauce on a sesame bun. Nix the special sauce and sub ciabatta bread to make the whole thing vegan and then add avocado? chile, we have a winner.

The creaminess from the hummus and the crunch from the cucumber...bananas. The patty itself isn't sloppy, mushy and fall-aparty like OTHER burger joints I know of (*coughburgermeistercough*), but it's substantial, slightly crispy, perfectly seasoned. The corn kernels inside even have like a golden sear on them...a level of attention to detail you could only expect from old man duper and his burger franchise. veggies are always fresh, bread is always soft--just all around good. the fries are out of this world also.

i'm seriously envious of all the milkshake-enjoyers i see there and if they ever started offering vegan non-dairy alternatives, I'd be bankrupt.
author: Bo R.

description:
Ordered a super combo (+ cheese & bacon, + garlic fries) for $15. Overall, I was very impressed by the quality of the ingredients and by its taste. They used thick cut bacon and the patty is spot on. However some improvements to be made include: 1) cooking the bacon more to a crisp, as mine were still chewy; 2) use less butter; 3) increase the garlic to cheese ratio on the fries.

Would definitely recommend this place.
author: Favian S.

description: Tasty burgers that are not too big and not too small. Their garlic fries can be a little greasy, but you're at a burger joint...The cherry on top for me are their spiked milk shakes - what's not to love about this place?!
author: Devina W.

description: Soo this is my second 5 star rating for Super Duper as I LOVE their fries n veggie burgers. Before I went vegetarian, I used to also love their mini burgers ( for me one and fries was plenty filling). Also, they make a delicious housemade lemonade. If your visiting SF give them a try personally, Super Duper is my favorite burger joint (: Also the freshness level and quality is A+
author: Ariana H.

description: OK burger, actually they could do better, service is minimal and there is no love in the food. The bread is in particular too industrial.
author: Alex G.

description: Convienent location right near the bus station can grab a bite to eat. This one is a little smaller from the other two located in the city however the food is still good
author: Kentara W.

description:
I honestly don't see the hype about the burgers here. They taste okay. They are nothing special. I got the super duper burger and some regular fries and ended up feeling like I got duped. Maybe they should change their name to Duper Burger lol. I tried some of my friend's garlic friends and I guess I found out I am not a big fan of garlic and so did my friend.

The biggest pro about this place is the spacious seating. My friends and I had no problem finding seats after the SF marathon. The place was half full.

If you try to try a little bit of everything it can quickly add up.

Ex:
Super duper burger (7.75) = reasonable since it's two patties and it's meat from grass fed cows
Garlic fries (3.75)
Fountain drink (2.25)
Dipped cone (4)

That's almost $18 before tax. The price of a fountain drink should not be $2.25. Just saying.

I would come back to try some of their organic shakes because I am curious how good an organic shake could be but they're from $3.25 (kiddie size) - $8.25 depending what size you get and if you get it spiked.
author: Martin N.

description: Ah-mazing! Come here all the time. I get both the burger and the chicken sandwich with no bun and it's perfectly executed every time. The quality of the fries has totally improved and they handed out donut samples today! All three varieties were delicious but the vanilla donut is by far the best!
author: Andy A.

description:
this is my favorite super duper joint because it's walking distance and i love the small burger.
its so juicy and yummy and of course you have to get the garlic fries with the 3 sauces - its just fun! i come here when i want to commit a sin and eat fast food. not sure if its really fast food though. i think they make everything to order. oh and the pickles - love the pickles!
author: Marie r.

description: Omg! The best burgers ever. The garlic fries, crazy good, with aged cheddar cheese. Try the the burger with fried egg and bacon, yum yum   And the service - fantastic!! You must stop here when in San Fran.
author: Melissa W.

description: Best burger of my life, a mini burger with bacon, cheese, and a fried egg definitely my fav item on the menu. The other super dupers are closer to my office, but I enjoy bringing my clients here for the beer and fry special at the end of the day. Service is on point as well, I would rate it a ten if I could.
author: Alberto D.

description: Delicious!!! Definitely recommend this burger place. And their garlic cheese fries are amazing!
author: Amy C.

description:
Updating my review to underline the fact that Super Duper burgers are definitely a life saver in the financial district. Especially on the weekends when you're not looking for a fancy bite- but rather a deliciously grab-n-go burger, frills optional.  

Thanks for being my angel in the outfield that is the financial district. 

I will forever be your burger bae. xoxo
author: Tiffany S.

description:
This is a breakfast review:

The Backstory-  I'd have to say this place was a little further than I wanted to walk from Harrison and Beale. My coworker mentioned that she'd heard they had a breakfast sandwich meal deal with a mini donut and a coffee. Hmm sounded appealing so I made my way through the streets peeking my head in to a few of the dozens of available breakfast choices along my walk. Coffee Roastery looked ok but was gonna be $11 with coffee, Sweet Joanna's didn't entice me, Working Girls cafe was busy, put it on my list. Stopped in Rincon Place and stark Eatsa was empty for their new breakfast offering and the Taqueria inside had very poor breakfast burrito offerings. I had now made it through the gauntlet of choices and wasn't enticed enough to be diverted from Super Duper. it was 8:45 and their large patio glowed orange in the warm morning sun! Despite being surrounded by skyscrapers in the cold SOMA streets, Heaven's Halo was shining down warming up this burger joint! 

The Food- I walk inside to a moderate crowd eating and no line. I see a large sign promoting the breakfast special my coworker had mentioned. " Organic Egg Breakfast Sandwich -  Donut - 4 Barrel Coffee- $6" This seemed like a great deal! You can add cheese for $.50 and/or Sausage for Bacon is $1. i promptly ordered, but the cashier informed me that the sign was outdated and the price had changed..... now the special meal deal was $5.50! I was the definition of a Happy Camper. Max the cashier was super sweet and friendly, extremely rare service in this neighborhood of high volume food service. They give you a buzzer, so I took the 3-4 minutes of waiting to soak in some sun their Heaven's Halo patio. I forgot I had put the vibrating buzzer in my pocket and when that thing vibrated I was pleasantly startled. I walked up and the young girl handed my my bag with the biggest smile and said "enjoy your food Giovanni". 

Consumption- I'll keep this paragraph short and sweet. Four Barrel coffee was nutty and had a slight bitter but pleasant bite. Donut was not mini, I'd say 3/4 scale and super delicious. Chose the glazed and the glaze was perfect not runny, hard or sticky. The donut was light not chewey or cakey. It was perhaps the best donut I've , no exaggeration. The breakfast sandwich was on a soft moist english muffin. I had the very tasty sausage and it wasn't salty and the egg was cooked to perfection. 5 Super Duper Gold Star breakfast!
author: Gio D.

description: Really atrocious service. Placed an order for a chicken sandwich, no frills. Cashier says 'that's simple should be a couple minutes'. 12 minutes later I walk up to the counter and ask about my sandwich and they say 'the chicken needs to be cooked'. I was done.
author: Mahesh A.

description: I didn't wait 6 minutes for a lukewarm egg cheese and bacon sandwich. We gotta do better
author: David D.

description: This is not the first time I have had something wrong with my order.. I ordered a mini burger with everything on it w/ jalapeño, grilled onions, and an egg with a side of garlic fries to go. I got my order today in a timely matter as it wasn't as busy as a normal lunch day. I got my order and went back to my office. As I was eating my burger, I noticed that something was wrong as my burger tasted so plain. Then I realized that they gave me a PLAIN burger with cheese.. I didn't want to walk back and complain as my lunch period was almost over. I feel like the employees there don't pay enough attention to detail about each individual order . My burger was also undercooked..
author: Samson L.

description: Reasonably priced, juicy burgers! One of the best burgers by my work place. Try their garlic fries and milk shakes. Simply delicious!
author: Alberto C.

description: We checked out this location hungry after an appointment. We really need to use the bathroom, guess what NO BATHROOMS!! At a food location seems ridiculous to me! It was difficult to enjoy my food needing to use the restroom. The cashier told us there was one down the street we went looking walked a while, and bathroom was out of service. The food was good my in-laws enjoyed the complimentary pickles, I personally could careless for them. The atmosphere is not rather inviting and the decor of the place is dull. For the price of the food one would think that at least the tables would be clean and the floor. They were not. I would never go back to this location even though I and my in-laws enjoyed the food.
author: Wendy F.

description: I'm a huge fan of Super Duper. Their burger is always great. Sometimes I get the salad with the burger patty on it. It's simple but delicious. The fries are just okay for me. The shakes are great. I wish their portobello mushroom wasn't breaded but it's okay. I'm often dissatisfied with most burgers but this place is reliable. Service is pretty fast, too.
author: Elsie M.

description:
Tried Super Duper Burger for the first time in December and loved it! Their burgers are really fresh and the garlic fries are amazing! 

I ordered the mini-burger, shared the garlic fries, and have yet to have any room left to try the desserts.

Highly recommended!!! Customer service is always great as well. :)
author: Kris V.

description: I love the garlic fries!!!!!!!! This is the only place I come for these Yummy fries. Also the whole staff is amazing!
author: Rina J.

description: This place is amazing! Great service, great food, and great prices! You CANNOT go wrong here! Every employee is so awesome! They greet you in a very professional and courteous way, remember your name, and my first time here gave me a free bacon donut and coffee. Jackie is a really nice person and it is a pleasure to have her as a cashier in the morning! All I can say is you HAVE to try this place if you have never been here, you will not regret it. If you do, there's something wrong with you! I started working down the street two weeks ago and have been a regular since. Manuel is also awesome. Just met him today for the first time ordering breakfast. Very professional and very kind. LOVE THIS PLACE!
author: Phil F.

description:
This place ain't shit. I came here looking for some sweet potato fries only to find out they did not have any. "Okay, cool," I thought. I love all strains of the potato, so I decided to go with their garlic fries. 

"Cheese, garlic, french fries, and parsley. How can I go wrong with that?", I thought.

I kid you not, after about 45 seconds after I took a seat upon paying, my order was complete; out and ready to be consumed as indicated by the employee yelling half way across the restaurant.
 
Referencing to the opening line of my review, this place ain't shit. They are incapable of even frying French fries. My French fries came out heavy and soggy. They tasted as if they had recently been thawed and immersed into the deep fryer. Personally, I like my fries crisp. I like them light and airy, to which this establishment failed to meet, tremendously. You can do better, Super Duper Burger. Try for making them in house, or switching up the technique or timing. Actually immerse the potatoes into the frier upon, you know, receiving the order. If it takes an extra five minutes to issue them, so be it. Don't compromise speed for quality and taste. 

Though I did not have the opportunity to be be disappointed by their alleged "super duper" burger, I can sure as hell tell you I won't be so much as paying them a visit next time I'm up in Northern California, because what's a "super duper" burger without an equally pairing side of potatoes?

It ain't shit, that's what. Go to Roam Artisan rather.
author: Nadir G.

description:
I like Super Duper, I do. I like that there's happy hour here too. BUT. The cashier didn't deduct for the happy hour special and when we asked, she insisted that it's already deducted. Sorry not sorry but you're wrong, lady. You deducted one HH special, not both. And I have the receipt to prove it.

There's no bathroom here either but they have moist towelettes if you ask. The bathroom is part of the shared building and if you come here after building hours, you need to get the key card and walk half a block to get to the door and find the bathroom in there. Meh.

And there's only 2 beers on tap: IPA and Pilsner. So yeah, sure, this Super Duper has the HH special too but no bathroom and limited beer choices steer me away. I rather go to the one at the Metreon.
author: Sandy T.

description: The AK47 of burger joints: reliable, consistent and a go-to option for many of life's (culinary) situations. There's nothing stellar about the Super Burger (+blue cheese, grilled onions, egg, jalepenos) or the fries: the burger was poorly ratioed and assembled, the fries unremarkable.  I'll certainly return for a another burger/fries/beer lunch, but I'll not walk-in with expectations of burger nirvana.
author: Risk D.

description:
The cookies and cream organic shake is cookied and creamy, and didn't make me hate myself afterward. Though, you might appreciate sharing it with a fellow c&c enthusiast - how hard can they be to find ;)

They offered a large cup for free ice cold water and had racer 5 on tap today. I hope it's there next time.

Oh and the super duper is a solid burger sub-$10. Thank you for being open till 6:30pm on a Saturday!
author: Joel F.

description: Excellent service. Delicious food. They had Jenga out on the tables for nye!
author: Ace V.

description: This Super Duper on Mission continues to be the only place I'll go to get my coffee in the morning. Yes I love four barrel coffee but that's not why I keep going. It's the incredible staff. Every morning they are so friendly it really makes my day. Thank you Mani, Xavier, Jackie & Mario! You're the best! And I really suggest trying their egg sandwich, it's delicious & healthy.
author: Jennifer S.

description:
I'd give this place 4.5 stars if it weren't for the constant screwups on my order...

When I'm asked "do you want cheese?" and I say "no cheese" I expect two things: that there not be cheese on my burger and that I not be charged for it. It's really disappointing that when I point out the error to the cashier they offer to remove the cheese but not refund the price they charge for it (!).
author: Christopher W.

description: One of the best burgers ever! Garlic fries were amazing as well!! Quick, clean and friendly staff. The tables are a little too close to one another but whatever.
author: Juliann N.

description: Service is super friendly and they offered me water while waiting for my to-go. I usually order the mini combo meal with the burger that comes with fries and a drink - I would upgrade the fries to their garlic fries and the drink to the oreo milkshake. My mother was craving burgers too and I ordered this to bring home, and she loved it! The oreo milkshake is my favorite, so I highly recommend :)
author: Amanda C.

description: Decent burgers, delicious shakes, cool vibe, prompt service.
author: Andrew B.

description: Great expected burger joint, good prices, nice location, many options and add-ons.  Friendly staff and quick food prep make it a fast done. Will be returning.
author: Daniel D.

description: Came here for lunch during Super Bowl week, Great fresh burgers, good service the cashier was good about recommending options. Recommend getting a shake to go :)
author: A C.

description:
For those East Coast crazos that rave about Shake Shack, come check out Super Duper and then tell me that the West Coast doesn't have anything as good. I've had Shake Shack a bunch of times this past year and I the Super Duper is very similar in my opinion. The burger is a bit on the smaller side, patty is a bit peppery, the bun softer than most and the veggies are simply and refreshing.

If I think so highly of Super Duper, why only 3 stars? Cause I'm still a fan of In-N-Out. For a simple throwback burger, In-N-Out can't be beat. Fresh, juicy and cheap. Super Duper is going for that hometown burger joint feel, but charging a bit too much for it. I'd have it again if i was there, but I wouldn't seek it out
author: Billy T.

description: It's too expensive for the kind of food they have and not so special but vegan burger was nice in taste
author: Mahek C.

description:
One of my favorite burger places in the Bay Area!  The burgers taste so fresh and juicy and the garlic fries taste really good and garlicy.... what you're supposed to get if you order the garlic fries!  

I like them as much as I like the Habit, but, that might change if they plan to open a place in San Mateo or other part of the Peninsula.....
author: Edward L.

description: The burgers are really good and the Oreo shake is amazing but even though it's San Francisco, it's too expensive for what it is. It's a cool place to go if you work in the area and have time to try all the places around.
author: Dakota G.

description: Quick service. I ordered the organic regular size vanilla ice cream. A little expensive for a soft serve cone and tasted like generic soft serve. But the place does have a good selection of foods so I'd recommend this corner spot for anyone looking for a quick lunch or a sit down meeting.
author: Vu D.

description:
Note:  you can wait up to 15 minutes for your food during peak lunch rush. 

Great food here. Burgers, breakfast sandwiches, and a bomb chicken sandwich.
author: Alan T.

description:
Moooove over every other burger joint - Super Duper lives up to all the hype! 

I ordered the "Mini Burger" which just means one patty - the "Super Burger" has two.  I opted for everything on the burger - lettuce, tomato, onion and I added cheddar cheese and avocado.  My oh my, this was hands-down one of the best burgers I've ever had.  It was SO juicy, literally dripping!  Don't forget to order their garlic fries -- de-freakin-licious! The chipotle dipping sauce - yum, their pickles - yum!  Everything is good...EVERYTHING! 

This will be my go-to place whenever I'm craving a burger.  I hear they also have spiked milk shakes!
author: Suki B.

description:
I tried Super Duper Burger about a week ago and it was ok but the patty was very very red and kind of rare. 

I came in around 3pm and it was still packed and lots of people were ordering the drinks and ice cream sundaes.

The service is very good and friendly and the burger was pretty good.
author: Gangsta G.

description: Ed, the manager for Super Duper contacted me and gave me his assurance that the issues would be rectified and encouraged me to give them another chance. I have gone back a few times and other than a couple of long waits, the issues appear to be resolved. I decided to up their rating to three stars and I will re-evaluate again after a couple more visits.
author: Nick B.

description:
Ill be real..my homegirl was hyping this place up to the MAX. So we had to try it when I stopped by in the city to have lunch with her. 

All in All a SOLID burger. Had it protein style, super duper with two tastey patties with ALL the fixings. I really like the way the cheese is melted covering all the meat like a pair of boxers..OOOOOEEYYY GOOOEEEY DELICIOUS BOXERS i might add. The beef taste like great quality and the food was great. The self serve pickles were great, alil on the sour side but still very yummmo.

All in all a solid burger place that gets around ~12 for fries and a soda. I opted for no fries and just water..trying to eat alil bit more healthy. The staff is super nice and maintained the busy restaurant pretty well. Someone was always wiping down tables, making sure the condiment bar/fountain drink area was clean. I would eat here again but id take a double double animal & protein style xtra xtra xtra xtra grilled onions over this any day.
author: Johnny G.

description:
Damn good vanilla dipped cones. The chocolate is high quality and soft serve. Screw Dairy Queen this place is the real deal.

I realize this isn't the most insightful review-- but the point is if you're thinking about getting a dipped soft serve, allow yourself the privilege and calories to do so.
author: Amelia D.

description: I ordered the salad with chicken to go. I believe the lettuce, tomatoes, and cucumbers were not dried properly. Also my salad dressing resemble mayo. I live in the Eastbay and was disappointed to find my salad like that. If there is a next time, I will open up the lid and inspect the contents.
author: Felicia M.

description:
Ok, you got me, Super Duper - you've got some pretty super duper burgers!

I'd been skeptical about this burger chain, but first bite had me converted into a fan.  Went for the $6.75 8oz two patty, but probably would have fared just as well with the $4.75 4oz one patty.  Burger was juicy and messy as promised, as any burger should be.  Loved the variety of free toppings - "everything on it" (lettuce, tomatos, red onions, super sauce), jalapenos, grilled onions, and pickles.  Shared a $2.75 order of garlic fries, served with fresh garlic and 6 month aged cheddar, and while I thought they were tasty, I think those around me for the remaining entirety of the day suffered the wrath of my garlic breath.  Oops.  Don't say I didn't warn you.

I do have to say that I do have two regrets:

- I forgot to order an egg in my burger
- I mustered the resistance to pass on a super shake, only now wishing my willpower hadn't been so strong.  I mean, cookies and cream?  Come on!
author: Mel T.

description: Really fire. Was visiting and found it at random just being a tourist. Incredible milk shake and garlic fries with a super juicy burger. Wish there's was one near my home town. Nice location by the water very clean and cozy.  Plus nice people working there. It was a great end meal for my first time in sf. Go grub on their food asap
author: Number F.

description: No kinks to work out here, this Super Duper is definitely running at full force despite being a new kid in the neighborhood.  As someone who lives in the vicinity,  I can't begin to describe how happy I am to have a non-fancy pants restaurant.  And, the other Super Duper thing about this place is that it's open on the weekend! Huzzah!  I'll definitely be back for one of the sumptuous burgers and dat soft serve cone.
author: Lisa I.

description: I wanted this to be great because I've heard great things about super duper.  It wasn't great for my first experience.  The line to order was out the door but it was pretty quick and the guy taking the order was nice and explained that burger comes  out medium and asked if that would be ok.   Perfect, I said.  Well, comes the mini burger and the fries I ordered.  Fries were great.  The tomato slice in my burger had part of the produce sticker on it!!! I was still hopeful that burger would still be great without the tomato slice.  It wasn't.  It was not medium, but well done and it was dry even with the lettuce as well as the avocado slices I had paid extra for.  So disappointed.
author: Happy L.

description:
HALE YES! I just had my first Super Duper burger today for lunch and it lived up to the hype. I ordered the Super Duper with cheese and everything on it (lettuce, tomato, super sauce, onion) and even the bun tastes good. That's saying a lot for someone who usually orders protein style at In-and-Out.  The double patties are juicy and beefy, which sounds silly, but they smell good and you can tell they use good beef. Cheese isn't too salty and the vegetables are fresh. Add a little ketchup and I'm a happy camper. Soft serve is also rich and delicious. I work a few blocks from here and the cone doesn't make it back into the office!

I've also tried a couple breakfast items here. The egg sandwich is a little small but I like how they fold the cheese into the egg so it's part of the egg. I've also had it where the cheese is just layered on top of the egg, but I prefer the other way better. Bacon is nice and crispy, but not too dry or burnt. Their donuts are just okay - a little too dense for my liking (I'm a Krispy Kreme girl all the way). I was happy to receive one of their free coffee with purchase cards but I just can't get behind Four Barrel coffee, which is way too sour/acidic for me. It pretty much reminds me of Chinese herbal medicine, YUCK. I tried the coffee multiple times to see if it was a fluke but each time it was super sour so I ended up tossing my coffee card.

TL;DR: Stick to the burgers and soft serve!
author: Bella L.

description: Went there with two co workers yesterday. We all ordered the super duper combo. The three of us all got sick and ended up throwing up. I wouldn't recommend ordering this meal.Ive been to this location often and have never had any issues until yesterday .
author: Dylan H.

description:
the first time at this Super Duper but enjoyed it just like the others..

really a fantastic burger for the price! Juicy, great meat and you can get it like you want it :)

Happiness!
author: Steven W.

description:
Burger was tasty, great meat - the bacon and cheese made it even better. Fries were undercooked and cold. 

I was bummed at the lack of customer service. I asked where the restroom was and employee told me that there wasn't one and he'd walk me next door in a moment... He then chatted with another customer while I finished my meal. He could have just told me there was no restroom available. Maybe would have been less annoying if they were busy.
author: Sara S.

description: Organic, fresh, local, and very delicious!  Grass fed cows and compostable packaging to boot!  Friendly fast service too.... The best of fast food and slow food in one!
author: Kevin K.

description:
Great burgers and ice creams
Outdoor tables and very nice people.
Only downside is they don't have bathrooms which can be a challenge with kids.
author: Alex D.

description: The garlic fries are friekishly good and the burger is miles above average.  Add the friendly and efficient service, housemade pickles, and organic ingredients, then you end up with a winning formula that should be part of your lunch rotation.  I've been to New York's Shake Shack plenty of times.   I'd put Super Duper against it in a blind taste test any day.
author: Angel S.

description: Love that you can get a quality burger for dinner in SF for under $10 still.  My favorite part are the house made pickles that are offered by the jarful for you to take as many as you would like. Everything here sings quality.  I would suggest going with the dip trio- the sauces are fantastic on the fries as well as your burger.
author: Jojo L.

description: Burgers are great. Cheeseburgers are great. Fries are great. I love this restaurant. If getting a heart attack tastes like this... get me a cardiologist ASAP! 5 STARS!!!!!!!!
author: Jake H.

description:
I dropped in to this place around 6 in the evening on a weekday because I was starving and came out quite satisfied! So much so that I had to come back again the next day. At this place, I've tried:
- cookies and cream shake (delicioso)
- mini burger with cheese (juicy)
- garlic fries (could be a meal all by itself)

Would strongly recommend all of the above. This place has plenty of seating inside and outside. Food was better when I ate in over takeout.
author: Jen G.

description:
The first thing to love about this place is that it is one of the few reasonably priced restaurants open past business hours south of Market in the FiDi. It seems like everywhere else only caters to the lunch crowd and closes very early, so I'm happy to have another option in the evening.

Another plus is that this location is only one block from Embarcadero Station. A group of us at UCSF decided to place a pick-up order here, and Natalie and the staff were very helpful in accommodating our large order. Then it was only 1 block to the T and back to Mission Bay where everybody thoroughly enjoyed their Super Burgers & fries. The free jalapeños were much appreciated, and the pickle slices are bomb.

Oh yeah, and the soft-serve is fantastic so Super Duper Burgers also doubles as a dessert venue -- who would have thought? I will definitely be back soon.
author: Nima E.

description:
This is a first. I was the only person in line and still couldn't place an order. Cashier was on the phone the entire time. Zero eye contact or acknowledgement that I was there.

Get it together guys.
author: Tom D.

description:
Decent burgers, albeit overly greasy.  The quality varies between location.  The 4-star is for the 98 Mission St location.  The others I've been to are 3-star.  

Overall, I'd recommend them.  Quality toppings.  Nice extras like free spicy pickles.  They even have a decent veggie burger.
author: Ryan C.

description:
Ok i know this is a chain but I had to give it a go.

Nice decor inside.

Good burger although a tad bit greasy.  It was nice and moist with a generour dressing of extras.

The Galric Fries were super garlicky but tasted yummy.  

We choose "on-tap" drinks as you could get refills.

I like the fact the recycle all the packaging - this is a good thing.

It's a four star as it was just a bit too over greasy.
author: Emma W.

description: I've been here a few times. The last couple of times have been a little disappointing. Food was cold and lacked flavor and wanted to try it wrapped in lettuce as opposed to a bun and it was poorly put together, fell apart, soggy, lettuce was drenched. Disappointing
author: N T.

description:
Today was the first time and was impressed. I got the mini combo and worth the price. The lines were long but went by five to eight minutes. It was worth the wait and the quality is good and hot. 

Definitely will come back the next time I'm in the city.
author: Linh P.

description: I'd say the place might use a bit faster service, because when we came our table was dirty and until i asked no one cleaned it, but if not for this minor detail, everything was pretty good. If you're not too hungry I won't recommend getting the super combo, that's a mistake I made. You will most likely be fine with just a mini combo. Garlic fries are absolutely a must try and the burgers were really fresh and tasty.
author: Luba Y.

description:
Surprisingly awesome place to get breakfast, too.  They've got a great egg sandwich with bacon and fantastic coffee.

Also, their burgers and shakes rock my world
author: Tim C.

description: Great burgers my daughter had the garlic fries she thought they were awesome in her words. A great change of pace from the wonderful seafood in the area.
author: Ronie A.

description: I had a mini super burger, fries, coke, and a couple of pickle pieces on Friday 5/29/15 at 11:30 a.m.The burger was tasty, fries were good and the pickles were ok. The problem started about 5 hours later when I noticed that the food in my stomach was no going through. It felt as though I just ate. A couple hours later, the vomiting started. On into the night, diarrhea had set in and kept me up and down all night. The weekend was no fun as I was ill until this Monday morning. I went to see the Manager this morning at 9 :30 a.m. to see the store manager and explain what had happened. I wasn't going to YELP about it. It happens, I know, from time to time and I hate writing negative reviews BUT, the little man at the counter told me to go online. He was more interested interested in taking more orders than he was interested in helping me contact the store manager. For this reason  I give them 1 star,  the middle finger, and a promise to contact the health department. I'm not sure if it was the burger, the drink dispenser, the pickles ( only pieces were left in jar) or an employee not washing hands. Shame on you! I hope I can at least bring some misery on you by contacting the health department. I payed for your mistakes for 72 hours...
author: Rick P.

description:
Argumentative, defensive customer service. I was shown my receipt with my order's time stamp as proof that I was being impatient and should know my role and be quiet and wait. 

What happened to "the customer is always right"? Don't prove to me that I am wrong, and certainly don't argue. Just say it's on its way, there was something on the grill before or whatever explains the delay, and smile reassuringly. They seriously skimped on training the staff here. 

I was the only customer at 10:30am. No reason to make me stand around and watch your fully staffed kitchen prepare catering orders. 

Go to the location on market street instead. Well worth the walk.
author: Slim M.

description: Food was DE LI CIOUS!!! Best burger I've had this year! Will definitely not be the last time I come here. Had the mini cheeseburger with portobello mushroom and grilled onion, garlic fries and regular coke. Had the strawberry shake too. Think I went into a food coma lol
author: Racquel E.

description: Oh yum!!!  I ordered the little burger and it is actually pretty big, as well as juicy and totally good. Sorry Bistro Burgers, these guys are much better!!!
author: AnneMarie W.

description:
I absolutely love this place!! This is my new go to spot if I ever want a burger & if I'm in the area.

Cheeseburgers + Super Sauce - Great! :) AHHHH!
(my mouth's already drooling just thinking about it)
Fries - Fries! I love fries!
Icre Cream Cone Dipped in Chocolate - TO DIE FOR! (Came back the next day after having my first one)

Their homemade pickles are so good! If you love pickles, you'll love theirs!
author: JG I.

description: Like the others, consistent and excellent.  Went very early so zero line.  Nice thing here is if you want more elbow room, can go take your food to One Market or Rincon Center to eat.
author: Marc S.

description: Tried three different mornings to call in a order. Called almost 15 times each time and never received a answer on any day. THEY DO NOT ANSWER THE PHONE.
author: Brianna S.

description: Super Duper has the best service. They always make me feel welcome and the food is really good! I get the warm fuzzies here!! They go out of their way for people and its awesome. Customer for life!
author: Domenique B.

description: I first came to this location for lunch, I ordered a mini burger meal with a chocolate malt shake. Pickles are amazing. Super delish. I now come frequently for breakfast now. I have tried the egg sandwich with cheese and bacon, but my new favorite is the egg sandwich with sausage and the aioli. GET THE AIOLI.
author: Janelle O.

description:
Now that is a tasty burger... 

Pros:
-Good customer service 
-Food comes in reasonable time frame, even when busy 
-Food is good 

Cons:
-The single is a bit small
author: Brandon G.

description: Finally had the chance to try it today after the lunch rush.  No wait and super fast.  Got a super burger with grilled onions, jalapenos, lettuce and tomatoes, no salt and non-salted fries.  Everything was done well.  The meat was cooked perfect medium.  Couldn't tell if the jalapenos were fresh cut then grilled or pre-cut then grilled.  Solid choice and under $10 and I'm full.  Definitely go during non-peak times.
author: Josh L.

description: This is the superstar of the Super Duper chain. Same great food as other locations, but somehow minus all the chaos. Staff is very attentive, and I love the outdoor patio. Close to the action, but just off the grid enough to seem like a find.
author: Robert M.

description: The burgers are juicy and delicious, the chicken sandwiches have a great sauce, and the veggie burgers are surprisingly flavorful. I would give five stars, but the frequency of mistakes in my order is a little too high (especially since I don't special order anything).
author: Eric R.

description: the burgers are really good but they are greasy, beware of the greasy dripping from the burger wrap. I tried the garlic fries and that are the best garlic fries I've had. The fries are lightly coated with garlic and cheese. I wish this placed offered curly fries, it would be a dream.
author: Elba A.

description: Oh my oh my. If you want a burger that has its juices running down your hands and melt in yoir mouth order the super burger. My my.
author: Aretha B.

description:
Visited Super Duper off Mission and Spear after seeing it in Valley Fair mall in San Jose. I had only heard positive reviews from friends and thought my wife, few friends, and myself would try it. 

Burger quality is 3/5, poor seasoning, artificial fats added for flavor. Poor quality meat. 

They had nice produce and pickles seemed fine. But this is by far from a great burger and just slightly above Smash###### in terms of edible. 

Boo
author: Justin S.

description:
We usually had great service and good at Super Duper Burger. The food was good but actually getting that food was such an ordeal. 

We ordered 3 mini burgers and 2 regular fries. After 25 mins of waiting for the buzzer to buzz, we head up to the counter and ask where our food is. The girl says that we had a really big order and it's still being worked on.  After another 10 mins, she actually checks and says that our order was never started. She grabs the manager who proceed to tell us all the various reasons why we don't have our food yet, rather than start making our food. We tell them what we ordered again and they bring it out saying "sorry about that". The burgers, once we got them, were still very good.
author: Christopher A.

description: Super Duper Burger is as good as a burger can get.  I tried the Chicken Sandwich with Chipotle Aioli and everything on it.  The ingredients are fresh and the chicken is cooked to the perfection and is tender and juicy.  Don't try to try the pickles from the Condiments section, they are delicious and complimentary.  Also the prices are reasonable for the level of food and the type of good customer service you get at this place.  Lunch lines can get bigger, so either go very early or go late to avoid long lines.
author: Ani R.

description: Yummy garlic fries. Tender chicken sandwich.  It was a tad spicy but not bad. I was so full after. Did not even finish the fries which were laced in cheese. The music is way too loud... Feels like you are in a club!  The line gets long so come early.  They have lemons for your water. Yay. The employees also seem very nice.
author: Esther S.

description:
Super Duper is good quality food for the price, and always tasty. You have to try their chicken sandwich with cheese. But the reason I'm writing is because of my experience buying breakfast here yesterday.

I needed to bring in donuts for a coworker's last day. Turns out these guys have delicious ones, made fresh on premises. Think Krispy Kreme glazed, with sweetened lemon zest on top. I ordered two dozen - they didn't have enough already made, so they asked if I would be willing to wait 5 minutes. They offered me complimentary coffee or juice while I waited. The donuts came out warm and delicious, and were a hit at the office. But most of all I really appreciated the great customer service. Thanks!
author: Jen M.

description:
amazingly mediocre.. 

Burger quality was pretty good but I thought it was over cooked.. in addition the burger is actually kind of small. I wasn't a fan of the fried egg that they added in.. I think the burger was just okay definitely not worth the price. 

 fries were wayy too salty.. shake was delicious! F
author: James H.

description:
Too much fluff.

When it's a bad thing: 50 page Powerpoint presentation.

When it's a good thing: $5 breakfast sandwich featuring an organic egg, muffin and large Four Barrel drip coffee. Light and fluffy on the eats. Smooth and potent on the drink.

Number theme continues as it was ready in 5 minutes. 

No such thing as too much of this.
author: Jason B.

description:
Finally got to try this place once it's opened a block away from my work. Can i just say, D-E-L-I-C-I-O-U-S. .Since it's been open for less than a month, lines are long. Got there at 11:30 and there was already a line 15 people deep!  

They have two choices of burgers: mini (1 patty) or super burger (2 patties). I actually went with the mini and was quite content. Unless you're starving I don't see the need for a 2-patty niman ranch burger. Can I just say the burger bun is also scrumptious! Now that's how you make a burger. 

You can also get regular fries or garlic fries. I opted for the latter and boy was it worth it.  This probably is on par with the Gordon Biersch Fries. They also have option to get 3 additional sauces for $1.50 but I didn't even bother trying those but I'm sure they are worth it. 

Good Burger, Fries, and at a decent price. I'm going to be a regular here.
author: Phillip D.

description: Solid burger joint and if you only need the 1/4 pound "mini" burger like me, reasonably priced. I get the craving for burgers about once a month and when I do, this is my first choice. Solid.
author: Jim A.

description:
First time trying this place and was pretty disappointing.

Only good thing was the garlic fries...

They advertise moist and juicy burgers, but mine was anything but that.  Burger was charred and dry.  Felt like sand paper going down my throat.  Will probably not try them again with so many burger places in the city around the same price if not cheaper and better.
author: Scottie P.

description: Good Burgers and better fries.  I go for the garlic fries with melted cheese and herbs.  I have to say that my draw to this place are their milkshakes.  They have some of the best milkshakes I've tried.  They use Strauss Ice Cream base.  I'm an ice cream junkie.  I give this place 4 stars because the burgers can be on the smaller size and their staff (depending on the day and location) can be a little aloof.  Regardless, go here instead of McDonalds and Burger King.  Fast food mega chains like that are dead
author: Joey S.

description:
Burgers are awesome. Simple and juicy. Almost has a hole in the wall diner taste but also just has something that makes it new and fresh. 

On the other hand, the 6 dollar salad with no additions was awful. Seemed like hamburger lettuce in a box. Salad lettuce and burger lettuce are two very different things.  Bad but its to be expected and i shouldve known better. Skip it.
author: Jonas K.

description: New location, still consistent, still my favorite fast food burger in the City. Added avocado and grilled onions, had a lemonade as well.
author: Maximillian M.

description:
Excellent meat quality. Burger cooked right consistently. The grind/consistency of the meat is fantastic. 

Speedy service and perfect location.

Im going to remove a star because they just served me cold garlic fries. I guess those are just sitting there in the foil bag under a heat lamp. I would have waited for fresh fries.

Excellent shakes as well.
author: Ken W.

description: Awesome Burgers loved it best in San Francisco thanks to Yelp we found it, me and my wife loved the food and service
author: Grant M.

description: Good burgers, just super duper greasy! I love the combos they have here. Burger + Fries + Fountain drink = $9 and some change! Burgers are extra juicy and extra greasy. I would prefer a little less grease. The garlic fries were also amazing, just dripping with grease. I had the burger combo after the recent San Francisco Rock and Roll Marathon, craving a burger fix...but I just felt really bloated and unattractive afterwards.
author: Narciso A.

description: Really happy they continue to expand locations. This one has great outdoor seating and is a far superior value to nearby ferry building food locations that are also high quality but with ferry premium prices. Order takers are always nice and food comes up pretty quickly. I recommend burgers, fries, and shakes, each among the best in the city.
author: J D.

description: One of the best burgers I have ever had. Nice friendly staff and my biggest suprise was the homemade cucumbers they are really cool. I'm definitely coming back soon.
author: Andreoni P.

description: Great Food! The Garlic Fries are Delicious! Next time I'm in town I will defiantly stop by! The customer service was excellent as well!
author: Gabriela H.

description: Vegetarian burger was sooo good. Along with the garlic fries! And milkshakes! This meal is so filling and yummy, I couldn't be more content after finishing this. I think it's the combination of hummus and cucumbers that make the burger really unique to me. I love burgers but there aren't many quick grab-and-go places that have vegetarian options (In-n-out, 5 guys, step up your game please). Highly recommend this spot if you haven't tried it!
author: Sam U.

description: These guys need to get their management and service sorted out. Super duper disorganised. Sadly it's an open kitchen so you can the mess unfolding. Probably okay if they are not busy but more than 4 orders and it's all panic.
author: Red E.

description: I like Super Duper, and the food is really great. I am deducting one point because it is pretty expensive for what you get which I understand why, but perhaps I just want more. I will say that the cashiers there seem like they are having a great time, and that is infectious in a good way! If you like burgers then hop on over to Super Duper
author: Justin C.

description: This is my Go-To on Sundays when I'm at work and didn't bring lunch. They're always in a good mood and their burgers are great. I like that they can accommodate for my diet -- lettuce wrapped burger without sauce aka paleo). The burger itself is juicy and has plenty of flavor. I haven't had the chance to try anything else but I will definitely tell people that this is a good place to eat.
author: Noel A.

description: Huge fan of super duper- we usually go to the other location which has balcony seating - but this one is totally cool too. Veggie burger is a delight!  #whatveganseat Yum!!
author: Cherriesan P.

description: The burger here is definitely better than other fast food burger places but it's no gourmet burger. The garlic fries was ok, nothing special. I do like their pickles though.
author: Tina C.

description: Wow... That's really all I can say. I have never tasted a burger that was that great and in such a small package( if you get the mini you know what I mean!) Fantastic food, fresh and a great atmosphere. My only gripe is I wish I either worked or lived in San Fran so I can eat there more. I guess having a friend who works two blocks away will have to do! This place is definitely doing it right.
author: Nikki C.

description: First Super Duper experience. Have had grass fed hand made hamburgers and organic shakes made from real ice cream before (Chicago) and never thought it could get better than that. WELL IT JUST DID! Unbelievable taste and so juicy! I had super burger (2-4 oz paties)with cheese +shake...i wish I had ordered 2 of them (they're big enough...im a pig for great tasting food, that's all)!
author: Allan C.

description: Soo greasy but soo good. Easily gets my stamp of approval, which means a lot because I'm weirdly picky about burgers. I got a mini burger, which is one patty and much like a standard sized burger, with blue cheese added. I love that the beef patty had little bits on the edge that were grilled to a crisp. The fries were exactly how I like them too. Cool local chain. I would definitely come here for my next burger craving, and then walk around the city for the rest of the day, just to burn some of those ingested calories. The patio seating is really nice on a sunny day!
author: Rita L.

description:
3.5
much better experience second time around

came here for lunch for my coworkers bday

ordered:
-mini bacon cheesebuger: mini's are pretty big
-garlic fries: good as i remember 
-cookies and cream milkshake
-swirl choco dipped cone

after a recent visit to umami next to the ball park, i prefer super duper when im in this area
author: Raquel T.

description: Best burgers ever! Better than Fuddruckers or Johnny Rocket. They are juicy and bit greasy.Try the garlic fries. They are perfect. Also try the strawberry-chocolate milkshake combination.
author: Celinés V.

description: My second time here today. The wait time was way better as I got there post their peak 11:30pm to 12:30pm rush hour. Ordered the chicken burger with chocolate shake and got the order served in about 5 min.  The burger was supposed to be with no tomatoes but some how I saw plenty of them in my burger. The staff was very quick to apologize and fix the issue. I just asked the tomatoes to be removed. However, they offered to replace the entire burger for me in case I had any allergies with tomatoes.  On insisting that I am just fine with it removed, it was quickly taken care of.  The burgers and the chipotle sauce is good !  Chocolate shake is super good.  I think this is going to be my go to place for lunch.
author: Prathamesh T.

description: The Super Duper Burger was most certainly the best burger I've ever had at a fast food restaurant. Sure, it's a league above a drive-thru, but you can be in and out in less than ten minutes. They make fresh and local ingredients a priority, which shows in the quality of their food. I highly recommend ordering it with all the toppings, adding cheese, grilled onions, and jalapeño. The garlic fries were soft on the inside, and perfectly crisp on the outside. To top it all off, finish with a chocolate-dipped soft serve ice cream cone. The restaurant was extremely busy at lunch time, so I would suggest dining before noon or after 1:30. Well worth a short wait!
author: Ashley J.

description: Pretty burger and decent price. They have outdoor seating too.  If it were a little cheaper Id give another star
author: Eric R.

description:
Awesome burgers, awesome service! I've stopped at this location both during the week and on the weekends and it's always top notch.  

Burger: 5. Was cooked just right, nice and juicy with the fixings. The buns always taste fresh as well. 

Fries: 4. Not quite as crispy as I usually prefer, but that's just my personal preference for fries. They still tasted great. 

Service: 5. You can tell they these guys know what they're doing. Even with a line out the door at lunch hour during the week I can order, eat and be back to work in no time. Overall a fantastic place!
author: Ryan R.

description: This place just makes me happy. Grass fed beef burgers. Garlic fries. Wine. You can get a fried egg or avocado on your burger. The food is so good. I have one near my work in SF and was happy to see one come to my neighborhood in Novato. The housemade pickles are delicious. Great service. Very clean. They actually get your order right. Very efficient. My kids complained that their burgers were too rare. I guess ask for well done if you don't like any pink. I thought it was perfect.
author: Lori S.

description: Wow. Just wow. Have you ever dreamed about a burger just melting in your mouth? Have you dreamed about eating your burger and having an out of body experience? Super duper burger can help induce the feeling of a drug high upon the first bite, but without the illegal repercussions. The best burger I've had in a long while. I don't know what sauce they throw on there, it's pretty indescribable. You NEED to get a side of garlic fries, and stock up on their pickles at the condiment area. Line at this location gets long during lunch hour.. Actually I've been at all hours of the day and it's always consistently packed. People need their burger high!
author: Angeli W.

description: Decent burger here. I order the 4 oz burger with garlic fries & aged cheese. Nice price coming in at under $10. The burger wasn't too greasy and the lettuce and tomato were fresh.
author: Nathan B.

description: Everything I've had here is delicious. That includes the breakfast sandwich, hose made donuts, four barrel coffee, and the mini meal which you can upgrade to get any beverage you want. I highly recommend spiking your milkshake or malt.
author: Sandeep B.

description: Great burger at reasonable price. Burger was made to perfection.  The shakes are made with Strauss cream. And they are open till 9 on the weekdays which is great since nothing is opened at that hour for fast food.
author: James W.

description: Awesome burger! So fresh and juicy! Garlic fries are in top! Woman at the desk is super nice :) my fries were cold but they changed for warm ones... Good service and clean
author: Yannick G.

description: My wife says it's tied for her favorite burger place anywhere. I like it fine, but I guess I'm just not that big of a burger guy, so they only get three stars for the food from me. They get an extra star for being open later at night and on weekends after most of the other places have closed.
author: Nathan P.

description: The food is good but take out service SUCKS big time in this branch, esp. in the evening. Went there 2x and had to wait long for my to go order. The first time, they almost gave my order to another person without checking the receipt (no buzzer was given to me)! Lucky, I was right in front of the counter to claim my order. Second time, they gave me the buzzer and I had to wait IN FRONT of the counter for 30 minutes! They eventually asked me because the server looked uncomfortable with me staring at them. And guess what... They missed my order! No appologies given both time. Will NOT go here again to dine.
author: Mel J.

description: Just a good burger, but not something I would probably go out of my way to get. I got the mini cheese burger with grilled onions and everything on it. Not enough grilled onions in my burger; I got 2 bites of grilled onions and that was it. Also had an order of regular fries. Good fries, perfectly salted. Plenty of seating. Quick service.
author: Liliana P.

description: This is the best super duper burger! The employees are so nice and helpful and the food was as delicious as you would expect!
author: Mickey A.

description: Needed some breakfast, saw the $5 breakfast special.  Egg and cheese on a muffin, mini donut and coffee.  Coffee was quite good, Four Barrel I believe.  Now the egg thing and mini donut, meh.  I mean I saw the guy in the kitchen working, but it felt like the egg was heated in a microwave, slapped on, cheese on a heat lamp for two minutes as they made everyone wait the two to three minutes.  Staff was nice.
author: Rey D.

description: I had a pretty super duper burger at Super Dupet the other day. If you're expecting an unconventionally put together burger with odd flavors you might be disappointed. But they make a basic burger really well. It's juicy and straight to the point. If you did yourself there, make sure you order the Parmesan garlic fries, hey are friggin good. You know you've had tasty garlic fries of your breath is still hummin it's goodness two hours later. Lastly, after your order is ready, do yourself a favor and grab yourself ten of those pickles they put out. Ohhhhh
author: Anna K.

description: Shake Shack rip off, but with a forgettable burger. It was drowning in that "special sauce" that over powered everything else. Solid garlic fries and house made pickles though. If I ever go back it would be to try that soft serve cone.
author: Anna V.

description: It's like Five Guys & Shake Shack got together and had a baby.. that's better than them! Homemade pickles, homemade mayo that makes the burger just that much better. The Burger was so juicy, and is all grass-fed meat (for you picky health freaks out there). Even the fries are amazing. Awesome place - but did I mention - THEY SERVE BEER TOO? Beer and a Burger, and all you can eat home-made pickles. That makes 5 stars for me.
author: Jess S.

description: Greasy but in a good way. :) The patties tastes like good quality meat and you get the impression all the ingredients are food quality. The garlic fries are an awesome side too. Service was fast and friendly plus I enjoyed the cheesy classic tunes that were playing (Stevie Wonder, Journey, the Eagles)! ;) I would definitely return myself and am happy recommend it to others.
author: Abbie P.

description: The best fast-food burger I have ever had.  I'm hoping they open one closer to home.  Next time I'm in SF, I am definitely stopping by.
author: Sang J.

description: I was expected a little more for the slightly overpriced fast food. The lady at the counter was nice but the burger was ho hum. bummer
author: Tiff W.

description: Great burger. No need to go for the full burger as the mini is 4oz. While that doesn't seem like much to the average Joe, keep in mind that is still a quarter pounder. It had a nice sesame seed bun, great condiments, and a nice peppery patty that tasted like real meat. Great fries and a soda all for under $10! Fantastic burger and lunch spot. Be ready for a line if you get there after noon, but there's lots of room to sit and enjoy, and they even have the buzzers like the big restaurants to know when your food is ready while you sit and enjoy your drink.
author: Brent J.

description: Super duper is just everywhere! Delicious food. Always busy. Convenient. Awesome ice cream.
author: Anudari K.

description: Mediocre.  Burger was overcooked, buns reminiscent of the last bag of wonder bread at a sad convenience store.
author: Nicholas P.

description: The burger is pretty awesome in that it was juicy and packed a lot of flavor in a bun. My to go place when I am in mood for a burger. The only downside is that it can be a bit pricey, and I think the joint near Metreon is even more expensive then the one near Emberaccado. The fries cost extra, but are worth it.
author: Vincent P.

description: Two Thumbs Up!! Great customer service, food is amazing and the atmosphere is on point but the only thing is the restroom is outside to the right down block in a building pass the security to the right . lol I still give it five stars thou
author: Adrianna R.

description: Super duper was alright for me. The problem is the patty although tender lacks flavor. I still prefer the 4505 meat burger in the ferry building.
author: Caina S.

description:
I have come here several times now and have settled into a nice routine.  I always get a super burger with everything, grilled onions, super sauce, a sunny-side egg.  Sometimes I'll get a milkshake.  Sometimes I'll get fries.  Sometimes I'll get pickles.  Sometimes I'll get a 2nd burger.  Whatever I choose, I always come away satiated.

Sure, the wait can be long - 15-20 min is pretty long for a burger + fries, but it's still much better than waiting 3 hours for, say, a street food ramen festival.  There's no bathroom, which can be annoying, but it hasn't affected the taste of my food yet.  Overall, I will happily come back again for their juicy, happy (the sauce comes in a happy face) burgers.
author: Josh Q.

description: i love that this place is a one-stop shop -- shakes, burgers, coffee, fries! I hope service is faster than when it first opened. Would def go back for burger cravings. it's super quiet here on weekends. at first i wasn't a huge fan of the juicy burgers but now that i think about it, it tastes most natural like the way my grandma made them at home. so JUICY. but def messy...don't go on a first date here!
author: Emm C.

description: Fun staff, open later and on weekends depending on your location.  Tasty tasty burgers and pickles.  I'm a fan.
author: Jeff E.

description: We do huge catering orders for our office and Super Duper Burger BROUGHT IT! Our employees LOVED them so much that now we do a regular order often. The burger are delicious, the fries are off the hook and the service is friendly, efficient, and personal. We heart you Super Duper!
author: R. P.

description: We really liked this place. The food was good, the service was friendly, and the atmosphere was fun. Good people watching out the window and good music coming from the speakers. We had no expectations and it was a nice surprise!
author: Katy F.

description: Delicious garlic fries! Convenient location on the way to casual carpool (sorry for smelling like garlic, drivers!).  Pretty quick to get out order and decent size fry order size. Haven't tried the veggie burger yet, but that will be next up!
author: Sheena C.

description: Pretty good burger! Felt delicious and fresh. The super burger is really big and should be enough for everybody. The fries are also good but not enough for their price.
author: Mike Y.

description: Fresh, fast burger and fries! Line out the door but it moves fast now that they have three registers open. Free samples of their fries with chipotle aioli while you wait! Tip: you can request an egg on your burger.
author: Abby H.

description:
I do like burgers but this place is only ok. Yes it is fast and yes you know what to expect at each Super Duper Burger you go to, but at the end of the day, it is not the best burger in the city. 

One great tidbit is the veggie burger which doesn't pretend to be a meat patty. The colorful pieces of veggies in the patty are enticing.

I also like that you can get a mini milkshake.

Negative: There is NO bathroom
author: Sophia B.

description: At long last, something spurred me to write my first Yelp review after years of turning to Yelp for input. I travel frequently and often enjoy watching how businesses operate. I can think of three times in the last decade when I've come across someone who made me think, "I would hire that person for anything." I thought that this evening at--of all places--Super Duper Burger in San Francisco. I needed a quick and inexpensive bite, they were open late-ish, and I was surprised to see that they had something from Bear Republic (a favorite brewery) on tap. Sold! I enjoyed the beer. my veggie-burger-with-everything, and some nicely-done, house-made pickles. What really struck me was the fantastic person who took my order and made the quick meal memorable.
