As I sat in the corner and watched the evening crowd, I noticed the person who took my order did something similar with everyone else who streamed in: she looked people in the eye, had tremendous energy, and sent everyone to the pickup counter with a huge smile--over and over . . . when she wasn't zipping around attending to other details. She checked out for the evening just before I left. When I exited, I mentioned to the manager what I had observed, and she said, "That's Tashia! She is fantastic. Mention something on Yelp." So . . . here I am. In any role, in any profession, it can be difficult to fine someone who cares and to makes a difference. Tashia is one of those people, and she is hiding out at Super Duper Burger. Employers of San Francisco: your best potential people are not always the one currently eating your free snacks in the third-floor lounge or loudly ordering martinis after work. I sat next to some of them this evening before heading to the real world at Super Duper Burger. It turn out to be the biggest flameout ever, but I would place a very large bet that Tashia is that person who not only needs her next big break, but who would also help you make that same strong impression. Apologies for the weirdest restaurant review ever, but . . . wow. Don't overlook the unlikely places. Don't discount the people behind the counter. There's some latent talent out there ready to break out.
author: Paul G.

description: I don't usually complain, in fact it's the first time I've ever written a review on yelp, but if I'm paying 9+ dollars for a small burger, I expect to at least have it done quickly. Watching the workers makes me feel like they're on some far away island where time isn't an issue. Sorry, but this is SoMa, and people have things to do.
author: Rich A.

description: Love this place except the huge lunch time crowds. Very fresh and juicy burgers. I love the mini burger lunch deal. Under $10 bucks for a burger,fries and drink in downtown SF is not a bad deal. And the fact that its really good makes this super duper ;)  Make sure you grab some pickles.
author: Aaron W.

description: Customer service was awesome! Everyone was so friendly. The only thing is everytime i come here o have to wait too long but food is good!!!
author: CJ G.

description: Just flew in from Los Angeles and off the BART subway. Before checking into the hotel, we had to grab some food. Well damn bomb burger for sure.
author: Leo M.

description: They have happy hour fries- free fries with a beer purchase at happy hour.  The burger aint too bad either.  Juicy and fresh. I had their mini-burger with blue cheese and it was delicious.  Added a side of free fries and a Razor IPA on draught all for about $11! Dang, that's a deal!  Cool interior too.  I'd come back for sure!
author: Steven D.

description: Great burgers but their garden burger may be the best I've had. Add amazing garlic fries with a chipotle mayo dip and it's one of the best lunch spots around. Just bring gum for after the garlic.
author: Ron B.

description: this place has the bomb burgers. the taste is, out of sight. the flavor is intense. the cheese paper is off the chain. I think this is in my top five take out burgers. even open Saturday!
author: Lando H.

description: The service was absolutely amazing and the burgers are fabulous!! I'm in San Francisco on Mission and I'll definitely be back again before my trip ends in a week!!!
author: Cheryl S.

description: Great burger....waaaaay to long to wait. Over 20 min til we got our "big order" of 3 burgers and 1 fry. Took soooo long manager refunded our $$.
author: adam h.

description: Went here on recommendation of my "foodie" friend.  Service was fast and efficient.  The staff is friendly.  There can be long lines here during lunch time but it moves pretty fast.  I thought burgers were just OK though.  To be fair, I consider myself a burger nazi so it's pretty hard to impress me.  They do have a nice selection of beer to their credit.  They serve racer 5 (one of my favorites).
author: Bernard C.

description: Really good burger at a fair price. Get the double patty.
author: Cyrus A.

description: The beef burger is too oil...don't like the burger at all...but chicken sandwich is good :-) My colleague love the garlic fries
author: Danielle M.

description: Love Super Duper, hate this location. Took 15 minutes to get my order and had to ask for a refund to get it. The burger was in pieces. Pigeons everywhere in the restaurant, as well as trash.
author: Dan G.

description: Service with a smile, always.  The veggie burger was great, I wasn't a huge fan of the garlic parm fries but the regular fries are good.  I haven't had a normal burger here but everything I have had was just delightful.
author: Christine M.

description:
First visit to this new location and second visit to Super Duper.  I had such a delicious burger last time in the Marina that I drove 25 minutes to this place but unfortunately it was a fail. 
Asked to use the bathroom and was asked for my ID and then handed a large key and sent down the street felt like a quarter mile away. On the way out to the bathroom my buzzer went off and upon  completing the bathroom journey I returned to a lukewarm burger.  The cashier had forgotten to ask me if I wanted fries too which I did.  
They advertise that they cook the meat to a well done level but my burger was totally pink in the middle, definitely like a medium tops which I don't care for.  However I was hungry and ate it and it was just ok.  Definitely not better than others this time around.  
I'll give them another try seeking that first delicious burger and hopefully they will come through.  
The restaurant however is beautiful with floor to ceiling windows all the way around and beautiful decor but I don't get the higher height of some of the tables(chest level)!
Super Duper, you have a good thing going. Don't mess it up!
author: r t.

description: It's Super Duper. Niman Ranch beef.  Good ingredients everywhere.  My favorite burger in the Financial District.  Some people complain it's too juicy, I like it.
author: Spooge W.

description: Really like this place. Fast service, great quality, kind. Viva comfort food!!
author: Philippe s.

description: Super duper doesn't disappoint. Burger, milkshake, comes, garlic fries. It's all pretty good. It definitely Daisies my cravings for a better fast food burger than McDonalds. Still can't quite decide if I like this better or in-n-out, but since there's no in-n-out in the city, this is good
author: Edison T.

description: I'd never eaten or been to Super Duper before, smelled other people's take out from there (and drooled; people ought to be a little more considerate by  NOT bringing deliciously aromatic food onto a bus or train unless they are going to share with everyone) so it was someplace I knew I needed to get to someday.  I'd only discovered this shop by accident while continuing on my #6 bus which has been detoured while they fix Spear St.  Saw it through the windows but never stopped in.  One excessively stressful and hectic Thurs, I fled out for a late lunch at 4-something and was walking around, decided to see what 1 Market Plaza had now since I hadn't been inside for years now, found you can't walk through the lobby from Market to Mission (at least not right now while they too do some construction stuff in there) so had to walk allthewayaroundthewholebuilding and since that ticked me off so much, I decided now was the time to stop for a burger.  First, there is way too much on the wall menu to be able to figure out what to eat, I don't even think I got beyond the milkshake list.  Oh, there was no line and only maybe 5 tables of people already eating so I'd probably avoid this place at the high noon lunch hours when most offices let their peons out to feed.  I was lucky that the guy taking orders guided me very nicely through.  I'd have loved to have breakfast (love breakfast) but figured since I still had to go back to work and put in another 5 hours of work and then it's a 1.5 hour ride home, I needed more sustenance so a mini bacon & cheese burger (which is actually a regular sized burger with 1 patty--normal for a lot of us but I suppose in these days of supersizing everything, it may be considered a "mini") with the works, side of fries.  Those alone cost over $10 when you add on tax.  And I got some of their pickles.  My review:  burger was delicious, had that nice flavorful greasy that makes all the difference (yea, I noticed this years ago when my doctor said I needed to stop using 85% ground beef and buy the 95% instead, might be less saturated fat but the flavor also diminished; my solution is to buy the 85% but just eat it far less frequently, I mean, why bother eating if the food doesn't taste like anything).  It was just the right size for me too (I have no idea how much "bigger" a super burger is there but I'll see next time I go, even if I can't eat it all; it's nice to have enough money to experiment like this and I shall miss it when I retire).  Fries were delicious too and they don't give you too many, just enough.  Pickles were awful, too sweet or they tried to combine kosher with garlic  with sweet pickles and it just didn't work, flavors were conflicting so after one bite, I dumped the rest.  Next time I go (which may be tomorrow), I'm getting the bigger burger, fries, and a strawberry shake (I just want a sip or two, can't handle much more before my gut begins to churn but I just need to taste it, I'll give the rest to one of the boy at work).  And someday I'll stop in for eggs--I wonder if they'll put a fried egg on a burger (one of my favor eats, burger, egg, bacon, cheese; it's like the perfect breakfast sandwich).  This place is smack in an area that is basically populated by businesses; after hours and weekends it's REAL dead (who wants to be downtown on a weekend working if you can possibly avoid it) so I'm a bit impressed they even open on weekends.  Most eateries down that way tend to open at about 10:30a and close by 3p on a workday, don't bother opening on weekends at all.  I've had burgers at Ziggy's and Bistro Burger and Buckhorn and at the Hyatts and at a few other places and although most of them are good, Super Duper out does them all (must be the grease, grease is the word).
author: Kai T.

description: Chain-Schmain.  This is the best burger in town.  Nopa has a better bun, but the price, wait time factor gives Super Duper the edge.  The meat if fabulous and it is cooked to perfection.  Their fixins are plumb dandy, too.  I avoid chains for economic reasons, but I'm hooked on these burgers.  Better than:  Gotts, Panther Ranch (American Eatery), Spruce, Burger Bar and Mo's.  Plus, they have shakes.  I mean, come on!
author: Otto D.

description: Honestly, I thought it was pretty bad.  The fries were tasteless, I didn't even care to finish the small size.  The burger was beyond greasy, it was unappetizing.  I just really can't think of anything that was that great about any of it.  I guess I was fooled by the crazy lines that exist during lunch hours.  If you want a good burger and fries or that type of meal, I would suggest walking over to Gott's at the Ferry Building...WAY better!
author: L C.

description: The burgers are fresh and made with excellent beef from farms that have free range grass fed cattle.  The draft beer they have is a wonderful addition to any meal.  Fries were cooked perfectly and the bun was gourmet quality.  All this came at a very reasonable price.  I will be going here again very soon.
author: Joe M.

description: Lived in this area for about 3 months now and tonight- a Sunday night, just wanted something quick. Glad I did... It was really good. Ordered the mini burger with cheese, bacon, grilled onion and avocado. And to be clear, their mini burger is not small! Hubby got the super burger (which has 2 patties) with bacon and blue cheese. He absolutely loved it. We also ordered the garlic fries to share. I'm usually a little hesitant ordering this coz usually it's just too garlicky... But on the menu it said something about some aged cheese on it.. So I was sold... The cheese made it so good! Next time I'd want to try the milkshakes especially the fresh strawberry one. I'm giving it 4 stars because it's not necessarily the best burgers I've had but in this neighborhood... Nothing is ever open on weekends let alone a Sunday night. I took out a star coz I think it's pretty expensive for a semi-fast food chain... It's not a fancy place. It's no mcdonalds but it's also not a Hubert Keller burger bar. More like in & out but more expensive. For example their milkshakes start at $4+. But with that said, their burgers are good, they're a block from my place and their open on weekends... I'd come back!
author: Cherry S.
